DEF: A compound muscle action potential (CMAP) is a type of electromyography (EMG). CMAP refers to a group of almost simultaneous action potentials from several muscle fibers in the same area evoked by stimulation of the supplying motor nerve and are recorded as one multipeaked summated action potential. This abnormality refers to a greater than normal decrease in the amplitude during the course of the investigation.

ET: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
JT: 母指基節骨骨端の円錐骨端
DEF: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the thumb of the hand, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat. The related entity 'angel-shaped' epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of the phalanx. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

ET: Complete duplication of the proximal phalanges of the hand
JT: 指の基節骨の完全重複
DEF: A complete duplication affecting one or more of the proximal phalanges of the hand. As opposed to a partial duplication were there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones, a complete duplication leads to two separate bones appearing side to side (radio-ulnar axis) as seen on x-rays. A duplication leading to an accesory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, this is actually a different entity called a Pseudoepiphyses (see according terms) sometimes also referred to as Hyperphalangism.

ET: Congenitally corrected transposition of the great arteries
JT: 先天性修正大血管転位
DEF: The essence of the lesion is the combination of discordant atrioventricular and ventriculo-arterial connections. Thus, the morphologically right atrium is connected to a morphologically left ventricle across the mitral valve, with the left ventricle then connected to the pulmonary trunk. The morphologically left atrium is connected to the morphologically right ventricle across the tricuspid valve, with the morphologically right ventricle connected to the aorta.

ET: Abnormal axonemal organization of respiratory motile cilia

DEF: Abnormal arrangement of the structures of the axoneme, which is the cytoskeletal structure that forms the inner core of the motile cilium and displays a canonical 9 + 2 microtubular pattern of motile cilia studded with dynein arms.

JT: 母指基節骨の三角形骨端
DEF: A triangular appearance of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb of the hand. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

ET: Irregular epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
JT: 不規則な母指基節骨骨端
DEF: Irregular radiographic opacity of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

ET: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
JT: 母指末節骨骨端の円錐骨端
DEF: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb of the hand, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat. The related entity 'angel-shaped' epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of the phalanx.

ET: Complete duplication of the middle phalanges of the hand
JT: 指の中節骨の完全重複
DEF: A complete duplication affecting one or more of the middle phalanges of the hand. As opposed to a partial duplication were there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones, a complete duplication leads to two separate bones appearing side to side (radio-ulnar axis) as seen on x-rays. A duplication leading to an accessory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, this is actually a different entity called a pseudoepiphysis (see corresponding terms) sometimes also referred to as hyperphalangism.

ET: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
JT: 母指基節骨無形成/低形成
DEF: This term applies if the proximal phalanx of the thumb is either small/hypoplastic or absent. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

ET: Enlarged epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
JT: 母指基節骨の拡大した骨端
DEF: Abnormally large size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the proximal phalanx of the thumb with respect to age-dependent norms. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

ET: Triangular epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
JT: 母指末節骨の三角形骨端
DEF: A triangular appearance of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb of the hand. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat.

ET: Complete duplication of the phalanges of the 2nd finger
DEF: A complete duplication affecting one or more of the phalanges of the 2nd finger. As opposed to a partial duplication were there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones, a complete duplication leads to two separate bones appearing side to side (radio-ulnar axis) as seen on x-rays. A duplication leading to an accesory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, is a different entity called a Pseudoepiphyses (see according terms) sometimes also referred to as Hyperphalangism.

ET: Complete duplication of the phalanges of the 3rd finger

DEF: A complete duplication affecting one or more of the phalanges of the 3rd finger. As opposed to a partial duplication were there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones, a complete duplication leads to two separate bones appearing side to side (radio-ulnar axis) as seen on x-rays. A duplication leading to an accesory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, this is actually a different entity called a Pseudoepiphyses (see according terms) sometimes also referred to as Hyperphalangism.

ET: Complete duplication of the phalanges of the 4th finger

As opposed to a partial duplication were there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones, a complete duplication leads to two separate bones appearing side to side (radio-ulnar axis) as seen on x-rays. A duplication leading to an accesory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, this is actually a different entity called a Pseudoepiphyses (see according terms) sometimes also referred to as Hyperphalangism.

ET: Complete duplication of the phalanges of the 5th finger
DEF: A complete duplication affecting one or more of the phalanges of the 5th finger. As opposed to a partial duplication were there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones, a complete duplication leads to two separate bones appearing side to side (radio-ulnar axis) as seen on x-rays. A duplication leading to an accesory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, this is actually a different entity called a Pseudoepiphyses (see according terms) sometimes also referred to as Hyperphalangism.

ET: Partial duplication of the distal phalanges of the hand
DEF: A partial duplication, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance, affecting one or more of the distal phalanges of the hand. As opposed to a complete duplication there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones.

ET: Partial duplication of the middle phalanges of the hand
JT: 手の中節骨末節骨の部分重複
DEF: A partial duplication, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance, affecting one or more of the middle phalanges of the hand. As opposed to a complete duplication there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones.

DEF: A less than normal number of sternal ossification centers. The sternum is initially formed from bilateral sternal plates that chondrify and begin to fuse with ribs at 10 weeks gestational age. Ossification starts in the manubrium and upper part of the sternal body at the 6th month, in the middle of the sternal body at the 7th month, in the lower part of the body during the 1st postnatal year and in the xiphoid process between years 5 and 18. The number of ossification centers vary up to six, and it is the ossification centers that are visualized by prenatal ultrasound. This term describes a reduction in the number of ossification centers compared with age-related norms.

DEF: The term collodion baby applies to newborns who appear to have an extra layer of skin (known as a collodion membrane) that has a collodion-like quality. It is a descriptive term, not a specific diagnosis or disorder (as such, it is a syndrome). Affected babies are born in a collodion membrane, a shiny waxy outer layer to the skin. This is shed 10-14 days after birth, revealing the main symptom of the disease, extensive scaling of the skin caused by hyperkeratosis. With increasing age, the scaling tends to be concentrated around joints in areas such as the groin, the armpits, the inside of the elbow and the neck. The scales often tile the skin and may resemble fish scales.

ET: Duplication of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
DEF: Complete or partial duplication of the proximal phalanx of the thumb. Depending on the severity, the appearance on x-ray can vary from a notched phalanx (the duplicated bone is almost completely fused with the phalanx), a partially fused appearance of the two bones, or two separate bones appearing side to side. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

The secretion of hormones from the anterior pituitary is under the strict control of hypothalamic hormones, and the posterior pituitary is essentially an extension of the hypothalamus, so that hypothalamus and pituitary gland may be regarded as a functional unit.

DEF: An abnormality of somatosensory evoked potentials (SSEP), i.e., of the electrical signals of sensation going from the body to the brain in response to a defined stimulus. Recording electrodes are placed over the scalp, spine, and peripheral nerves proximal to the stimulation site. Clinical studies generally use electrical stimulation of peripheral nerves to elicit potentials. SSEP testing determines whether peripheral sensory nerves are able to transmit sensory information like pain, temperature, and touch to the brain. Abnormal SSEPs can result from dysfunction at the level of the peripheral nerve, plexus, spinal root, spinal cord, brain stem, thalamocortical projections, or primary somatosensory cortex.

DEF: Paralysis of voluntary muscles means loss of contraction due to interruption of one or more motor pathways from the brain to the muscle fibers. Although the word paralysis is often used interchangeably to mean either complete or partial loss of muscle strength, it is preferable to use paralysis or plegia for complete or severe loss of muscle strength, and paresis for partial or slight loss. Paralysis due to lesions of the principle motor tracts is related to a lesion in the corticospinal, corticobulbar or brainstem descending (subcorticospinal) neurons.

DEF: The term collodion baby applies to newborns who appear to have an extra layer of skin (known as a collodion membrane) that has a collodion-like quality. It is a descriptive term, not a specific diagnosis or disorder (as such, it is a syndrome). Affected babies are born in a collodion membrane, a shiny waxy outer layer to the skin. This is shed 10-14 days after birth, revealing the main symptom of the disease, extensive scaling of the skin caused by hyperkeratosis. With increasing age, the scaling tends to be concentrated around joints in areas such as the groin, the armpits, the inside of the elbow and the neck. The scales often tile the skin and may resemble fish scales.

DEF: A swan neck deformity describes a finger with a hyperextended PIP joint and a flexed DIP joint. The most common cause for a swan neck-like deformity is a disruption of the end of the extensor tendon. Conditions that loosen the PIP joint and allow it to hyperextend, for example conditions that weaken the volar plate, can produce a swan neck deformity of the finger. One example is rheumatoid arthritis. Another cause are conditions that tighten up the small (intrinsic) muscles of the hand and fingers, for example hand trauma or nerve disorders, such as cerebral palsy, Parkinson's disease, or stroke.

Periventricular means beside the ventricles. This is by far the most common location for heterotopia. Subependymal heterotopia present in a wide array of variations. There can be a small single node or a large number of nodes, can exist on either or both sides of the brain at any point along the higher ventricle margins, can be small or large, single or multiple, and can form a small node or a large wavy or curved mass.

This features results from a failure of regression of the hyaloid vessel, which supplies the primary vitreous during embryogenesis and normally regresses in the third trimester of pregnancy, leading to a particular form of posterior cataract.

A duplication leading to an accesory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, is a different entity called a Pseudoepiphyses (see according terms) sometimes also referred to as Hyperphalangism.

The normal epiphysis of the third metacarpal is localised at the distal end of the metacarpal bone. This term aplies if an accesory epiphysis, located at the proximal end of the metacarpal bone, is present.

The normal epiphysis of the fourth metacarpal is localised at the distal end of the metacarpal bone. This term aplies if an accesory epiphysis, located at the proximal end of the metacarpal bone, is present.

The normal epiphysis of the fifth metacarpal is localised at the distal end of the metacarpal bone. This term aplies if an accesory epiphysis, located at the proximal end of the metacarpal bone, is present.

DEF: Absence or underdevelopment of the palmar creases.

An abnormality of the morphology or counts of the cells that make up the immune system.
An abnormality of the cerebral subcortex.

JT: 視神経路無形成/低形成
歯エナメル質の限局性低形成
DEF: A localized form of developmental hypoplasia of the dental enamel.
Any abnormality of the morphology of the major calices or minor calices of the kidney.

An abnormality of the skin adnexa (skin appendages), which are specialized skin structures located within the dermis and focally within the subcutaneous fatty tissue, comprising three histologically distinct structures: (1) the pilosebaceous unit (hair follicle and sebaceous glands); (2) the eccrine sweat glands; and (3) the apocrine glands.

ET: EEG with generalized sharp slow waves
JT: 全般性棘徐波を伴う脳波
DEF: EEG with generalized sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec followed by a slow wave.

JT: 耳輪の不連続な上行基部

JT: 中枢性運動機能の異常
DEF: An anomaly of the control or production of movement in the central nervous system.
Cognitive, psychiatric or memory anomaly.
Hyposegmented (hypolobulated) or bilobed neutrophil nuclei.
Absence or underdevelopment of the gallbladder.

With left or right cardiac isomerism in a biventricular, the atrioventricular connections are perforce ambiguous, in that one of the connections is concordant (e.g., right-sided morphologic right atrium connected to a morphologic right ventricle) and one of the connections is discordant (e.g., left-sided morphologic right atrium connected to a morphologic left ventricle).

A specific combination of heart defects including a primum atrial septal defect and cleft anterior mitral valve leaflet. There is not an inlet ventricular septal defect present. There are two valve annuluses and two valve orifices.
Abnormal plane of direction of the heart from the base to the apex in the midline. Left sided is normal.
A ventricular septal defect that lies beneath the semilunar valve(s) in the conal or outlet septum.
Any ventricular septal defect (VSD) that is small enough to restrict flow across it such that a pressure gradient exists between the two sides of the VSD.

JT: 多源性多巣性心房頻拍

DEF: An abnormality of the adenohypophysis, which is also known as the anterior lobe of the pituitary gland.

JT: 下垂体成長ホルモン細胞腺腫

JT: 循環性フィブリノーゲンの異常

JT: 循環性クレアチニン値異常

An anomalous build up of iron (Fe) in the substantia nigra.
A lighter than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the thalamus. This term refers to a localized hyperintensity affecting a particular region of the thalamus.
Abnormality in the space in the meninges beneath the arachnoid membrane and above the pia mater that contains the cerebrospinal fluid.
A darker than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the brainstem. This term refers to a localized hypointensity affecting a particular region of the brainstem.

An anomaly in the process of intramembranous ossification by which flat bones (cranial bones of the skull, i.e., the frontal, parietal, occipital, and temporal bones, and the clavicles) are formed.
Underdevelopment of part or all of the female external reproductive organs (which include the mons pubis, labia majora, labia minora, Bartholin glands, and clitoris).

DEF: Any deviation from the normal concentration in the blood circulation of a hormone that is involved in the regulation of phosphate and calcium.

JT: 上腕骨橈骨関節の異常

DEF: An increased susceptibility to cutaneous abscess formation, as manifested by a medical history of recurrent cutaneous abscesses.
An abnormality of the Common bile duct, a tube-like anatomic structure in the human gastrointestinal tract, formed by the union of the Common hepatic duct and the Cystic duct from the gall bladder.
A type of vitreoretinal degeneration with manifestations that are concentrated at the periphery of the retina.
An abnormality of a frontalis muscle belly.
An abnormality of a central retinal artery.
Any structural anomaly of the glossopharyngeal nerve, the ninth paired cranial nerve (CN IX).

Abnormality of the paranasal (cranial) sinuses, which are air-filled spaces that are located within the bones of the skull and face and communicate with the nasal cavity. They comprise the maxillary sinuses, the frontal sinuses, the ethmoid sinuses, and the sphenoid sinuses.

ET: Globe retraction and deviation on abduction
JT: 外転による眼球後退と偏位

DEF: Initial bilateral ptosis followed by limitation of eye movements in all directions and slowing of saccades.

JT: 円滑的追跡眼球運動の異常
DEF: An abnormality of eye movement characterized by impaired smooth-pursuit eye movements.

JT: 円滑的追跡眼球運動の異常
DEF: An abnormality of eye movement characterized by impaired smooth-pursuit eye movements.

JT: 測定障害性断続性眼球運動
DEF: The controller signal for saccadic eye movements has two components: the pulse that moves the eye rapidly from one point to the next, and the step that holds the eye in the new position. When both the pulse and the step are not the correct size, a dysmetric refixation eye movement results.

JT: フロンタルリリースサイン
DEF: Primitive reflexes traditionally held to be a sign of disorders that affect the frontal lobes.

JT: 高い認知能をもつ自閉症
非言語的行動使用での障害
DEF: Reduced ability to use nonverbal behavior for communication, such as eye-to-eye gaze, facial expression, body posture, and gestures.

JT: 高インスリン血症性低血糖
DEF: An increased concentration of insulin combined with a decreased concentration of glucose in the blood.
An abnormality of the parathyroid gland.

JT: レニン-アンギオテンシン系活動亢進
DEF: An abnormally increased activity of the renin-angiotensin system, causing hypertension by a combination of volume excess and vasoconstrictor mechanisms.

JT: 二次性副甲状腺機能亢進症
DEF: Secondary hyperparathyroidism refers to the production of higher than normal levels of parathyroid hormone in the presence of hypocalcemia.
Pectus excavatum (defect of the chest wall characterized by depression of the sternum) affecting primarily the inferior region of the sternum.

JT: 柔らかいパン生地様の皮膚
DEF: A skin texture that is unusually soft (and may feel silky), and has a malleable consistency resembling that of dough.

JT: アルコール摂取後お顔面紅潮
半盲性視力障害(視朦;霧視)
DEF: Transient blurring of vision associated with the aura phase of migraine.

JT: 脈絡膜網膜ジストロフィー
格子性角膜ジストロフィー
DEF: The presence of fine, branching linear opacities in Bowman's layer in the central area that may spread to the periphery in the clinical course. The deep corneal stroma may be involved but the process does not reach Descemet's membrane. Recurrent corneal erosion may occur. Histologic examination reveals amyloid deposits in the collagen fibers of the cornea.

JT: サッカード性滑らかな追視
DEF: An abnormality of tracking eye movements in which smooth pursuit is interrupted by an abnormally high number of saccadic movements.
Ossification of carpal bones occurs later than age-adjusted norms.

JT: 慢性感覚神経性ポリニューロパチー
原発性副腎皮質機能亢進症
DEF: Hypercortisolemia associated with a primary defect of the adrenal gland leading to overproduction of cortisol.

ET: obsolete Rhythm disturbances associated with pheochromocytoma
JT: 褐色細胞腫に伴う律動障害

DEF: A type of subvalvular aortic stenosis resulting from thickening of the musculature of the interventricular septum, which results in obstruction to blood flow through the left-ventricular outflow tract.
An obstruction to the forward flow of blood in the outflow tract of the right ventricle.

JT: 高拍出性うっ血性心不全
DEF: A form of heart failure characterized by elevated cardiac output. This may be seen in patients with heart failure and hyperthyroidism, anemia, pregnancy, arteriovenous fistulae, and others.

JT: 非球状赤血球性溶血性貧血
アンモニア中毒エピソード
糖尿病性ケトアシドーシス
DEF: A type of diabetic metabolic abnormality with an accumulation of ketone bodies.

JT: 近位腎尿細管アシドーシス
DEF: A type of renal tubular acidosis characterized by a failure of the proximal tubular cells to reabsorb bicarbonate, leading to urinary bicarbonate wasting and subsequent acidemia.

JT: 全身性ミオクローヌス発作
DEF: A generalized myoclonic seizure is a type of generalized motor seizure characterised by bilateral, sudden, brief (<100 ms) involuntary single or multiple contraction of muscles or muscle groups of variable topography (axial, proximal limb, distal). Myoclonus is less regularly repetitive and less sustained than is clonus.

ET: Melanin pigment aggregation in hair shafts
JT: 毛髪軸のメラニン色素集簇

DEF: An anomaly of the vermis of cerebellum.

JT: 下部運動ニューロンの異常
DEF: Any structural anomaly of the lower motor neuron.

JT: 傍神経節腫関連脳神経麻痺

ET: Neuronal loss in central nervous system
JT: 中枢神経のニューロン喪失

ET: Right aortic arch with mirror image branching
JT: 鏡像分枝を伴う右大動脈弓
DEF: The aortic arch crosses the right mainstem bronchus and not the left mainstem bronchus, but does not result in the creation of a vascular ring. The first branch is the left brachiocephalic artery which divides into the left carotid artery and left subclavian artery, the second branch is the right carotid artery, the third branch is the right subclavian artery.

JT: リンパ球アポトーシス障害
DEF: A reduction in the rate of apoptosis in lymphocytes.

JT: 反復性クレブシエラ感染症
DEF: Increased susceptibility to Klebsiella infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of Klebsiella infection.

JT: 特異的抗多糖類抗体欠乏症
DEF: The presence of normal overall immunoglobulin levels with deficiency of specific immunoglobulins directed against bacterial polysaccharides.

JT: 肝トランスアミナーゼ上昇
DEF: Elevations of the levels of SGOT and SGPT in the serum. SGOT (serum glutamic oxaloacetic transaminase) and SGPT (serum glutamic pyruvic transaminase) are transaminases primarily found in the liver and heart and are released into the bloodstream as the result of liver or heart damage. SGOT and SGPT are used clinically mainly as markers of liver damage.

JT: 甲状腺刺激ホルモン過剰症
DEF: Overproduction of thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH) by the anterior pituitary gland.

JT: 甲状腺ホルモン受容体障害
DEF: Reduced sensitivity of end organs to thyroid hormone characterized by elevated serum levels of free thyroid hormone with nonsuppressed thyroid stimulating hormone.
Congenital absence of a part of the vermis of cerebellum.

JT: 異常ガンマグロブリン血症
DEF: Selective deficiency of one or more, but not all, classes of immunoglobulins.

ET: Bowing of limbs due to multiple fractures
JT: 多発性骨折による四肢湾曲
DEF: Curvature of the shafts of the long bones due to multiple fractures.

JT: コレステロール代謝の異常
DEF: Any deviation from the normal concentration of cholesterol in the blood circulation.

JT: 鉄ホメオスターシスの異常
DEF: Abnormality of the homeostasis (concentration) of a monoatomic ion.

JT: 循環性コルチゾール値増加
DEF: Overproduction of the hormone of cortisol by the adrenal cortex, resulting in a characteristic combination of clinical symptoms termed Cushing syndrome, with truncal obesity, a round, full face, striae atrophicae and acne, muscle weakness, and other features.

JT: 循環性コルチゾール値増加
DEF: Overproduction of the hormone of cortisol by the adrenal cortex, resulting in a characteristic combination of clinical symptoms termed Cushing syndrome, with truncal obesity, a round, full face, striae atrophicae and acne, muscle weakness, and other features.

JT: 汎低ガンマグロブリン血症
DEF: A reduction in the circulating levels of all the major classes of immunoglobulin. is characterized by profound decreases in all classes of immunoglobulin with an absence of circulating B lymphocytes.

ET: Increased cellular sensitivity to UV light

DEF: An increased concentration of phosphoethanolamine in the urine.

JT: ミトコンドリア代謝の異常
DEF: A functional anomaly of mitochondria.

JT: 一次骨幹端海綿体欠損
循環性カテコラミン値上昇
DEF: An abnormal increase in catecholamine concentration in the blood.

JT: プロトロンビン消費の減少
DEF: The prothrombin consumption test measures the formation of intrinsic thromboplastin by determining the residual serum prothrombin after blood clotting is complete. If there is a defect in the process, less prothrombin will be converted to thrombin than normal (less prothrombin is consumed). This test may be abnormal with conditions including deficiency of factors VIII or IX, with circulating anticoagulants, thrombocytopenia.

JT: 尿中ノルエピネフリン上昇
DEF: An increased concentration of noradrenaline in the urine.

JT: コレステロールエステル化率低下
DEF: A reduction in the rate of cholesterol esterification.
An abnormality of amino acid metabolism characterized by a decreased level of propionyl-CoA carboxylase.

ET: Decreased number of peripheral myelinated nerve fibers
JT: 末梢有髄神経線維数の減少
DEF: A loss of myelinated nerve fibers in the peripheral nervous system (in general, this finding can be observed on nerve biopsy).

JT: 感覚性軸索ニューロパチー
DEF: An axonal neuropathy of peripheral sensory nerves.

JT: 不規則な近位大腿骨骨幹端

JT: 感覚失調性ニューロパチー
高プロスタグランディン尿
DEF: An increased concentration of prostaglandin in the urine.

JT: アセトアルデヒド酸化遅延
DEF: Decreased level of acetaldehyde dehydrogenase (ADH). ADH and alcohol dehydrogenase (ALDH) are the primary enzymes involved in alcohol metabolism.

ET: Foam cells with lamellar inclusion bodies
JT: 層状封入体を伴う泡沫細胞
DEF: The presence of foam cells that contain lamellar inclusion bodies.
The presence of circulating autoantibodies to phospholipids.

JT: 多発性ミトコンドリアDN欠失
DEF: The presence of multiple deletions of mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA).

JT: 出生時からの全身性筋肉質
エンテロウイルス性皮膚筋炎症候群

JT: ミオクローヌス性スパスム
代謝滴に活性のある脂肪組織のほぼ完全な欠損(皮下,腹内,胸内)
DEF: An abnormally reduced amount of adipose tissue in the thoracic cavity.

ET: Cupped metaphyses of the upper limbs

DEF: An anomaly of the humeral epiphysis.

ET: Irregular ossification of the humeral epiphyses

DEF: The term Maturity-onset diabetes of the young (MODY) was initially used for patients diagnosed with fasting hyperglycemia that could be treated without insulin for more than two years, where the initial diagnosis was made at a young age (under 25 years). Thus, MODY combines characteristics of type 1 diabetes (young age at diagnosis) and type 2 diabetes (less insulin dependence than type 1 diabetes). The term MODY is now most often used to refer to a group of monogenic diseases with these characteristics. Here, the term is used to describe hyperglycemia diagnosed at a young age with no or minor insulin dependency, no evidence of insulin resistence, and lack of evidence of autoimmune destruction of the beta cells.

DEF: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the thumb of the hand, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat. The related entity 'angel-shaped' epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of the phalanx. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

ET: Enlarged epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
JT: 母指基節骨の拡大した骨端
DEF: Abnormally large size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the proximal phalanx of the thumb with respect to age-dependent norms. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

ET: Bracket epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
JT: 母指末節骨骨端ブラケット
DEF: An abnormality of the distal phalanx of the thumb in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.

ET: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
JT: 母指末節骨骨端の円錐骨端
DEF: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb of the hand, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat. The related entity 'angel-shaped' epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of the phalanx.

ET: Enlarged epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
JT: 母指末節骨の拡大した骨端
DEF: Abnormally large size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the distal phalanx of the thumb with respect to age-dependent norms.

ET: Osteolytic defects of the hand bones
Abnormality of the spinal dura mater
DEF: An abnormality of the spinal dura mater, which is the outermost of the three layers of the meninges surrounding the spinal cord.

JT: 大腿四頭筋無形成/低形成
DEF: Absence or underdevelopment of the quadriceps muscle.

JT: 甲状腺機能正常性甲状腺腫
DEF: A goiter that is not associated with functional thyroid abnormalities.

ET: Aplasia of the phalanges of the hand
DEF: Absence of one or more of the phalanges of the hand.
An anomaly of one or more metaphyses of the arms.

ET: Osteolytic defects of the distal phalanges of the hand
JT: 手の末節骨のの骨融解病変

ET: Broad proximal phalanges of the hand
DEF: Increased width of the proximal phalanges of the finger.

ET: Symphalangism affecting the proximal phalanges of the hand
JT: 手基節骨の指趾関節癒合症

ET: Cerebellar ataxia associated with quadrupedal gait
JT: 四つ足歩行を伴う小脳失調
DEF: The presence of cerebellar signs and symptoms such as lack of balance associated with quadrupedal gait (locomotion on all four extremities with a 'bear-like' gait with the legs held straight).

Abnormality of the growth of secondary sexual hair, which normally ensues during puberty. In males, secondary sexual hair usually comprises body hair, including underarm, abdominal, chest, and pubic hair. In females, secondary sexual hair usually comprises a lesser degree of body hair, most prominently underarm and pubic hair.

ET: Abnormality of the crus of the helix
DEF: An abnormality of the crus of the helix, which is the horizontal piece of cartilage located outside the ear canal that divides the upper and lower parts of the ear.

A partial duplication, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance, affecting one or more of the phalanges of the thumb. As opposed to a complete duplication there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones.

This term applies if one or more of the phalanges of the 2nd finger are either partially duplicated, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance of the phalanges, or completely duplicated.

This term applies if one or more of the phalanges of the 3rd finger are either partially duplicated, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance of the phalanges, or completely duplicated.

This term applies if one or more of the phalanges of the 4th finger are either partially duplicated, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance of the phalanges, or completely duplicated.

This term applies if one or more of the phalanges of the 5th finger are either partially duplicated, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance of the phalanges, or completely duplicated.

ET: Symphalangism affecting the distal phalanx of the hallux
JT: 母趾末節骨の趾関節癒合症

ET: Broad proximal phalanx of the hallux
DEF: Increased width of proximal phalanx of big toe.

ET: Symphalangism affecting the proximal phalanx of the hallux
JT: 母趾基節骨の趾関節癒合症

ET: Bracket epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
JT: 母趾基節骨骨端ブラケット
DEF: The epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the hallux surrounds the diaphysis, having a bracket-like form.

ET: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
JT: 母趾基節骨骨端の円錐骨端

ET: Enlarged epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
JT: 母趾基節骨の拡大した骨端

ET: Bracket epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the hallux
JT: 母趾末節骨骨端ブラケット
DEF: The epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the hallux surrounds the diaphysis, having a bracket-like form.

ET: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the hallux
JT: 母趾末節骨骨端の円錐骨端

ET: Enlarged epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the hallux
JT: 母趾末節骨の拡大した骨端
趾の骨端のブラケット骨端

ET: Duplication of distal phalanx of toe
DEF: A partial or complete duplication of one or more distal phalanx of toe.

ET: Duplication of middle phalanx of toe
DEF: Partial or complete duplication of a middle phalanx of toe.

ET: Bracket epiphyses of the distal phalanges of the hand
JT: 指末節骨のブラケット骨端
DEF: An abnormality of the distal phalanges of the hand in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.

ET: Enlarged epiphyses of the distal phalanges of the hand
JT: 指の末節骨の拡大した骨端

ET: Bracket epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand
JT: 指中節骨のブラケット骨端
DEF: An abnormality of the middle phalanges of the hand in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.

ET: Enlarged epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand
JT: 指の中節骨の拡大した骨端

ET: Bracket epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand
JT: 指基節骨のブラケット骨端
DEF: An abnormality of the proximal phalanges of the hand in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.

ET: Enlarged epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand
JT: 指の基節骨の拡大した骨端

DEF: Any abnormality of the sublingual glands, which are the salivary glands that are located beneath the floor of the mouth anterior to the submandibular glands.

ET: Curved middle phalanx of the 2nd toe
DEF: A deviation from the normal straight form of the middle phalanx of the 2nd toe.

ET: Curved distal phalanx of the 2nd toe
DEF: A deviation from the normal straight form of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe.

ET: Absent distal phalanx of the 2nd toe
DEF: Absence of distal phalanx of the second toe as a result of developmental aplasia.

ET: Weakness due to upper motor neuron dysfunction
JT: 主要運動路病変による麻痺
DEF: Paralysis of voluntary muscles means loss of contraction due to interruption of one or more motor pathways from the brain to the muscle fibers. Although the word paralysis is often used interchangeably to mean either complete or partial loss of muscle strength, it is preferable to use paralysis or plegia for complete or severe loss of muscle strength, and paresis for partial or slight loss. Paralysis due to lesions of the principle motor tracts is related to a lesion in the corticospinal, corticobulbar or brainstem descending (subcorticospinal) neurons.
This term applies if the Epiglottis is absent or hypoplastic.

JT: 母体血清αフェトプロテイン低値
DEF: An abnormally low concentration of serum alpha-fetoprotein as compared to normal values for gestational-age.

ET: Patchy reduction of bone mineral density
JT: 骨ミネラル濃度の斑状減少
DEF: Patchy (irregular) reduction in bone density. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.

ET: Patchy changes of bone mineral density
JT: 骨ミネラル濃度の斑状変化
DEF: Patchy (irregular) changes in bone mineral density. These changes can either be patchy reduction or increase of mineral density as seen on x-rays. Depending on the pathomechanism and the underlying disease, these changes can either appear solely as reduction or increase or as a combination of both (patches of bone showing an increased density while others are affected by reduction of mineral density).

ET: Fusion of the left and right thalami
DEF: A developmental defect characterized by fusion of the left and right halves of the thalamus.

ET: Aplasia of the phalanges of the toes
DEF: Absence of a digit or of one or more phalanges of a toe.

JT: 前上顎骨の無形成/低形成
DEF: Absence or underdevelopment of the premaxilla.
The presence of a cyst, fistula, or abscess in the sacrococcygeal region (gluteal crease) characteristically accompanied by hair and skin folds.

JT: 銅ホメオスターシスの異常
DEF: An abnormal concentration of copper.

JT: 血清セルロプラスミン減少
DEF: Decreased concentration of ceruloplasmin in the blood.

JT: 焦点性徐波活動を伴う脳波
DEF: Focal (localized) slow activity reflects focal dysfunction, not diffuse dysfunction (i.e., encephalopathy).

JT: 多焦点性徐活動を伴う脳波
DEF: Multifocal slowing of cerebral electrical activity recorded along the scalp by electroencephalography (EEG).

JT: 群発‐抑制交代を伴う脳波
DEF: The burst suppression pattern in electroencephalography refers to a characteristic periodic pattern of low voltage (<10 microvolts) suppressed background and a relatively shorter pattern of higher amplitude slow, sharp, and spiking complexes.

JT: メチオニン代謝の異常
DEF: Any deviation from the normal concentration of methionine in the blood circulation.

JT: イソロイシン代謝の異常
DEF: Any deviation from the normal concentration of isoleucine in the blood circulation.

JT: ホモシステイン代謝の異常
DEF: An abnormality of a homocysteine metabolic process.
An abnormality of a nucleobase metabolic process.
Absence or underdevelopment of the nasal bone.

ET: Congenital cystic adenomatoid malformation of the lung
JT: 肺の先天性嚢胞腺腫様奇形
DEF: Congenital cystic adenomatoid malformation (CCAM) can be diagnosed prenatally if ultrasound shows a cystic or solid lung tumor. A CCAM does not have systemic arterial blood supply (in contrast to bronchopulmonary sequenstration). It is a cystic area within the lung that originates from abnormal embryogenesis.

ET: Absence of stomach bubble on fetal sonography
JT: 胎児エコーでの胃気泡欠損
DEF: By the 14th week of gestation it is nearly always possible to visualized the fluid-filled fetal stomach bubble on prenatal sonography. This term refers to the absence of a normal fetal stomach bubble on fetal ultrasonography performed at around 16 to 20 weeks' gestation.

JT: 脂肪酸陰イオン代謝の異常
DEF: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a fatty acid anion in the blood circulation.
An abnormality of glycolipid metabolism.

JT: 外因系凝固経路の異常
DEF: An abnormality of the extrinsic pathway (also known as the tissue factor pathway) of the coagulation cascade.

JT: 内因系凝固経路の異常
DEF: An abnormality of the intrinsic pathway (also known as the contact activation pathway) of the coagulation cascade.

JT: モノカルボン酸代謝の異常
DEF: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a monocarboxylic acid in the blood circulation.

JT: 鉄ホメオスターシスの異常
DEF: An abnormality of the homeostasis (concentration) of iron cation.

JT: カリウムホメオスターシスの異常
DEF: An abnormal concentration of potassium.

JT: 血清サイトカイン値の異常
DEF: Abnormality of the cytokine levels in the blood, i.e., an abnormality of any of the non-antibody proteins made by inflammatory leukocytes and some non-leukocytic cells that affect the behavior of other cells.

JT: インターロイキン分泌の異常
DEF: An abnormality in the production or cellular release of interleukins (a class of cytokines).
The presence of inflammation of the skin. That is, an abnormality of the skin resulting from the local accumulation of fluid, plasma proteins, and leukocytes.

JT: 特別な特徴をもつ欠神発作
ミオクローヌス性欠伸発作
DEF: Myoclonic absence seizure is a type of generalized non-motor (absence) seizure characterised by an interruption of ongoing activities, a blank stare and rhythmic three-per-second myoclonic movements, causing ratcheting abduction of the upper limbs leading to progressive arm elevation, and associated with 3 Hz generalized spike-wave discharges on the electroencephalogram. Duration is typically 10-60 s. Whilst impairment of consciousness may not be obvious the ILAE classified this seizure as a generalized non-motor seizure in 2017.

JT: 異常に徐波頻度の多い脳波
DEF: EEG with abnormally slow frequencies.

JT: 異常に徐波頻度の多い脳波
DEF: EEG with abnormally slow frequencies.

JT: 連続性徐波活動を伴う脳波
DEF: EEG showing diffuse slowing without interruption.

ET: Abnormal shape of the frontal region
DEF: An abnormal shape of the frontal part of the head.
Increased protrusion of the inferior crus relative to the prominence of the antihelix stem.
Increased protrusion of the superior crus relative to the prominence of a normal antihelix stem.

ET: Crus of helix connected to antihelix
JT: 対耳輪に連結した耳輪脚
DEF: Extension of the ridge of the crus helix across the ear and connection of the crus to the antihelix.

JT: 尿中カテコラミン濃度異常
DEF: An abnormal level of urinary catecholamine concentration.

JT: 短節性無神経節性巨大結腸
DEF: A type of aganglionic megacolon in which the aganglionic segment does not extend beyond the upper sigmoid.

JT: 多発性頭蓋骨縫合早期癒合
DEF: Craniosynostosis involving at least 2 cranial sutures, where the exact pattern of sutures fused has not been precisely specified.

JT: 軽度の理解できる言語遅滞
DEF: A mild delay in the acquisition of the ability to understand the speech of others.

JT: 重度の理解できる言語遅滞
DEF: A severe delay in the acquisition of the ability to understand the speech of others.
Reduced pigmentation of hair diffusely.
Underdevelopment of the semicircular canal.
An abnormality of the medulla oblongata, the lower half of the brainstem.
A lack of intestinal ganglion cells (i.e., an aganglionic section of bowel) affecting the small intestine.
The appearance of yellow/white crystalline-like (hence the name) spots in the retina and thickening of the peripheral part of the vitreous.
An abnormality of the circulatory connection between atria and ventricles.
A developmental defect of the pericardium with congenital onset.

JT: 部分的横隔膜側心外膜欠損
DEF: Lack of a part of the pericardium over the diaphragmatic surface of the heart. It is a congenital defect, not the result of a pericardectomy. Pericardium is present on other parts of the heart.
Narrowing or constriction of the aorta localized at the insertion of the ductus arteriosus, i.e., to the juxtaductal region of aortic arch.

ET: Supraventricular tachycardia with a concealed accessory connection
JT: 副伝導路を伴う上室性頻拍
DEF: Supraventricular tachycardia with an accessory connection mediated pathway that is called concealed becasue it is not seen on the ECG during sinus rhythm.

An intermittent atrioventricular block with failure of some atrial impulses to conduct to the ventricles, i.e., some but not all atrial impulses are conducted through the atrioventricular node and trigger ventricular contraction.

JT: 循環性コルチゾール値異常
DEF: An abnormality of the concentration of cortisol in the blood.

JT: 原発性高アルドステロン症
DEF: A form of hyperaldosteronism caused by a defect within the adrenal gland.

JT: 二次性高アルドステロン症
DEF: A form of hyperaldosteronism caused by abnormally increased renin levels.

JT: 二次性副腎皮質機能亢進症
DEF: Hypercortisolemia associated with a overproduction of ACTH (often from a tumor), leading secondarily to overproduction of cortisol.

JT: 非分泌性副腎皮質腺腫
DEF: An hormonally inactive adrenocortical adenoma, that is, an adenoma that does not secrete excessive amounts of adrenal hormones.

JT: 副腎皮質刺激ホルモン過剰
DEF: Overproduction of adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH), which generally leads secondarily to overproduction of cortisol by the adrenal cortex.

JT: 三次性副甲状腺機能亢進症
DEF: A type of hyperparathyroidism that occurs following kidney transplantation, which is a treatment for secondary hyperparathyroidism. Although kidney transplantation leads to a normalization of serum calcium and parathyroid hormone in most patients. The state of persistent hypercalcemia and hyperparathyroidism is referred to as tertiary hyperparathyroidism.

JT: 解剖学的位置による新生物
DEF: Neoplasm categorized according to the anatomical site of origin of the neoplasm.

JT: 骨コラーゲン線維形態異常
DEF: Any structural anomaly of the connective tissue bundles in the extracellular matrix of bone tissue that are composed of collagen, and play a role in tissue strength and elasticity.

ET: Abnormality of the wing of the ilium
DEF: An anomaly of the ilium ala. This is the large expanded portion of the ilum which bounds the greater pelvis laterally.

JT: ヘパリン誘発性血小板減少
DEF: Low platelet count following administration of unfractionated or (less commonly) low-molecular weight heparin.

ET: Anemia due to reduced life span of red cells
JT: 赤血球寿命減少による貧血
DEF: A type of anemia related to a reduction in the average life span of red blood cells in the peripheral circulation, which is normally around 120 days.

JT: 異常フィブリノーゲン血症
DEF: Qualitatively abnormal fibrinogen.

JT: シトルリン代謝の異常
DEF: Any deviation from the normal concentration of citrulline in the blood circulation.
A functional abnormality of neutrophils.
An abnormal form or size of neutrophils.

ET: EEG with central focal spike waves
JT: 中心焦点性棘波を伴う脳波
DEF: EEG with focal sharp transient waves in the central region, i.e., focal sharp waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave.

ET: EEG with occipital focal spike waves
JT: 後頭焦点性棘波を伴う脳波
DEF: EEG with focal sharp transient waves in the occipital region, i.e., focal sharp waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave.

ET: EEG with occipital focal spike waves
JT: 後頭焦点性棘波を伴う脳波
DEF: EEG with focal sharp transient waves in the occipital region, i.e., focal sharp waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave.

ET: EEG with parietal focal spike waves
JT: 頭頂焦点性棘波を伴う脳波
DEF: EEG with focal sharp transient waves in the parietal region, i.e., focal sharp waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave.

ET: EEG with temporal focal spike waves
JT: 側頭焦点性棘波を伴う脳波
DEF: EEG with focal sharp transient waves in the temporal region, i.e., focal sharp waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave.

JT: 中心焦点性棘波を伴う脳波
DEF: EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec in the central region.

JT: 後頭焦点性棘波を伴う脳波
DEF: EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec in the occipital region.

JT: 頭頂焦点性棘波を伴う脳波
DEF: EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec in the parietal region.

JT: 側頭焦点性棘波を伴う脳波
DEF: EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec in the temporal region.

JT: 尿中アシルグリシンのプロフィール異常
DEF: An abnormal distribution of N-acylglycines in the urine. There are numerous different N-acylglycines, and this term refers to pathological alterations in their level or distribution.

JT: ユビキチン陽性大脳封入体
DEF: Nuclear or cytoplasmic aggregates that show positive staining with antibodies against ubiquitin within cells of the brain.

JT: ミトコンドリアの形の異常
DEF: An anomaly in the surface contour of mitochondria.

JT: 循環性カテコラミン値異常
DEF: An abnormal catecholamine concentration in the blood.

JT: 循環性クレアチニン値異常
DEF: An abnormal concentration of creatinine in the blood.
Decreased quantity or activity of von Willebrand factor. Von Willebrand factor mediates the adhesion of platelets to the collagen exposed on endothelial cell surfaces.

JT: ナチュラルキラー細胞活性の減少
DEF: Reduced ability of the natural killer cell to function in the adaptive immune response.

JT: プロトロンビン活性の減少

DEF: An abnormal reduction in the volume of fluid filtered out of plasma through glomerular capillary walls into Bowman's capsules per unit of time.
An abnormal rise in the volume of water filtered out of plasma through glomerular capillary walls into Bowman's capsules per unit of time.

JT: 肩甲上神経の絞扼神経障害
DEF: An entrapment neuropathy of the suprascapular nerve, presenting with shoulder weakness confined to the supraspinatus muscle (this muscle initiates shoulder abduction) or to the infraspinatus (this muscle externally rotates the arm), as well as with pain in the posterior part of the shoulder and upper periscapular region.
Atrophy of the levator palpebrae superioris, the extraocular muscle that elevates the superior eyelid.

ET: Abnormal axonemal organization of respiratory motile cilia
JT: 運動性繊毛の軸糸構築異常
DEF: Abnormal arrangement of the structures of the axoneme, which is the cytoskeletal structure that forms the inner core of the motile cilium and displays a canonical 9 + 2 microtubular pattern of motile cilia studded with dynein arms.

JT: 安静時エネルギー消費の増加
DEF: An increase in the number of calories used per unit time.

JT: 安静時エネルギー消費の減少
DEF: A reduction in the number of calories used per unit time.

JT: マイクロプロラクチノーマ
DEF: A pituitary prolactin cell adenoma of less than 10 mm diameter.

JT: 尿中クエン酸濃度異常
DEF: A deviation from normal of the concentration of citrate(3-) in the urine.
Coronary disease that has not progressed to the point of causing significant occlusion (blockage) of the coronary arteries.
A reduced concentration of 5-methyltetrahydrofolate(2-) in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF). 5-methyltetrahydrofolate is the active folate metabolite.

JT: 片側性手関節屈曲拘縮
DEF: A chronic loss of wrist joint motion on one side only.

JT: 中サイズ動脈の中膜石灰化
DEF: Calcification, that is, pathological deposition of calcium salts in the tunica media of medium-sized (muscular or distributive) arteries.

JT: トランスフェリン飽和上昇
DEF: An above normal level of saturation of serum transferrin with iron.

JT: 特異的肺炎球菌抗体欠乏症
DEF: The presence of normal overall immunoglobulin levels with deficiency of specific immunoglobulins directed against pneumococci.

JT: 表面結合性開放管系の異常
DEF: An anomaly of the invaginations of the surface membrane that form the open canalicular system (OCS). The OCS serve as the pathway for transport of substances into the cells and as conduits for the discharge of alpha granule products secreted during the platelet release reaction.
A decrease in the maximum amount of negative pressure a person can generate during an inhalation.
Reduced strength of the orbicularis oculi, the circumorbital muscle in the face that closes the eyelid.
Muscle fibers degeneration resulting in fatty replacement of skeletal muscle fibers

JT: ステロイド抵抗性ネフローゼ症候群
DEF: A form of nephrotic syndrome that does not respond to treatment with steroid medication.

JT: 多剤耐性ネフローゼ症候群
DEF: A form of nephrotic syndrome that does not respond to any immunosuppresive treatment.

JT: 尿中マグネシウム濃度異常
DEF: An abnormal concentration of magnesium the urine.
A deviation from the norm of the intracranial pressure.

JT: 異常な中枢神経ドパミン値
DEF: Abnormal concentration of dopamine in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

JT: FDGPETでの前前頭葉代謝低下
DEF: Reduced uptake of [18F]-fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) in the prefrontal cortex as measured by positron emission tomography (PET) brain scan.

JT: FDGPETでの前前頭葉代謝低下
DEF: Reduced uptake of [18F]-fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) in the prefrontal cortex as measured by positron emission tomography (PET) brain scan.

JT: FDGPETでの視床下部代謝低下
DEF: Reduced uptake of [18F]-fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) in the hypothalamus as measured by positron emission tomography (PET) brain scan.
A medium reduction in the fraction of blood pumped from the left ventricle with each cardiac cycle.
An abnormal build up of iron (Fe) in the globus pallidus.
A darker than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the thalamus. This term refers to a localized hypointensity affecting a particular region of the thalamus.

JT: 異常な視床MRIシグナル強度
DEF: A deviation from normal signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the thalamus.

ET: Abnormal metabolic brain imaging by MRS
JT: MRSでの異常な代謝性脳画像
DEF: An anomaly of metabolism in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).
A severe form of conductive hearing impairment.

JT: 低カリウム血症エピソード
DEF: An abnormally decreased potassium concentration in the blood occurring periodically with a return to normal between the episodes.

JT: 異常な脳幹MRIシグナル強度
DEF: A deviation from normal signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the brainstem.

ET: Reduced upper to lower segment ratio
DEF: Decreased ratio between the upper and the lower segment of the body, where the lower segment is defined as the length between the top of pubic symphysis to floor, and the upper segment is defined as the top of head to top of pubic symphysis. Consider the term Disproportionate tall stature (HP:0001519) if tall stature is also present.

JT: 両室性緻密化障害性心筋症
DEF: Noncompaction cardiomyopathy that affects both ventricles.

JT: 一側性OR一側OR片側性OR片側
DEF: Being present on only the left or only the right side of the body.

JT: 遠位OR遠心性OR末端OR遠位性
DEF: Localized away from the central point of the body.

JT: 異所性副甲状腺甲状腺組織

Third-degree atrioventricular (AV) block (also referred to as complete heart block) is the complete dissociation of the atria and the ventricles. Third-degree AV block exists when more P waves than QRS complexes exist and no relationship (no conduction) exists between them.
Abnormalities of the metatarsal bones (i.e. of five tubular bones located between the tarsal bones of the hind- and mid-foot and the phalanges of the toes).
An abnormality of the viscera of the abdomen.
A structural abnormality of the esophagus.
Inflammation, or an inflammatory state in the large intestine.
Defective development of the vermis of cerebellum.
An anomaly of the brainstem.
An anomalous configuration of blood vessels that shunts arterial blood directly into veins without passing through the capillaries and that is located in the brain.

The presence of an abnormal shape of the calvaria (skullcap), that is, of that part of the skull that is made up of the superior portions of the frontal bone, occipital bone, and parietal bones and covers the cranial cavity that contains the brain.
Any abnormality of bones of the arms or legs.

ET: Protuberances at ends of long bones
DEF: The presence of multiple protuberances (bulges, or knobs) at the ends of the long bones.
A type of chromosomal aberration characterised by reduced resistance of chromosomes to change or deterioration.
Abnormality of the dens of the axis, which is also known as the odontoid process.

JT: 橈骨骨端の内側扁平化
骨ミネラル濃度の異常
DEF: This term applies to all changes in bone mineral density which (depending on severity) can be seen on x-rays as a change in density and or structure of the bone. Changes may affect all bones of the organism, just certain bones or only parts of bones and include decreased mineralisation as may be seen in osteoporosis or increased mineralisation and or ossification as in osteopetrosis, exostoses or any kind of atopic calicfications of different origin and distribution. The overall amount of mineralization of the bone-organ can be measured as the amount of matter per cubic centimeter of bones, usually measured by densitometry of the lumbar spine or hip. The measurements are usually reported as g/cm3 or as a Z-score (the number of standard deviations above or below the mean for the patient's age and sex). Note that measurement with this method does not reflect local changes in other bones, and as such might not be correct with regard the hole bone-organ.

JT: リソソーム代謝の異常

DEF: An abnormality of the pulmonary artery.

The term juvenile polyps refer to a special histopathology and not the age of onset as the polyp might be diagnosed at all ages. The juvenile polyp has a spherical appearance and is microscopically characterized by overgrowth of an oedematous lamina propria with inflammatory cells and cystic glands. Juvenile polyps are a specific type of hamartomatous polyps.

This term applies if the suture is widely patent from bregma to nasal root.

ET: Bifid proximal phalanx of the thumb
DEF: This term applies if the proximal phalanx of the thumb is partially duplicated. Depending on the severity, the appearance on x-ray can vary from a notched phalanx (the duplicated bone is almost completely fused with the phalanx) to a partially fused appearance of the two bones. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

ET: Broad proximal phalanx of the thumb
DEF: Increased width of the proximal phalanx of the thumb. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

ET: Contracture of the distal interphalangeal joint of the fingers
JT: 指の遠位指間(DIP)関節拘縮
DEF: Chronic loss of joint motion in one or more distal interphalangeal joints of the fingers.

DEF: A demarcated, largely intraventricular tumor in the region of the foramen of Monro composed of spindle to large plump or ganglion-like cells with eosinophilic to amphophilic cytoplasm and somewhat pleomorphic nuclei with occasional prominent nucleoli. These tumors are almost always associated with tuberous sclerosis.
A lesion located beneath a fingernail or toenail.
The presence of short and wide phalanges which taper distally (\

JT: 低拍出性うっ血性心不全
DEF: A form of heart failure characterized by reduced cardiac output. This may be seen in patients with heart failure owing to ischemic heart disease, hypertension, cardiomyopathy, and other causes.

DEF: A structural abnormality of a diaphysis of the arm.

Curved middle phalanges of the hand

DEF: A deviation from the normal straight form of the distal phalanx of the big toe.

Absence or underdevelopment of the diaphragm.
Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the phalanges of the second toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.
Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the phalanges of the third toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.
Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the phalanges of the fourth toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.
Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the phalanges of the fifth toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.

DEF: Absence (agenesis) or underdevelopment of one or more of the proximal phalanges of the 2nd toe.

Short distal phalanx of the 2nd toe
DEF: Reduced length of the distal phalanx of the second toe as a result of developmental hypoplasia.

ET: Short middle phalanx of the 2nd toe
DEF: Reduced length of the middle phalanx of second toe as a result of developmental hypoplasia.

In contrast to forms of polydactyly where the supernumerary digit (this can either be a rudimentary or a completely 'normal' digit) is either located postaxial (on the fibular side of the foot, next top the little toe), preaxial (on the tibial side of the foot, next to the big toe) or mesoaxial (somewhere central, between big and little toe), a supernumerary digit may also be placed ectopically, meaning anywhere else except post-,meso- or preaxial. In the literature this is sometimes referred to as Disorganisation-like Syndrome (OMIM223200).
Abnormality of the female genital system.
Amniotic constriction rings affecting the arms.
Amniotic constriction rings affecting the legs.
Any abnormality of a metatarsal bone epiphysis.

The presence of complexes of spikes and waves (>3.5 Hz) in electroencephalography (EEG).

JT: スレオニン代謝の異常

JT: グルタミン代謝の異常

DEF: EEG with sharp slow waves in the occipital region. Sharp slow waves are focal sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec followed by a slow wave.
An abnormality of size or shape of the long bones.
An abnormality of the vermilion border, the sharp demarcation between the lip (red colored) and the adjacent normal skin.

JT: 中等度の全般性発達遅滞
DEF: A moderate delay in the achievement of motor or mental milestones in the domains of development of a child.

Incomplete formation of the cochlear partition. The scala vestibuli and scala tympani separated by the cochlear partition, except in the apical turn where the two scalae are in continuity via the helicotrema.

JT: 冠状静脈洞心房中隔欠損
DEF: An atrial septal defect characterized by a deficiency in the tissue separating the coronary sinus from the left atrium (LA). This results in partial or complete unroofing of the coronary sinus leading to a predominantly left-to-right shunt through the coronary sinus (LA to coronary sinus to right atrium [RA]). The orifice of the ostium is frequently large because of the increased flow. From the RA side, the defect is located at the level of the coronary sinus ostium and may also include some deficiency in atrial tissue around the ostium. From the LA side, the size can be variable depending on the degree of unroofing of the coronary sinus.
Narrowing or constriction of the aorta localized distal to the ductus arteriosus, i.e., to the postductal region of aortic arch.
Delay of conduction through the atrioventricular node, which is manifested as prolongation of the PR interval in the electrocardiogram (EKG). All atrial impulses reach the ventricles.
The presence of a neoplasm (tumour) in the neurohypophysis, which is also known as the posterior lobe of the hypophysis.

A swelling formed at the base of umbilicus associated with a patent urachus which results from an allantoic remnant. The urachus is a fibrous remnant of the allantois which communicates from the apex of the urinary bladder to the umbilicus. Failed obliteration of the urachus can lead to various abnormalities: urachal cyst, urachal diverticulum, sinus or patent urachus - the most common type. Allantoic cysts in infants with patent urachus can be formed due to the drainage of urine into the umbilical cord, or in uncommon situations, after leakage of hypo-osmotic urine into the Wharton's jelly.

Folds of membranous tissue (peritoneum, mesothelium) attached to the wall of the abdomen and enclosing viscera. Examples include the mesentery for the small intestine; the transverse mesocolon, which attaches the transverse portion of the colon to the back wall of the abdomen; and the mesosigmoid, which enfolds the sigmoid portion of the colon. Cells of the same embryologic origin also surround the other organs of the body such as the lungs (pleura) or the heart (pericardium).

The bones of the skeleton undergo a series of characteristic changes in size, shape, and calcification from fetal life until puberty. An abnormality of this process can include delayed or accelerated skeletal maturation, or deviation of some, but not all bones from the expected patterns of maturation.

ET: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
JT: 母指基節骨無形成/低形成
DEF: This term applies if the proximal phalanx of the thumb is either small/hypoplastic or absent. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

ET: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the distal phalanx of the thumb
JT: 母指末節骨無形成/低形成

ET: Curved distal phalanx of the thumb
DEF: A deviation from the normal straight shape of the distal phalanx of the thumb.

JT: 母指指骨の骨融解病変
DEF: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of one or more phalanges of the thumb.

A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphyses of the thumb, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. The related entity 'angel-shaped' epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of a phalanx.
Uneven (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the phalanges of the hand.

JT: 上腕二頭筋無形成/低形成
DEF: Absence or underdevelopment of the biceps muscle.

JT: 上腕三頭筋無形成/低形成
DEF: Absence or underdevelopment of the triceps muscle.

JT: 大腿四頭筋無形成/低形成
DEF: Absence or underdevelopment of the quadriceps muscle.

ET: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the distal phalanges of the hand
JT: 指の末節骨無形成/低形成
DEF: Absence or underdevelopment of the distal phalanges.

ET: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the proximal phalanges of the hand
JT: 指の基節骨無形成/低形成

DEF: A reduction in diameter of the distal phalanx of finger towards the distal end.
Flatness of the supraorbital portion of the frontal bones.
Absence or underdevelopment of the ear lobes.

ET: Aplasia of the middle ear ossicles
DEF: Absence of the middle ear ossicles, malleus, incus, and stapes.

JT: 第1中手骨骨端ブラケット
DEF: An epiphysis that curves around from its transverse orientation to a longitudinal one from proximal to distal along one side of the phalanx, thus resembling the letter 'C' and forming a bracket around the diaphysis. This results in a so called delta phalanx characterized by a triangular or trapezoidal shaped bone with a C-shaped epiphyseal plate.

JT: 第1中手骨骨端の円錐骨端
DEF: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance.

JT: 第1中手骨の拡大した骨端
DEF: Abnormally large size of the epiphyses of the 1st metacarpal with respect to age-dependent norms.
Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more phalanges of the big toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.

ET: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the distal phalanx of the hallux
JT: 母趾末節骨無形成/低形成

ET: Broad distal phalanx of the hallux
DEF: An increase in width of the distal phalanx of the big toe.

ET: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
JT: 母趾基節骨無形成/低形成

DEF: Absence or underdevelopment of the distal phalanges of the toes.

ET: Broad middle phalanges of the toes

JT: 趾の基節骨無形成/低形成
DEF: Absence (agenesis) or underdevelopment of one or more of the proximal phalanges of the toes.
An abnormal morphology of one or more of the proximal phalanges of the toes, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.
Any abnormality of the salivary glands, the exocrine glands that produce saliva.
Any abnormality of the spinal meninges, the system of membranes (dura mater, the arachnoid mater, and the pia mater) which envelops the spinal cord.
One or more bent (flexed) joints of the second toe that cannot be straightened actively or passively.
One or more bent (flexed) joints of the fourth toe that cannot be straightened actively or passively.
One or more bent (flexed) joints of the fifth toe that cannot be straightened actively or passively.

角化嚢胞性歯源性腫瘍
DEF: A benign uni- or multicystic, intraosseous tumor of odontogenic origin, with a characteristic lining of parakeratinized stratified squamous epithelium and potential for aggressive, infiltrative behaviour.
Abnormality of the midnasal cavity which includes the cavity between the nares and the choanae.
An abnormality of the thalamus.

JT: 胎盤由来アルカリホスファターゼ低値
DEF: An abnormally reduced level of alkaline phosphatase, placental type in the blood.

JT: 前上顎骨の無形成/低形成
DEF: Absence or underdevelopment of the premaxilla.

JT: 多焦点性てんかん型放電
DEF: An abnormality in cerebral electrical activity recorded along the scalp by electroencephalography (EEG) and being identified at multiple locations (foci).

JT: 全般性徐活動を伴う脳波
DEF: Diffuse slowing of cerebral electrical activity recorded along the scalp by electroencephalography (EEG).

JT: アルギニン代謝の異常
DEF: Any deviation from the normal concentration of arginine in the blood circulation.
Any deviation from the normal concentration of tyrosine in the blood circulation.

JT: システイン代謝の異常
DEF: An abnormality of a cysteine metabolic process.

JT: キサンチン代謝の異常
DEF: An increased level of xanthine in the blood circulation.
An abnormality of the third ventricle.
The presence of an altered number of of permanent teeth.
Agenesis of either mandibular second permanent molar or maxillary second permanent molar.
An abnormality of morphology of premolar tooth.

JT: 歯エナメル質低石灰化
DEF: A form of hypomineralization of enamel characterized by reduced calcification.

JT: ケモカイン分泌の異常
DEF: An abnormality in the production or cellular release of a chemokine (a class of cytokines).
EEG background activity at 4-5/second.

JT: 反復性マイコバクテリウム感染症
DEF: Increased susceptibility to mycobacterial infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of mycobacterial infection.

JT: 長節無神経節性巨大結腸
DEF: A type of aganglionic megacolon in which the aganglionic segment extends proximal to the sigmoid.

ET: EEG with parietal sharp slow waves
JT: 頭頂焦点性棘除波を伴う脳波
DEF: EEG with sharp slow waves in the parietal region. Sharp slow waves are focal sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec followed by a slow wave.

ET: EEG with temporal sharp slow waves
JT: 側頭棘除波を伴う脳波
DEF: EEG with sharp slow waves in the temporal region. Sharp slow waves are focal sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec followed by a slow wave.
A moderate delay in the acquisition of the ability to use language to communicate needs, wishes, or thoughts.

ET: Dilated vestibule of the inner ear
DEF: Dilatation of the vestibule of the inner ear.
Underdevelopment of the vestibular nerve.
Abnormality of the corneal endothelium, that is, the single layer of cells on the inner surface of the cornea.

JT: 静脈洞心房中隔欠損症
DEF: An interatrial communication caused by a deficiency of the common wall between the superior vena cava (SVC) and the right-sided pulmonary veins. SVASD is commonly associated with anomalous pulmonary venous connection (APVC) of some or all of the pulmonary veins, which produces additional left-to-right shunting.
An atrioventricular valve that has failed to open (atretic).

The trabecular septum is the largest part of the interventricular septum. It extends from the membranous septum to the apex and superiorly to the infundibular septum. A defect in the trabecular septum is called muscular VSD if the defect is completely rimmed by muscle.
An abnormality of the pulmonary veins.

JT: 副腎皮質刺激ホルモン過剰
DEF: Overproduction of adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH), which generally leads secondarily to overproduction of cortisol by the adrenal cortex.
A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the adenohypophysis, which is also known as the anterior lobe of the pituitary gland.

JT: 下垂体甲状腺刺激ホルモン産生細胞腺腫
DEF: A type of pituitary adenoma that produces thyroid stimulating hormone (TSH).

JT: びまん性甲状腺腫を伴う甲状腺中毒症

DEF: An abnormality of the form, structure, or size of the skeletal system.
An abnormality of the function of the skeletal system.

JT: 血小板糖タンパクVIの減少
DEF: Decreased cell membrane concentration of glycoprotein VI.
A reduction in the ratio of production of beta globin to that of alpha globin. This is the major abnormality in the various forms of beta thalassemia.
A reduction in the ratio of production of alpha globin to that of beta globin. This is the major abnormality in the various forms of alpha thalassemia.

An abnormality of the pectoral muscle, comprising the pectoralis major, a thick, fan-shaped muscle of the anterior chest and the pectoralis minor, a thin, triangular muscle situated underneath the pectoralis major.

JT: 間歇的有痛性筋スパスム
DEF: History of repeated intermittent involuntary muscle contractions that were painful.

JT: 尿中ホモバニリン酸上昇
DEF: An increased concentration of homovanillic acid in the urine.

ET: EEG with central focal spike waves
JT: 中心焦点性棘波を伴う脳波
DEF: EEG with focal sharp transient waves in the central region, i.e., focal sharp waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave.

ET: EEG with frontal focal spike waves
JT: 前頭焦点性棘波を伴う脳波脳波
DEF: EEG with focal sharp transient waves in the frontal region, i.e., focal sharp waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave.
An abnormal concentration of a hormone in the urine.

JT: 尿中硫酸ケラタン排泄
DEF: An increased concentration of keratan sulfate in the urine.
An anomaly of the function of the pancreas.

JT: クレアチン代謝の異常lism
DEF: A deviation from the normal concentration of creatine in the blood circulation. Creatine is a derivative of glycine having methyl and amidino groups attached to the nitrogen. Creatine is naturally produced from amino acids, primarily in liver and kidney, and acts as an energy source for cells, primarly for muscle cells.

JT: クレアチン代謝の異常lism
DEF: A deviation from the normal concentration of creatine in the blood circulation. Creatine is a derivative of glycine having methyl and amidino groups attached to the nitrogen. Creatine is naturally produced from amino acids, primarily in liver and kidney, and acts as an energy source for cells, primarly for muscle cells.
A subtype of ductal pancreatic carcinoma that is thought to originate from squamous metaplasia of pancreatic ductal epithelium.
A separation (dissection) of the layers of the internal carotid artery wall.
A separation (dissection) of the layers of the external carotid artery wall.

JT: 反復性会陰膣カンジダ症
DEF: Recurrent infection involving the vulva, vagina, and adjacent crural areas, whereby the causative agent belongs to the genus Candida.
A structural or developmental anomaly of any of the tissues involved in the genital system.

ET: Absent inner and outer dynein arms
JT: 内側および外側ダイニン腕欠損
DEF: Complete absence of the dynein arms of respiratory motile cilia, that is, absence of the inner and the outer dynein arms, which normally are situated inside and outside of the peripheral microtubules of motile cilia. This feature is usually appreciated by electron microscopy.
Reduced diameter of the proximal phalanx of finger.
Lack of skin pigmentation (coloring) of the abdomen.
Narrowing or constriction of the inner surface (lumen) of the posterior cerebral artery.
An anomaly of the pituitary gland.

JT: 母X染色体不活性化の偏り
DEF: A deviation from equal (50%) inactivation of each parental X chromosome in maternal cells.
Anomalous movements of the eyes that occur without the subject wanting them to happen.
Reduced uptake of [18F]-fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) in the thalamus as measured by positron emission tomography (PET) brain scan.
Reduced uptake of [18F]-fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) in the parietal cortex as measured by positron emission tomography (PET) brain scan.

JT: 駆出分画の重度の減少
DEF: A large reduction in the fraction of blood pumped from the left ventricle with each cardiac cycle. The normal range in adults is at over 50 percent, and a severe reduction is defined as less than 30 percent.

JT: 男性生殖細胞形態異常
DEF: A structural anomaly of a male reproductive cell.

DEF: An abnormality of somatosensory evoked potentials (SSEP), i.e., of the electrical signals of sensation going from the body to the brain in response to a defined stimulus. Recording electrodes are placed over the scalp, spine, and peripheral nerves proximal to the stimulation site. Clinical studies generally use electrical stimulation of peripheral nerves to elicit potentials. SSEP testing determines whether peripheral sensory nerves are able to transmit sensory information like pain, temperature, and touch to the brain. Abnormal SSEPs can result from dysfunction at the level of the peripheral nerve, plexus, spinal root, spinal cord, brain stem, thalamocortical projections, or primary somatosensory cortex.

In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.
