DEF: EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec followed by a slow wave.

ET: EEG with generalized sharp slow waves
JT: 全般性棘徐波を伴う脳波
DEF: EEG with generalized sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec followed by a slow wave.

JT: びまん性促進を伴う脳波
DEF: EEG frequency is abnormally increased.

JT: 連続性徐波活動を伴う脳波
DEF: EEG showing diffuse slowing without interruption.
An abnormal elevation of the C-reactive protein level in serum.

ET: Crus of helix connected to antihelix
JT: 対耳輪に連結した耳輪脚
DEF: Extension of the ridge of the crus helix across the ear and connection of the crus to the antihelix.

JT: 耳輪の不連続な上行基部
DEF: Interruption between the ascending helix and the crus helix, allowing the ascending helix to be attached directly to the mastoid.

JT: 尿中カルシウム濃度異常
DEF: An abnormality of calcium concentration in the urine.

JT: 長節無神経節性巨大結腸
DEF: A type of aganglionic megacolon in which the aganglionic segment extends proximal to the sigmoid.

ET: EEG with frontal sharp slow waves
JT: 焦点性棘徐波を伴う脳波
DEF: EEG with sharp slow waves in the frontal region. Sharp slow waves are focal sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec followed by a slow wave.

ET: EEG with frontal sharp slow waves
JT: 焦点性棘徐波を伴う脳波
DEF: EEG with sharp slow waves in the frontal region. Sharp slow waves are focal sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec followed by a slow wave.

ET: EEG with central sharp slow waves
DEF: EEG with sharp slow waves in the central region. Sharp slow waves are focal sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec followed by a slow wave.

JT: 側頭棘波を伴う脳波脳波
DEF: EEG with sharp waves in the temporal region, i.e., sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec.

JT: 左単一冠状縫合早期癒合
DEF: Synostosis affecting only the left coronal suture.

JT: 右単一冠状縫合早期癒合
DEF: Unicoronal synostosis affecting only the right coronal suture.

JT: 左単一人字縫合早期癒合
DEF: Premature synostosis of only the left lambdoid suture.

JT: 右単一人字縫合早期癒合
DEF: Premature synostosis of only the right lambdoid suture.

ET: Incomplete cleft of the upper lip
DEF: A subtle unilateral cleft of the upper lip, which may appear as a small indentation.

JT: 中等度の全般性発達遅滞
DEF: A moderate delay in the achievement of motor or mental milestones in the domains of development of a child.

JT: 重度の全般性発達遅滞
DEF: A severe delay in the achievement of motor or mental milestones in the domains of development of a child.

JT: 中等度の理解できる言語遅滞
DEF: A moderate delay in the acquisition of the ability to understand the speech of others.

JT: 後天性毛髪パターン異常
DEF: An abnormality of the distribution of hair growth that is acquired during the course of life.

JT: 先天性毛髪パターン異常
DEF: A congenital abnormality of the distribution of hair growth.
Absence of the semicircular canal.
Absence or underdevelopment of the cochlea, a spiral shaped cavity in the inner ear, owing to a developmental defect.

JT: 異常な中枢神経髄鞘形成
DEF: An abnormality of myelination of nerves in the central nervous system.

JT: 中等度の子宮内成長遅滞
DEF: Intrauterine growth retardation that is at least 3 standard deviations (SD) below average, but not as low as 4 SD, corrected for sex and gestational age.

JT: 異常な母血清スクリーニング
DEF: An abnormally elevated or decreased level of a maternal serum marker analytes used in screening for aneuploidy.

JT: 麻酔剤誘発性横紋筋融解
DEF: Rhabdomyolysis induced by anesthesia.
Abnormality of the lacrimal gland, i.e., of the almond-shaped gland that secretes the aqueous layer of the tear film for each eye.
Abnormality of the corneal epithelium, that is of the epithelial tissue that covers the front of the cornea.
An atrioventricular valve that empties into both ventricles. The valve overrides the interventricular septum above a ventricular septum defect.
Anomalous insertion of the chordae tendinae or papillary muscles into the contralateral ventricle in the presence of a ventricular septum defect.

A type of ventricular septal defect communicating directly between the left ventricle and right atrium. This is anatomically possible because the normal tricuspid valve is more apically displaced than the mitral valve.

JT: 心尖部筋性心室中隔欠損
DEF: A muscular ventricular septal defect located at the apex of the heart.

JT: 多発性筋性心室中隔欠損
DEF: A type of muscular ventricular septal defect characterized by the presence of multiple small defects in the ventricular septum.

An abnormality of the coronary sinus, which is formed by the union of the great cardiac vein and the left marginal vein and terminates in the right atrium. The coronary sinus functions to o collect deoxygenated blood from the myocardium of the heart and drain it into the right atrium.

JT: 冠状静脈洞心房中隔欠損
DEF: An atrial septal defect characterized by a deficiency in the tissue separating the coronary sinus from the left atrium (LA). This results in partial or complete unroofing of the coronary sinus leading to a predominantly left-to-right shunt through the coronary sinus (LA to coronary sinus to right atrium [RA]). The orifice of the ostium is frequently large because of the increased flow. From the RA side, the defect is located at the level of the coronary sinus ostium and may also include some deficiency in atrial tissue around the ostium. From the LA side, the size can be variable depending on the degree of unroofing of the coronary sinus.

ET: Patent ductus arteriosus after birth at term
JT: 満期産後の動脈管開存症
DEF: Abnormal persistent patency of the ductus arteriosus in postnatal life when birth was at 37 completed weeks of gestation or greater.

JT: 左室緻密化障害性心筋症
DEF: Left ventricular non-compaction (LVNC) is characterized by prominent left ventricular trabeculae and deep inter-trabecular recesses. The myocardial wall is often thickened with a thin, compacted epicardial layer and a thickened endocardial layer. In some patients, LVNC is associated with left ventricular dilatation and systolic dysfunction, which can be transient in neonates.

JT: 膜様部周囲心室中隔欠損
DEF: A ventricular septal defect that is confluent with and involves the membranous septum and is bordered by an atrioventricular valve, not including the type 3 VSDs.

ET: Mixed total anomalous pulmonary venous connection
JT: 混合性総肺静脈還流異常
DEF: Type 4 total anomalous pulmonary venous connection.
Any structural anomaly of the adrenal glands.
A functional abnormality of the adrenal glands.

JT: 下垂体酸好性幹細胞腺腫
下垂体紡錘細胞オンコサイトーマ
DEF: A spindled-to-epithelioid, oncocytic, nonendocrine neoplasm of the anterior hypophysis that manifests in adults and follows a benign clinical course. Pituitary spindle cell oncocytomas are firm, fibrous, and adherent to surrounding structures and are highly vascular.
A structural abnormality of the thyroid gland.

JT: 中枢性甲状腺機能低下症
DEF: A type of hypothyroidism due to an insufficient stimulation of an otherwise normal thyroid gland. Central hypothyroidism is caused by either pituitary (secondary hypothyroidism) or hypothalamic (tertiary hypothyroidism) defects.

A reduced ability to distinguish tactile sensations at points that are very close to one another. This can be tested by using special calipers whose points can be set from 2mm to several centimeters apart.

JT: 大脳リポフスチンの増加
DEF: Lipofuscin (age pigment) is a brown-yellow, electron-dense, autofluorescent material that accumulates progressively over time in lysosomes of postmitotic cells, such as neurons and cardiac myocytes. This term pertains if there is an increase in the accumulation of lipofuscin (also known as autofluorescent lipoprotein) more than expected for the age of the patient.

JT: 尿中ヒポキサンチン増加
DEF: An increased level of hypoxanthine in the urine.
Decreased cell membrane concentration of P2Y12 receptor.
Abnormal bleeding of the umbilical stump following separation of the cord at approximately 7-10 days after birth.

JT: 高フィブリノーゲン血症
DEF: Increased concentration of fibrinogen in the blood.

JT: 低フィブリノーゲン血症
DEF: Decreased concentration of fibrinogen in the blood.
A history of repeated acute infections of the upper or lower respiratory tract.

JT: 間歇的有痛性筋スパスム
DEF: History of repeated intermittent involuntary muscle contractions that were painful.

JT: 尿中ホモバニリン酸上昇
DEF: An increased concentration of homovanillic acid in the urine.

JT: 全般性多棘波を伴う脳波
DEF: EEG with repetitive generalized sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec.

JT: 尿中コルチゾール値増加
DEF: Abnormally increased concentration of cortisol in the urine.

JT: ボーダーライン性格異常
DEF: A personality disorder characterized by impulsive behavior and unpredictable and capricious mood. Affected individuals show a liability to outbursts of emotion and an incapacity to control the behavioural explosions.
Atrophy of the cerebellum affecting primarily the granular cell layer.
Atrophy of the cerebellum affecting primarily the Purkinje cell layer.

ET: Abnormality of skeletal muscle fiber size
JT: 骨格筋線維サイズの異常
DEF: Any abnormality of the size of the skeletal muscle cell.

JT: ミトコンドリア数の異常
DEF: A deviation from the normal number of mitochondria per cell.

JT: 四肢近位短縮性下肢短縮
DEF: Disproportionate shortening of the proximal segment of the leg (i.e. the femur).

JT: 赤血球前駆細胞数の異常
DEF: A deviation from the normal count of erythroid precursor cells, that is, erythroid lineage cells in the bone marrow.

JT: 顆粒球前駆細胞数の異常
活性化タンパクCへの抵抗性
DEF: Poor anticoagulant response to activated protein C. A plasma is termed 'APC resistant' when the addition of exogenous APC fails to prolong its clotting time in an activated partial thromboplastin time assay.

JT: 過形成性結腸ポリープ症
DEF: Presence of multiple hyperplastic polyps in the colon. Hyperplastic polyps are generally about 5 mm in size and show hyperplastic mucosal proliferation.

JT: 未分化大細胞型リンパ腫
DEF: A type of T-cell lymphoma that is characterized by so-called hallmark cells with a pleomorphic appearance that express the CD30 antigen, are lobulated, and have indented nuclei.

JT: 反復性会陰膣カンジダ症
DEF: Recurrent infection involving the vulva, vagina, and adjacent crural areas, whereby the causative agent belongs to the genus Candida.

JT: 若年性骨髄単球性白血病
DEF: Juvenile myelomonocytic leukemia (JMML) is a lethal myeloproliferative disease of young childhood characterized clinically by overproduction of myelomonocytic cells and by the in vitro phenotype of hematopoietic progenitor hypersensitivity to granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor.

JT: 尿中ポルホビリノーゲン増加
DEF: Increased concentration of porphobilinogen in the urine.

A type of retinal detachment associated with a retinal tear, that is, with a break in the retina that allows fluid to pass from the vitreous space into the subretinal space between the sensory retina and the retinal pigment epithelium.

JT: 無トランスフェリン血症
DEF: Absence of transferrin, a protein that transports iron, in the blood.

JT: 呼吸器運動性繊毛の異常
DEF: A structural anomaly of the respiratory system.

JT: 異常な筋グリコーゲン量
DEF: Any anomaly in the amount of glycogen in muscle tissue.

JT: 筋グリコーゲン量減少
DEF: A decreased amount of glycogen in muscle tissue.

JT: 上気道閉塞エピソード
DEF: Intermittent episodes of increased resistance to the passage of air in the upper airway.
Abnormality of the occipital bone of the skull.

JT: マクロプロラクチノーマ
DEF: A pituitary prolactin cell adenoma of more than 10 mm diameter.
An altered ability of any enzyme or their cofactors to act as catalysts. This term includes changes due to altered levels of an enzyme.

JT: 幼児中の自力摂食の遅延
DEF: A delay in the development of skills required to feed oneself in the toddler period (between one and three years of age).

JT: ヨード造影剤アレルギー
DEF: Allergy to iodine contrast media used in radiological studies.
A functional abnormality of the biliary tree.
A structural abnormality of the biliary tree.

JT: 小さな動脈の中膜石灰化
DEF: Calcification, that is, pathological deposition of calcium salts in the tunica media of small arteries.

JT: 慢性呼吸性アシドーシス
DEF: Longstanding impairment in ventilation such that the partial pressure of carbon dioxide (PaCO2) is elevated above the upper limit of the reference range (more than 45 mm Hg), with a normal or near-normal pH secondary to renal compensation and an elevated serum bicarbonate levels (more than30 mEq/L).

JT: 急性呼吸性アシドーシス
DEF: Sudden onset of impairment in ventilation such that the removal of carbon dioxide by the respiratory system is less than the production of carbon dioxide in the tissues, leading to an elevation of the partial pressure of carbon dioxide (PaCO2) above the normal limits (more than 45 mm Hg) with an accompanying acidemia (pH less than 7.35).
Bony fusion of the mandibular condyle to the base of the skull, resulting in limitation of jaw opening.
Narrowing or constriction of the inner surface (lumen) of the anterior cerebral artery.
An abnormally decreased amount of thyroxin-binding globulin (TBG) in blood. TBG is responsible for carrying the thyroid hormones thyroxine (T4) and 3,5,3'-triiodothyronine (T3) in the bloodstream.
A deviation from the normal count of alpha granules per thrombocyte.
A deviation from the normal count of dense granules per thrombocyte.

JT: 好中球特異的顆粒の欠損
DEF: Lack of specific granules in neutrophils.
Reduction in thickness of the basal lamina of the glomerulus of the kidney.
The presence of minimal changes visible by light microscopy but flattened and fused podocyte foot processes on electron microscopy in a person with nephrotic range proteinuria.

JT: リン酸カルシウム腎結石
DEF: The presence of calcium- and phosphate-containing calculi (stones) in the kidneys.

JT: リン酸カルシウム腎結石
DEF: The presence of calcium- and phosphate-containing calculi (stones) in the kidneys.

JT: ネフローゼ範囲の蛋白尿
DEF: Severely increased amount of excretion of protein in the urine, defined as 3.5 grams per day or more in adults and 40 mg per meter-squared body surface area per hour in children.

JT: 尿中ナトリウム濃度異常
DEF: An abnormal concentration of sodium in the urine.
A difference in the amount of intraocular pressure in the right and left eye.

JT: 傍シルビウス裂多小脳回
DEF: Polymicrogyria (an excessive number of small gyri or convolutions) that is maximal in perisylvian regions (the regions that surround the Sylvian fissures), which may be symmetric or asymmetric and may extend beyond perisylvian regions. The Sylvian fissures often extend posteriorly and superiorly.
Reduced uptake of [18F]-fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) in the parietal cortex as measured by positron emission tomography (PET) brain scan.

ET: Elevated brain choline level by MRS
JT: MRSによる脳コリン値上昇
DEF: An increase in the level of choline-containing compounds in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).

JT: 紡錘状下行胸部大動脈瘤
DEF: A concentric abnormal localized widening (dilatation) of the descending thoracic aorta that involves the full circumference of the vessel wall

JT: 最重度の全般性発達遅滞
DEF: A profound delay in the achievement of motor or mental milestones in the domains of development of a child.
An increased polymorphonuclear cell count in the cerebrospinal fluid.

JT: 口腔粘膜の網状色素沈着
DEF: A net-like pattern of increased pigmentation of the oral cavity.

JT: 右室緻密化障害性心筋症
DEF: A predominantly right ventricular variant of isolated noncompaction cardiomyopathy.
An anomaly of the neck of the uterus (lower part of the uterus), called the uterine cervix.

JT: 異常な上肢運動誘発電位
DEF: An anomaly identified by motor evoked potentials (MEPs) in the arm.

JT: 異常な下肢運動誘発電位
DEF: An anomaly identified by motor evoked potentials (MEPs) in the leg.

ET: Patchy sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 3rd toe
JT: 斑状硬化症(第3趾中節骨)

ET: Patchy sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 4th toe
JT: 斑状硬化症(第4趾中節骨)
DEF: Uneven increase in bone density of the middle phalanx of the fourth toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.

ET: Patchy sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 5th toe
JT: 斑状硬化症(第5趾中節骨)
DEF: Uneven increase in bone density of the middle phalanx of the fifth toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.

ET: Patchy sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd toe
JT: 斑状硬化症(第3趾基節骨)

ET: Patchy sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th toe
JT: 斑状硬化症(第4趾基節骨)
DEF: Uneven increase in bone density of the proximal phalanx of the fourth toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.

ET: Patchy sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th toe
JT: 斑状硬化症(第5趾基節骨)
DEF: Uneven increase in bone density of the proximal phalanx of the fifth toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.

ET: Patchy sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 3rd toe
JT: 斑状硬化症(第3趾末節骨)

ET: Patchy sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 4th toe
JT: 斑状硬化症(第4趾末節骨)
DEF: Uneven increase in bone density of the distal phalanx of the fourth toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.

ET: Patchy sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 5th toe
JT: 斑状硬化症(第5趾末節骨)
DEF: Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of the distal phalanx of the fifth toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.
An anomaly in the metabolism of a vitamin.

JT: 膝の風邪になびく変形
DEF: The appearance of abnormal valgus deformity in one knee in association with varus deformity in the other.

ET: Abnormal pigmentation of the oral mucosa
JT: 異常な口腔粘膜色素沈着
DEF: An abnormality of the pigmentation of the mucosa of the mouth.
An abnormality of the thoracic vertebral column.
A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the parathyroid gland.
Absence or underdevelopment of the eyebrow.
An elevation in bone density in one or more proximal phalanges of the toes. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

ET: Cystic medial necrosis of the aorta
JT: 大動脈の嚢胞性中膜壊死
DEF: An increase of medial mucoid extracellular matrix creating translamellar and/or intralamellar expansions including extracellular pools as noted on an H&E stain and/or a stain to highlight extracellular matrix material (Movat's pentachrome, Alcian blue, etc.).

JT: 基底核のニューロン喪失
DEF: A reduction in the number of nerve cells in the basal ganglia.
An abnormality of a depressor labii inferioris.

JT: 鼻咽頭アデノイドの異常
DEF: Any abnormality of nasopharyngeal adenoids.

JT: 横方向の線状結石の異常
DEF: Any structural abnormality of a lateral crico-arytenoid muscle, which extends from the lateral cricoid cartilage to the muscular process of the arytenoid cartilage, and can adduct the vocal cords, which closes the rima glottidis and thereby protects the airway.

JT: 甲状腺機能亢進症の異常
DEF: An abnormality of a levator labii superioris.
A type of hearing impairment in one or both ears related to an abnormal functionality of the cochlear nerve.

JT: 垂直性核上性注視麻痺
DEF: A supranuclear gaze palsy is an inability to look in a vertical direction as a result of cerebral impairment. There is a loss of the voluntary aspect of eye movements, but, as the brainstem is still intact, all the reflex conjugate eye movements are normal.

JT: 不安(褐色細胞腫を伴う)
DEF: Recurrent attacks of severe anxiety, whose occurence is not restricted to any particular situation or set of circumstances and is therefore unpredictable.
The presence of immunoglobulin A deposits in the glomerulus.
An abnormality of the thyroid gland.
An abnormality of the pigmentation of the skin.

JT: 多汗(褐色細胞腫を伴う)
遠位指趾関節癒合症(手)
DEF: The term distal symphalangism refers to a bony fusion of the distal and middle phalanges of the digits of the hand, in other words the distal interphalangeal joint (DIJ) is missing which can be seen either on x-rays or as an absence of the distal interphalangeal finger creases.
The distal interphalangeal joint and/or the proximal interphalangeal joint of the second to fifth fingers cannot be extended to 180 degrees by either active or passive extension.
A form of hepatic steatosis characterized by the presence of large, lipid-laden vesicles in the affected hepatocytes.
A form of hepatic steatosis characterized by the presence of small, lipid-laden vesicles in the affected hepatocytes.
An anomaly of the intra-atrial or intraventricular septum.

JT: 頻拍(褐色細胞腫を伴う)
動悸(褐色細胞腫を伴う)

DEF: An abnormality of a cardiac ventricle.

JT: 遠位指趾関節癒合症(足)

DEF: Spontaneous detachment of a foot from the body.
Abnormality of the basal ganglia.
Individuals with Pseudobulbar signs often also demonstrate abnormal behavioral symptoms such as inappropriate emotional outbursts of uncontrolled laughter or weeping etc.
An increased susceptibility to respiratory infections as manifested by a history of recurrent respiratory infections.

JT: 頭痛(褐色細胞腫を伴う)
DEF: Repeated episodes of headache with rapid onset, reaching a peak within minutes and of short duration (less than one hour) with pain that is throbbing, pulsating, or bursting in quality.

JT: 運動ニューロンの異常
DEF: Any structural anomaly that affects the motor neuron.

JT: 脊椎骨端骨幹端異形成
外傷による無痛性骨折
DEF: An increased tendency to fractures following trauma, with fractures occurring without pain.
Abnormality of the sella turcica, a saddle-shaped depression in the sphenoid bone at the base of the human skull.
Any abnormality of the parietal bone of the skull.
Increased depth of the median tongue furrow.
An abnormality of the immune system.

JT: 反復性アスペルギルス感染症
DEF: An increased susceptibility to Aspergillus infections, as manifested by a history of recurrent episodes of Aspergillus infections.

JT: 反復性エンテロウイルス感染症
DEF: Increased susceptibility to enteroviral infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of enteroviral infection.

ET: Increased number of peripheral CD3+ T cells

DEF: An abnormal reduction in the concentration of corticotropin, also known as adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH), in the blood.
Decreased ability to react to a delayed hypersensitivity skin test.
An abnormality of the composition of urine or the levels of its components.
Excretion in urine of proteins of a size smaller than albumin (molecular weight 69 kD).
An abnormal increased in the concentration of corticotropin, also known as adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH), in the blood.

ET: Prolonged G2 phase of cell cycle

DEF: An abnormality of the process of endochondral ossification, which is a type of replacement ossification in which bone tissue replaces cartilage.
A pattern of simultaneous degeneration and regeneration of axons (see comment).

JT: コレステロールホメオスターシス異常

DEF: An abnormality of Krebs cycle metabolism that is characterized by a decreased rate of fumarate hydratase activity.
Any abnormality of the soft tissues, including both connective tissue (tendons, ligaments, fascia, fibrous tissues, and fat).

JT: 血清プロスタグランディンE2増加
DEF: An increased concentration of prostaglandin E2 in the blood.

JT: ウォームアップ減少を伴うミオトニア
DEF: Myotonia that occurs after a period of rest and decreases with continuing exercise.
An abnormal predominance of type I muscle fibers (in general, this feature can only be observed on muscle biopsy).

JT: 不規則な上腕骨骨幹端

ET: Periosteal new bone of humeral diaphysis
JT: 骨膜新生骨(上腕骨骨幹)

ET: Narrow joint spaces of the elbow

DEF: The distal epiphysis (rounded portion of bone at the far end of the radius distal to the growth plate) has an abnormal cone-shaped appearance.

JT: 手関節の手根骨角の減少

DEF: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a purine in the blood circulation.
Abnormal increase in systolic blood pressure.
A combined immunodeficiency primary immune deficiency that is characterized by a more severe defect in both the T- and B-lymphocyte systems.
Anterior cervical hypertrichosis (ACH) or 'hairy throat' refers to the presence of a tuft of terminal hair on the anterior neck, just above the laryngeal prominence.
Underdevelopment of one or more muscles innervated by the facial nerve (the seventh cranial nerve).
Narrow, paramedian longitudinal depressions in the plantar skin of the forefoot.
A type of hemolytic anemia in which the Coombs test is positive.
Bleeding that persists longer than the normal time following a surgical procedure.

JT: 無巨核球性血小板減少
DEF: Thrombocytopenia related to lack of or severe reduction in the count of megakaryocytes.

JT: 運動誘発性乳酸性酸血症
DEF: A form of lactic acidemia that occurs following exercise or exertion.
Recurrent episodes of decreased concentration of glucose in the blood occurring during the infantile period.
Increased pressure in the pre-hepatic portal vein.
A rare vascular anomaly with a direct communication between pulmonary artery and pulmonary vein without an intervening capillary bed.
A dislocation of the head of the radius from its socket in the elbow joint in an proximal direction.
A dislocation of the head of the radius from its socket in the elbow joint in an anterior direction.
Absence of the proximal radial epiphysis.

An arterial lesion that is characterized by either intimal fibroplasia, with neointimal lesions of cells and matrix deposition, or medial fibroplasia, in which there is loss of smooth muscle cells and increased deposition of collagen and proteoglycans in the medial layer.
An abnormality of the gestures or movements executed with the facial muscles with which emotions such as fear, joy, sadness, surprise, and disgust can be expressed.
An abnormality of the complement system.

Reduced functionality of the process in which a precursor cell type acquires the specialized features of a B cell. A B cell is a lymphocyte of B lineage with the phenotype CD19-positive and capable of B cell mediated immunity.
A general term referring to a defect in immunity resulting from impaired antibody production.
An abnormality of the physiological functioning of B cells.
An abnormal reduction of the cell motility of neutrophils.

ET: Decreased number of CD4+ T cells
DEF: A decreased proportion of circulating CD4-positive helper T cells relative to total T cell count.

JT: T細胞機能の著明な減少

ET: Decreased number of CD8+ T cells
DEF: A decreased proportion of circulating CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells relative to total number of T cells.

Normally, the posterior and lateral fontanelles are obliterated by about six months after birth, the anterior fontanelle closes by about the middle of the second year. This term refers to the situation in which the fontanelles close at an inappropriately early time point.
Abnormal reduction in ossification of the calvaria (roof of the skull consisting of the frontal bone, parietal bones, temporal bones, and occipital bone).

JT: メラニン細胞の巨大メラノソーム
DEF: The presence of large spherical melanosomes (1 to 6 micrometer in diameter) in the cytoplasm of melanocytes.

JT: 対合できない三指節母指
DEF: A form of triphalangeal thumb that cannot be placed opposite the fingers of the same hand.
Combined syndactyly and polydactyly of the foot on the lateral side (i.e., on the side of the little toe).
An abnormally round shape of the middle phalanx of the finger.
Progressively worsening joint contractures.
Abnormalities affecting the phalanx of finger.

JT: 中手骨骨端の円錐骨端
DEF: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphyses of the metacarpal bones, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. This epiphyses are located at the distal ends of the metacarpal bones.

JT: 重度の手根骨骨化遅延
中手骨の近位の先細り
DEF: Some or all of the metacarpal bones (i.e., metacarpal II to V) have a pointed proximal appearance.
Obliteration of the pulp chambers owing to mineralization of the dental pulp.
Progressive bending or abnormal curvature of a long bone.

JT: 膝蓋骨の外側位置異常

DEF: An abnormality of the morphology of the tooth.

JT: 腓骨末節骨無形成/低形成
DEF: Absence or underdevelopment of the fibula.
An anomaly of a growth plate of a femur.
A small/hypoplastic or absent/aplastic radius.

JT: 小さな異常形成された肩甲骨

DEF: Lack of formation and mineralization of the ribs in utero.

Inflammation of the coronary arteries involving a granulomatous response, i.e., a non-specific inflammatory response involving granulomas, defined as a compact organized collection of mature mononuclear phagocytes including epithelioid and giant cells.

JT: 下垂体プロラクチン細胞腺腫
DEF: A type of pituitary adenoma originating in prolactin secreting cells. This kind of adenoma is characterized by overproduction of prolactin, and may cause loss of menstrual periods and breast milk production in women.
The presence of a papillary adenocarcinoma of the ovary.
A severe delay in the acquisition of the ability to use language to communicate needs, wishes, or thoughts.

JT: びまん性末梢神経脱髄
DEF: A diffuse loss of myelin from the internode regions along myelinated nerve fibers of the peripheral nervous system.

JT: 先天性末梢性ニューロパチー

DEF: Proximal spinal muscular atrophy, i.e., muscular weakness and atrophy related to loss of the motor neurons of the spinal cord and brainstem.

JT: 文法特異的発語異常症

ET: Loss of Purkinje cells in the cerebellar vermis

DEF: Muscular rigidity (continuous contraction of muscles with constant resistance to passive movement).
Stiffness of the limbs (a condition in which muscles cannot be moved quickly without accompanying pain or spasm) occurring in an asymmetric pattern.

ET: Focal T2 hyperintense basal ganglia lesion
JT: 巣状T2高輝度基底核病変
DEF: A lighter than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the basal ganglia. This term refers to a localized hyperintensity affecting a particular region of the basal ganglia.
A developmental defect resulting in the congenital absence of skin on the scalp.
Photosensitivity of the skin occurring early in life.
The presence of fewer than normal sweat glands.

An abnormality of the vestibulo-ocular reflex (VOR). The VOR attempts to keep the image stable on the retina. Ideally passive or active head movements in one direction are compensated for by eye movements of equal magnitude.
Vitelliform maculopathy is a sharply demarcated lesion caused by the accumulation of material, often lipofuscin in the subretinal space underlying the macula.

JT: 不規則な列の長い睫毛
色素性傍静脈脈絡膜網膜萎縮
DEF: Chorioretinal atrophy along the retinal veins.

A subtype of retinitis pigmentosa in which, instead of the pathology starting in the mid-periphery like typical retinitis pigmentosa, the disease starts in the near periphery closer to the vascular arcades and tends to spare the far periphery.

JT: 注視誘発性水平性眼振
DEF: Horizontal nystagmus made apparent by looking to the right or to the left.

JT: 巨大結節性副腎過形成

DEF: An increase in the level of long-chain dicarboxylic acid in the urine.

JT: 母趾末節骨無形成/低形成
DEF: Absence or underdevelopment of the big toe.

Any abnormal process of ossification of the metatarsal bones, which normally are each ossified from two centers: one for the body, and one for the head (metatarsal II,III,IV, and V) and one for the body and one for the base (metatarsal I). The ossification process begins in the center of the body about the ninth week, and extends toward either extremity. The center for the base of the first metatarsal appears about the third year, and the centers for the heads of the other bones between the fifth and eighth years. They join the bodies between the eighteenth and twentieth years.
The presence of degenerative changes of intervertebral disk.
A progressive form of scoliosis with congenital onset.
Aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of the sacral bone.
Absence or developmental hypoplasia of the uterus.
Developmental hypoplasia of the fallopian tube.
A malformation of the laryngeal cartilage.

JT: 幅広い近位大腿骨骨幹端
DEF: Increased width of the proximal part of the shaft (metaphysis) of the femur.
Impairment in the physical production of speech sounds.
Irregular radiographic opacity of the epiphyses of the metacarpals.

ET: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the phalanges of the 5th finger
JT: 第5指指骨低形成/無形成
DEF: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the phalanges of the 5th finger.

ET: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the phalanges of the 4th finger
JT: 第4指指骨低形成/無形成

DEF: Uneven (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the phalanges of the third finger.

JT: 第3指指骨低形成/無形成

JT: 第2指指骨低形成/無形成
片側性前庭シュワン細胞腫
DEF: A unilateral vestibular Schwannoma (acoustic neurinoma).

JT: 斑状硬化症(母指基節骨)
DEF: An uneven increase in bone density of the proximal phalanx of the thumb.

Absence of the proximal phalanx of the thumb. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

ET: Patchy sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
JT: 斑状硬化症(母指末節骨)

Epiphysis of the thumb having multiple bony fragments.

Amelia of one or both upper limbs.
Amelia of one or both legs.
An abnormality of hair pigmentation (color).
Developmental hypoplasia of the crus of the helix. That is, flatter and/or shorter crus helix than average.
Abnormality of the temporal bone of the skull, which is situated at the sides and base of the skull roughly underlying the region of the face known as the temple.
Aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of the tragus.

JT: 第1中手骨無形成/低形成
DEF: Aplasia or Hypoplasia affecting the 1st metacarpal. In contrast to the metacarpals 2-5, the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5 (whereas the proximal phalanx of the thumb is equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits).
This term applies to a triangular shaped 1st metacarpal.

JT: 第2中手骨無形成/低形成
DEF: Aplasia or Hypoplasia affecting the 2nd metacarpal.

JT: 第3中手骨無形成/低形成
DEF: Aplasia or Hypoplasia affecting the 3rd metacarpal.

JT: 第4中手骨無形成/低形成
DEF: Aplasia or Hypoplasia affecting the 4th metacarpal.

JT: 第5中手骨無形成/低形成
DEF: Aplasia or Hypoplasia affecting the 5th metacarpal.
Partial or complete duplication of one or more phalanx of big toe.

JT: 第1中足骨無形成/低形成
DEF: Absence or underdevelopment of the first metatarsal bone.

DEF: Underdevelopment (hypoplasia) of the proximal phalanx of big toe.

ET: Broad distal phalanx of the toes
DEF: Increased width of the distal phalanx of toe of one or more toes.
An abnormal morphology of one or more distal phalanges of the toes, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.
An abnormal morphology of one or more middle phalanges of the toes, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.
Congenital hypoplasia of one or more proximal phalanx of finger.
Absence or underdevelopment of the tongue.

ET: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the phalanges of the 2nd toe
JT: 第2趾趾骨無形成/低形成

ET: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the phalanges of the 5th toe
JT: 第5趾趾骨無形成/低形成

DEF: Absence or underdevelopment of the spleen.
Absence or underdevelopment of the testes.
An abnormal limitation of the mobility of the ankle joint.
An abnormality of dermatoglyphs on the toes and soles, i.e., an abnormality of the patterns of ridges of the skin of sole of foot.
Absence or underdevelopment of the thymus.
An abnormal elevation of phytanic acid.
An abnormal predominance of type II muscle fibers (in general, this feature can only be observed on muscle biopsy).
An abnormality of the formation and mineralization of an epiphysis.
Underdevelopment of the zygomatic bone. That is, a reduction in size of the zygomatic bone, including the zygomatic process of the temporal bone of the skull, which forms part of the zygomatic arch.
Rupture of the eyeball not due to trauma.
Any deviation from the normal concentration of lysine in the blood circulation.
Any deviation from the normal circulation of valine in the blood circulation.
An abnormality of the external nose.
Aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of the vagina.
An abnormality of blood circulation.

JT: 体質性バリアントを伴う脳波
DEF: An EEG with constitutional variants contains waves that are rare or unusual but not generally pathologic.
Absence or underdevelopment of the eyelid.
Increased width of the inferred cross-section of the inferior crus.
Decreased protrusion of the antihelical ridge, proximal to its bifurcation, relative to the prominence of a normal helix.
An abnormality of the stem of the antihelix, which is the part below the bifurcation of the antihelix into the inferior and superior crura.
An abnormality of the metencephalon. The metencephalon is the part of the hindbrain that consists of the pons and the cerebellum.

JT: 多発性頭蓋骨縫合早期癒合
DEF: Craniosynostosis involving at least 2 cranial sutures, where the exact pattern of sutures fused has not been precisely specified.

JT: 先天性毛髪パターン異常
DEF: A congenital abnormality of the distribution of hair growth.
Absence of the vestibular nerve

JT: 脱髄性感覚神経ニューロパチー
DEF: Demyelination of peripheral sensory nerves.
A type of disproportionate short stature characterized by a short trunk but a average-sized limbs that is lethal at birth.

JT: 麻酔剤誘発性横紋筋融解
DEF: Rhabdomyolysis induced by anesthesia.
An abnormality of the lacrimal duct, a duct that drain tears from the conjunctiva, via the lacrimal puncta, into the lacrimal sac.
An abnormal anteroposterior thickness of the cornea.
No pericardium around the heart, occurring as a congenital defect, not the result of a surgical pericardectomy.
Right ventricular dysfunction (global or regional) with functional and morphological right ventricular abnormalities, with or without left ventricular disease.
A type of second degree atrioventricular (AV) block characterized by sudden failure to conduct an impulse through the AV node without a preceding change in the PR interval.
An hormonally active adrenocortical adenoma, that is, an adenoma that secretes excessive amounts of adrenal hormones.
A functional abnormality of a skeletal muscle.
A structural abnormality of a skeletal muscle.
A functional anomaly of T cells.

Decreased cell membrane concentration of P2Y12 receptor.

JT: 軽微な外傷または外傷なしでの出血
DEF: Significant bleeding or hemorrhage without significant precipitating factor.
An anomaly of the glenoid fossa, also known as the glenoid cavity, which is the articular surface of the scapula that articulates with the head of the humerus.

JT: 血漿総カルニチン減少
DEF: A decreased concentration of total carnitine in the blood.
An abnormality of the interatrial septum.
Persistence of blood flow through the ductus venosus for longer than the normal time after birth.

JT: 尿中コルチゾール値増加
DEF: Abnormally increased concentration of cortisol in the urine.

An anomaly of the mitochondrion, the membranous cytoplasmic organelle the interior of which is subdivided by cristae. The mitochondrion is a self replicating organelle that is the site of tissue respiration.
A separation (dissection) of the layers of the common carotid artery wall.

JT: 若年性骨髄単球性白血病
DEF: Juvenile myelomonocytic leukemia (JMML) is a lethal myeloproliferative disease of young childhood characterized clinically by overproduction of myelomonocytic cells and by the in vitro phenotype of hematopoietic progenitor hypersensitivity to granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor.

JT: 異常な筋グリコーゲン量
DEF: Any anomaly in the amount of glycogen in muscle tissue.
Any deviation from the normal concentration of serine in the blood circulation.
An abnormal functionality of the hypothalamus.
Any structural anomaly of the hypothalamus.
Reduced diameter of the middle phalanx of finger.
Reduced diameter of the distal phalanx of finger.
Lack of skin pigmentation (coloring) of the arms and legs.
An anomaly of the celiac artery.
An abnormality of the metabolism of folic acid, which is also known as vitamin B9.
Large or prominent malar surface of the zygomatic bone of the skull, which is convex and forms the prominence of the 'cheek bones'.
Underdevelopment of the cerebral white matter.
A reduced concentration of 5-methyltetrahydrofolate(2-) in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF). 5-methyltetrahydrofolate is the active folate metabolite.

JT: トランスフェリン飽和の減少
DEF: A below normal level of saturation of serum transferrin with iron.

JT: 側頭骨下顎関節捻髪音
DEF: Noises from the temporomandibular joint during mandibular movement (e.g., chewing). Temporomandibular joint crepitus is often described as a clicking, popping, grating sound.

JT: 下垂体の異常なサイズ
DEF: A deviation from the normal size of the pituitary gland.

ET: Abnormal brain FDG positron emission tomography
DEF: An anomaly detectable in [18F]-fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) positron emission tomography (PET) brain scans. Glucose uptake measured with FDG-PET is a marker of neuronal metabolic activity.

JT: 駆出分画の軽度の減少
DEF: A small reduction in the fraction of blood pumped from the left ventricle with each cardiac cycle. The normal range in adults is at least 50 percent, and a mild reduction is defined as 40-49 percent.
A structural abnormality of the pineal gland.
A functional abnormality of the pineal gland.
Abnormal anatomic location of the anterior pituitary gland.

ET: Focal T2 hypointense basal ganglia lesion
JT: 巣状T2低輝度基底核病変
DEF: A darker than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the basal ganglia. This term refers to a localized hypointensity affecting a particular region of the basal ganglia.

JT: 空間パターンOR空間分布
DEF: The pattern by which a phenotype affects one or more regions of the body.
A structural anomaly of the secretory duct of the testicle that carries spermatozoa from the epididymis to the prostatic urethra where it terminates to form ejaculatory duct.

An anomaly identified by motor evoked potentials (MEPs). MEPs are measured following single-pulse or repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation and can be used for the assessment of the excitability of the motor cortex and the integrity of conduction along the central and peripheral motor pathways.

The inability to maintain postures or positions (such as keeping eyes closed, protruding the tongue, maintaining conjugate gaze steadily in a fixed direction, or making a prolonged 'ah' sound) without repeated prompts.

JT: 異所性副甲状腺甲状腺組織
DEF: Accessory ectopic thyroid tissue arising from remnants of the thyroglossal duct anywhere along the path of the thyroglossal duct tract.

JT: 第2趾のブラケット骨端
第3趾のブラケット骨端
第4趾のブラケット骨端
第5趾のブラケット骨端

DEF: Abnormality of the growth of the axillary hair. Axillary hair is part of the secondary sexual hair, which normally ensues during puberty.

JT: 末梢神経アミロイドーシス
DEF: The presence of amyloid deposition in the nerves of the peripheral nervous system.
A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the endocrine system.

JT: モザイク型中枢性角膜ジストロフィー

DEF: An abnormality of emotional behaviour.
Any structural abnormality of the medulla of the kidney.
A type of dysharmonic skeletal maturation in which there is an acceleration in skeletal maturation whose degree differs markedly in different bones.
An abnormality of a temporalis muscle.
An abnormality of a buccinator muscle.
An abnormality of a blood vessel of the head, including branches of the arterial and venous systems of the head.
An abnormality of a blood vessel of the neck, including branches of the arterial and venous systems of the neck.
Any structural abnormality of a cricoid cartilage, that is, of the ring-shaped cartilage of the larynx.
An abnormality of a geniohyoid muscle.
An abnormality of a hyoglossus muscle.

A mode of inheritance that is observed for traits related to a gene encoded on one of the autosomes (i.e., the human chromosomes 1-22) in which a trait manifests in individuals with two pathogenic alleles, either homozygotes (two copies of the same mutant allele) or compound heterozygotes (whereby each copy of a gene has a distinct mutant allele).
An abnormality of the renal tubules.
An increased amount of subcutaneous fat tissue in the face.
An abnormality of the nasal septum.

Abnormality of the nasal bridge, which is the saddle-shaped area that includes the nasal root and the lateral aspects of the nose. It lies between the glabella and the inferior boundary of the nasal bone, and extends laterally to the inner canthi.
Dysplasia affecting the vasculature of the gastrointestinal tract.
Any deviation from the normal motor coordination of the eyes that allows for bilateral fixation on a single object.

JT: 先天性横隔膜ヘルニア
DEF: The presence of a hernia of the diaphragm present at birth.

JT: 視床下部-下垂体軸異常
DEF: Abnormality of the pituitary gland (also known as hypophysis), which is an endocrine gland that protrudes from the bottom of the hypothalamus at the base of the brain. The pituitary gland secretes the hormones ACTH, TSH, PRL, GH, endorphins, FSH, LH, oxytocin, and antidiuretic hormone. The secretion of hormones from the anterior pituitary is under the strict control of hypothalamic hormones, and the posterior pituitary is essentially an extension of the hypothalamus, so that hypothalamus and pituitary gland may be regarded as a functional unit.

ET: Posterior fossa cyst at the fourth ventricle
JT: 第4脳室での後頭窩嚢胞

DEF: The distal and proximal transverse palmar creases are merged into a single transverse palmar crease.
An abnormality of the dermatoglyphs, i.e., an abnormality of the patterns of ridges of the skin of palm of hand.

JT: びまん性体部被角血管腫

DEF: An abnormality affecting the carpal bones of the wrist (scaphoid, lunate, triquetral, pisiform, trapezium, trapezoid, capitate, hamate).

ET: Short tubular bones of the hand
DEF: Decreased length of the tubular bones of the hand, that is, the phalanges and metacarpals.

JT: ミオクローヌス放電ロック前ミオクローヌス棘波
DEF: Jerk-locked averaging (JLA) is used to record the timing and distribution of brain activity preceding brisk involuntary movements such as those observed in patients with myoclonus. JLA is capable of revealing a premyoclonus spike in the absence of paroxysmal activity in the routine EEG.

JT: 筋を含む無形成/低形成
DEF: Absence or underdevelopment of the musculature.

JT: 肩帯筋の無形成/低形成
DEF: Absence or underdevelopment of the muscles of the shoulder.

DEF: Absence or underdevelopment of the musculature of the upper limbs.

DEF: Absence or underdevelopment of the muscles of the upper arm.

JT: 男性限定常染色体優性

DEF: An abnormal restriction of fetal growth with fetal weight below the tenth percentile for gestational age.
Any structural anomaly of the mitral valve.
Any abnormality of the aortic valve.
Any structural abnormality of a cardiac valve.
An abnormality of the tarsus are the cluster of seven bones in the foot between the tibia and fibula and the metatarsus, including the calcaneus (heel) bone and the talus (ankle) bone.

DEF: A type of renal tubular acidosis characterized by a failure of the proximal tubular cells to reabsorb bicarbonate, leading to urinary bicarbonate wasting and subsequent acidemia.

Pulmonary hypertension is defined mean pulmonary artery pressure of 25mmHg or more and pulmonary capillary wedge pressure of 15mmHg or less when measured by right heart catheterisation at rest and in a supine position.
A type of motor delay characterized by a delay in acquiring the ability to control the large muscles of the body for walking, running, sitting, and crawling.
An increase of the pressure inside the cranium (skull) and thereby in the brain tissue and cerebrospinal fluid.
Telangiectasia affecting the gastrointestinal tract.
Abnormal outpouching or sac-like dilatation in an artery that originates from he abdominal aorta.

An anomaly of the rhythm or depth of breathing.

Any deviation from the normal concentration of a lipid in the blood circulation.
An abnormality of the myelination of motor and sensory peripheral nerves. These are axons for motor nerves and dendrites for sensory nerves in the strict anatomic sense.

4-ヒドロキシフェニルピルビン酸尿
DEF: Increased concentration of pyruvic acid in the urine.

JT: 高ペプシノーゲン血症I
プロトロンビン消費の減少
DEF: The prothrombin consumption test measures the formation of intrinsic thromboplastin by determining the residual serum prothrombin after blood clotting is complete. If there is a defect in the process, less prothrombin will be converted to thrombin than normal (less prothrombin is consumed). This test may be abnormal with conditions including deficiency of factors VIII or IX, with circulating anticoagulants, thrombocytopenia.

JT: 尿中ノルエピネフリン上昇
DEF: An increased concentration of noradrenaline in the urine.
An abnormality of the femoral neck (which is the process of bone, connecting the femoral head with the femoral shaft).
An abnormality of the femoral head.

JT: 筋電図:慢性変性サイン
DEF: Evidence of chronic denervation on electromyography.
Increased concentration of long-chain fatty acids in the blood circulation.

JT: 筋電図:ミオパチー異常
DEF: The presence of abnormal electromyographic patterns indicative of myopathy, such as small-short polyphasic motor unit potentials.

JT: 尿中ゴナドトロピン高値(原発性性腺機能低下症)
DEF: An elevated concentration of a gonadotropin hormone (stimulating hormone or luteinizing hormone) in the urine, consistent with the diagnosis of primary hypogonadism.
The presence of autoantibodies in the serum that react against nuclei or nuclear components.

The shoulder, or pectoral, girdle is composed of the clavicles and the scapulae. Shoulder-girdle weakness refers to lack of strength of the muscles attaching to these bones, that is, lack of strength of the muscles around the shoulders.

A positive response to the regitine blocking test consisting of a substantial reduction in blood pressure following administration of regitine, indicative of the presence of increased levels of epinephrine and norepinephrine in the circulation, which is seen in pheochromocytoma-associated hypertension.

JT: 筋電図:ミオトニア反応
DEF: Spontaneous, repetitive electrical activity demonstrated by electromyography (EMG).
Congenital underdevelopment of lymph vessels.

JT: 髄液ホモバニリン酸(HVA)減少

Increased width (breadth) of metaphyses of the arms.
Irregularity of the normally smooth surface of the metaphysis of the radius.
An anomaly of the radial diaphysis.

JT: 第4指指骨の骨融解病変
DEF: Osteolytic defects of the phalanges of the 4th (ring) finger.
Fusion of two or more bones of the 4th finger.

Fusion of two or more bones of the 5th finger.

ET: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger
JT: 第5指中節骨骨端の異常
DEF: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the fifth finger. This epiphysis is located on the proximal end of the phalanx.

Reduced size of cervical vertebrae.
Fusion of the C5 and C6 cervical vertebrae.
An abnormality of the normal developmental rotation of the kidney leading to an abnormal axial orientation of the kidney.

DEF: A form of hemolytic anemia that is triggered by ingestion of certain drugs.

JT: プロテインS活性の減少
DEF: An abnormality of coagulation related to a decreased concentration of vitamin K-dependent protein S. Protein S is a cofactor of protein C.
A type of sideroblastic anemia that is not responsive to treatment.

JT: 経口ブドウ糖負荷異常
DEF: An abnormal resistance to glucose, i.e., a reduction in the ability to maintain glucose levels in the blood stream within normal limits following oral administration of glucose.
Abnormal tortuous (i.e., twisted) form of arteries affecting most or all arteries.
An abnormal increase in the average blood pressure in an individual during a single cardiac cycle.
An abnormal osseous union (fusion) between the proximal portions of the radius and the ulna.

JT: 断片化した不規則な骨端

DEF: Conduction block in the posterior division of the left bundle branch of the bundle of His.
A form of chronic pancreatitis that is characterized by calcification.
An abnormality of the humoral immune system, which comprises antibodies produced by B cells as well as the complement system.
Recurrent infections by Neisseria meningitidis (one of the most common causes of bacterial meningitis), which is also known as meningococcus.

JT: T細胞機能の著明な減少

DEF: Recurrent infections by bacteria of the genus Neisseria, including N. meningitidis (one of the most common causes of bacterial meningitis).

JT: プロテインC活性の減少
DEF: An abnormality of coagulation related to a decreased concentration of vitamin K-dependent protein C. Protein C is activated to protein Ca by thrombin bound to thrombomodulin. Activated protein C degrades factors VIIIa and Va.

JT: ヘモグロビン合成不均衡
DEF: Normal hemoglobin synthesis is characterized by production of equal amounts of alpha and beta globins. This term refers to a deviation from this pattern and is the main characteristic of the various forms of thalassemia.
A focal type of palmoplantar keratoderma in which only certain areas of the palms and soles are affected.
Absence or underdevelopment of the femur.

An abnormally increased rate of skeletal maturation. Accelerated skeletal maturation can be diagnosed on the basis of an estimation of the bone age from radiographs of specific bones in the human body.
Absent ossification of the calvaria (vault of the skull).
Absence or underdevelopment of the tibia.
Severe degree of osteoporosis.

JT: 高カリウム血症性代謝性アシドーシス

DEF: A congenital form of torticollis resulting from shortening of the sternocleidomastoid muscle and leading to a limited range of motion in both rotation and lateral bending.
A chronic loss of joint motion in metacarpophalangeal joints due to structural changes in muscle, tendons, ligaments, or skin that prevents normal movement.
Increased length of the proximal phalanx of finger.

The term proximal symphalangism refers to a bony fusion of the middle and proximal phalanges of the digits of the hand, in other words the proximal interphalangeal joint (PIJ) is missing which can be seen either on x-rays or as an absence of the proximal interphalangeal finger creases.
The presence of a single, median maxillary incisor, affecting both the primary maxillary incisor and the permanent maxillary incisor.
Loss of the primary (also known as deciduous) teeth before the usual age.
The presence of a supernumerary, i.e., extra, maxillary incisor, either the primary maxillary incisor or the permanent maxillary incisor.
Developmental hypoplasia of the primary teeth.

JT: 上腕骨頸部の内反変形

DEF: An abnormal increase in the bone density of the long bones.

Slipped capital femoral epiphysis is defined as a posterior and inferior slippage of the proximal epiphysis of the femur onto the metaphysis (femoral neck), occurring through the physeal plate during the early adolescent growth spurt.

ET: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving bones of the feet
JT: 足の骨の無形成/低形成

DEF: A lymphocyte-predominant infiltration of the lungs characterized by bibasilar pulmonary infiltrates with dense interstitial accumulations of lymphocytes and plasma cells.

JT: グロムス鼓膜傍神経節腫

DEF: A subtype of renal cell carcinoma thought to originate from mature renal tubular cells in the proximal tubule of the nehpron.

JT: 小脳虫部無形成/低形成
DEF: Absence or underdevelopment of the vermis of cerebellum.
Atrophy (wasting, decrease in size of cells or tissue) affecting the frontotemporal cerebrum.

JT: オリーブ核橋小脳低形成
DEF: Hypoplasia of the cerebellum, pontine nuclei, and inferior olivary nucleus.
Leukoencephalopathy that gets more severe with time.
The formation of small cavities in the tissue of the basal ganglia.

JT: 全般性大脳萎縮/低形成
DEF: Generalized atrophy or hypoplasia of the cerebrum.

JT: 進行性痙性対不全麻痺

DEF: Atherosclerosis (HP:0002621) of a cerebral artery.

JT: 周期性高カルシウム血症性麻痺
DEF: Episodes of muscle weakness associated with elevated levels of potassium in the blood.

JT: 軸索再生のクラスター
DEF: Groups of small caliber axons in peripheral nerve biospies indicative of axonal regeneration.
Multiple areas of darker than expected signal on magnetic resonance imaging emanating from the deep cerebral white matter.
Underdevelopment of the frontal lobe of the cerebrum.

色素沈着性/低色素性斑
無汗型外胚葉形成不全

顔面皮膚無形成/低形成

DEF: An abnormality of the reflex that controls the diameter of the pupil, in response to the intensity of light that falls on the retina of the eye.
Underdevelopment of the lower eyelid.
Presence of multiple dilatations (sac-like outpouchings) in the blood vessels of the conjunctiva.
Horizontal nystagmus dating from or present at birth.

A shape created by an acute downward arching of the upper eyelid and upward arching of the lower eyelid, toward the medial canthus, which gives the outline of the palpebral fissures the configuration of an almond. Thus, the maximum distance between the fissures is offset from, and medial to, the center point.

JT: 巨大網状網膜ジストロフィー
DEF: A spectrum of fundoscopic appearances characterized by the development of a variety of patterns of deposits predominantly in the macular area. The deposits are typically bilateral, relatively symmetrical, yellow/white and associated with changes at the level of the retinal pigment epithelium. With time, retinal atrophy may occur. A number of pattern dystrophy subtypes have been described including butterfly-shaped dystrophy, reticular dystrophy (net-like pattern) and fundus pulverulentus (granular, mottled pigmentation).
Decreased retinal arteriolar diameters, which may decrease blood flow and slow oxygen delivery to regions of the retina.

JT: ブドウ膜無形成/低形成
DEF: Absence or underdevelopment of the uvea, the pigmented middle layer of the eye consisting of the iris and ciliary body together with the choroid.
Congenital absence or underdevelopment of the fovea centralis.

ET: Aplasia/Hypoplasia affecting the anterior segment of the eye
JT: 眼前節の無形成/低形成
DEF: Absence or underdevelopment of the anterior segment of the eye.
The presence of one or more bullae on the skin, defined as fluid-filled blisters more than 5 mm in diameter with thin walls.

JT: 男性でのテストステロン減少
亜鉛ホメオスターシスの異常
DEF: An abnormality of zinc ion homeostasis.

JT: 不抱合型高ビリルビン血症
DEF: An increased amount of unconjugated (indirect) bilurubin in the blood.
A partial reduction in level of the complement component Factor H in circulation.

JT: 一過性高フェニールアラニン血症
DEF: A condition of not having consistently high levels of phenylalanine in the blood but of experiencing temporary hyperphenylalaninemia following ingestion of large quantities of phenylalanine (for instance, following an oral loading test with phenylalanine).

JT: 血漿フリーカルニチン減少
DEF: A decreased concentration of free (unbound) carnitine in the blood.
Aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of the nail.
Chronic infection of the nails by Candida species.

Narrowing (becoming gradually narrower) of the distance between vertebral pedicles that gets progressively more severe towards to caudal (lower) end of the vertebral column. Note that normally, the interpedicular distances get progressively wider as one proceeds down the spine.
Narrowing (becoming gradually narrower) of the distance between lumbar vertebral pedicles that gets progressively more severe towards to caudal (lower) end of the vertebral column.

JT: 蓚酸カルシウム腎結石
DEF: The presence of calcium- and oxalate-containing calculi (stones) in the kidneys.
A loss of the ability to move the vocal fold on one side.
Any structural abnormality of the renal artery.
Delayed maturation and calcification of the pubic bone.
Joint dislocation of the femoral head.

Impaired feeding performance of an infant as manifested by difficulties such as weak and ineffective sucking, brief bursts of sucking, and falling asleep during sucking. There may be difficulties with chewing or maintaining attention.
Truncal obesity with onset during childhood, defined as between 2 and 10 years of age.

JT: 新生児短い-四肢低身長
DEF: A type of short-limbed dwarfism that is manifest beginning in the neonatal period.
Muscular hypotonia (abnormally low muscle tone) affecting the musculature of the trunk.
Muscular atrophy that does not display a progression in severity with time.
An abnormally increased tendency towards muscle fatigue induced by physical exercise.

In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

A duplication leading to an accesory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, this is actually a different entity called a Pseudoepiphyses (see according terms) sometimes also referred to as Hyperphalangism.

JT: 重度の理解できる言語遅滞

JT: 反復性ウイルス性皮膚感染症
DEF: Increased susceptibility to viral skin infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of viral skin infections.

Fifth finger clinodactyly is defined by a hypoplastic or absent mid-phalanx of the fifth digit. Ultrasound identification of the fetal hand must first be undertaken and then appropriate magnification accomplished. The evaluation requires stretching of the 5 fingers. The diagnosis is established when the middle phalanx of the fifth finger is markedly smaller than normal or absent, which often causes the finger to be curved inward (PMID:16100637).
Increased pigmentation of the fundus
An abnormality of binocular vision, that is of the ability to synthesize the visual inputs from both eyes to a single image with perception of depth.
Congenital malformation of the ventral wall with partial or total evisceration of the heart outside the thoracic cavity and displacement partially into the abdominal cavity.
A ventricular septal defect that involves the inlet of the right ventricular septum immediately inferior to the AV valve apparatus.

Absence of the right superior vena cava (RSVC). An absent RSVC is always associated with a persistent left superior vena cava (PLSVC). During normal fetal development, the left-sided anterior venous cardinal system regresses, leaving the coronary sinus (CS) and the ligament of Marshall. Failure of the closure of the left anterior cardinal vein results in PLSVC. In general, PLSVC is associated with the right superior vena cava (RSVC) and drains into the RA via a dilated CS. When developmental arrest occurs at an earlier stage, the CS is absent and the PLSVC drains into the left atrium.
The superior vena cava passes below the aortic arch.
An abnormal path of a coronary artery.

Progressive PR interval prolongation with the subsequent occurrence of a single nonconducted P wave that results in a pause. The pause that follows the nonconducted impulse is less than fully compensatory (less than the sum of two normal sinus intervals).
A soft tissue continuity in the A/P axis between fingers 3 and 4.

JT: 尿中カテコラミン上昇
DEF: An increased concentration of catecholamine in the urine.
A deviation from the normal range of neutrophil cell counts in the circulation.

JT: 全般性多棘波を伴う脳波

A personality disorder characterized by shallow and labile affectivity, self-dramatization, theatricality, exaggerated expression of emotions, suggestibility, egocentricity, self-indulgence, lack of consideration for others, easily hurt feelings, and continuous seeking for appreciation, excitement and attention.

The presence of a V-shaped indentation (notch) in the primary central incisor.

Being present on both sides of the body.

An abnormal site of the kidney.
An abnormality of the formation and mineralization of one or more vertebrae.
The presence of a neoplasm of the adrenal medulla.
Any structural abnormality of the lumbar vertebral column.
Congenital absence or underdevelopment of the colon.
The presence of a neoplasm of the small intestine.
The presence of a neoplasm of the large intestine.

Congenital mesoblastic nephroma is a type of kidney tumor that is usually found before birth by ultrasound or within the first 3 months of life. It contains fibroblastic cells (connective tissue cells), and may spread to the other kidney or to nearby tissue.
An elevation in bone density in one or more phalanges of the second finger. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.
An elevation in bone density in one or more phalanges of the third finger. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.
An elevation in bone density in one or more phalanges of the fourth finger. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.
An elevation in bone density in one or more phalanges of the fifth finger. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.
An elevation in bone density in one or more middle phalanges of the toes. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.
An elevation in bone density in one or more distal phalanges of the toes. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

JT: 非典型的または遷延性肝炎
両側性後鼻孔閉鎖/狭窄

DEF: An abnormality of a mandibular ramus.
An abnormality of a mylohyoid muscle.
An abnormality of a ciliary ganglion.

A mode of inheritance that is observed for traits related to a gene encoded on one of the autosomes (i.e., the human chromosomes 1-22) in which a trait manifests in heterozygotes. In the context of medical genetics, an autosomal dominant disorder is caused when a single copy of the mutant allele is present. Males and females are affected equally, and can both transmit the disorder with a risk of 50% for each child of inheriting the mutant allele.

ET: Functional abnormality of male internal genitalia
JT: 男性内性器の機能異常
低ゴナドトロピン性性腺機能低下症
DEF: Hypogonadotropic hypogonadism is characterized by reduced function of the gonads (testes in males or ovaries in females) and results from the absence of the gonadal stimulating pituitary hormones: follicle stimulating hormone (FSH) and luteinizing hormone (LH).
Abnormality of the oral cavity, i.e., the opening or hollow part of the mouth.
Pierre Robin malformation is a sequence of developmental malformations characterized by micrognathia (mandibular hypoplasia), glossoptosis and cleft palate.

Infants normally have two fontanels at birth, the diamond-shaped anterior fontanelle at the junction of the coronal and sagittal sutures, and the posterior fontanelle at the intersection of the occipital and parietal bones. The posterior fontanelle usually closes by the 8th week of life, and the anterior fontanel closes by the 18th month of life on average. This term applies if there is delay of closure of the fontanelles beyond the normal age.

JT: 耳輪の過剰な巻き込み
DEF: A condition in which the helix is folded over to a greater degree than normal. That is, excessive curling of the helix edge, whereby the free edge is parallel to the plane of the ear.
The palpebral fissure inclination is more than two standard deviations below the mean.
An abnormality of the conjunctiva.

JT: 垂直性核上性注視麻痺
DEF: A supranuclear gaze palsy is an inability to look in a vertical direction as a result of cerebral impairment. There is a loss of the voluntary aspect of eye movements, but, as the brainstem is still intact, all the reflex conjugate eye movements are normal.
Lack of any response to stimulation upon electroretinography.

JT: 脈絡膜網膜コロボーマ
DEF: Absence of a region of the retina, retinal pigment epithelium, and choroid.
Abnormality of the optic nerve.

JT: 内転で狭くなる眼瞼裂

DEF: Progressive deterioration of peripheral axons.

JT: 先天性横隔膜ヘルニア
DEF: The presence of a hernia of the diaphragm present at birth.

JT: 膜性増殖性糸球体腎炎
DEF: A type of glomerulonephritis characterized by diffuse mesangial cell proliferation and the thickening of capillary walls due to subendothelial extension of the mesangium. The term membranoproliferative glomerulonephritis is often employed to denote a general pattern of glomerular injury seen in a variety of disease processes that share a common pathogenetic mechanism, rather than to describe a single disease entity

JT: 高ゴナドトロピン性性腺機能低下症
DEF: Reduced function of the gonads (testes in males or ovaries in females) associated with excess pituitary gonadotropin secretion and resulting in delayed sexual development and growth delay.

JT: 下垂体前葉機能低下症
DEF: A condition of reduced function of the anterior pituitary gland characterized by decreased secretion of one or more of the pituitary hormones growth hormone, thyroid-stimulating hormone, adrenocorticotropic hormone, prolactin, luteinizing hormone, and follicle-stimulating hormone.

JT: ゴナドトロピン過剰症
DEF: Overproduction of gonadotropins (FSH, LH) by the anterior pituitary gland.

JT: 進行性鎖骨先端骨融解
DEF: Progressive bone resorption in the distal part of the clavicle.
Abnormal thickening of the cortex of long bones.
Any structural abnormality of the sweat gland.

DEF: An abnormality of the fingernails.

DEF: An abnormality of the function of the electrical signals with which nerve cells communicate with each other or with muscles as measured by electrophysiological investigations.

JT: 巨大身体感覚誘発電位
DEF: An abnormal enlargement (i.e. increase in measured voltage) of somatosensory evoked potentials.

JT: 眼振誘発性うなずき運動
DEF: Head movements associated with nystagmus, that may represent an attempt to compensate for the involuntary eye movements and to improve vision.

JT: 免疫不全による肝膿瘍
エンテロウイルス肝炎
DEF: Inflammation of the liver due to infection with enterovirus.

A mode of inheritance that is observed for recessive traits related to a gene encoded on the X chromosome. In the context of medical genetics, X-linked recessive disorders manifest in males (who have one copy of the X chromosome and are thus hemizygotes), but generally not in female heterozygotes who have one mutant and one normal allele.

JT: 性別限定常染色体優性
性別限定常染色体優性
男性限定常染色体優性
在胎月齢より小さい児
DEF: Smaller than normal size according to sex and gestational age related norms, defined as a weight below the 10th percentile for the gestational age.

JT: 在胎月齢より大きい児
DEF: The term large for gestational age applies to babies whose birth weight lies above the 90th percentile for that gestational age.

JT: 軽度の生後の成長遅滞
DEF: A mild degree of slow or limited growth after birth, being between two and three standard deviations below age- and sex-related norms.

JT: 二次口心房中隔欠損症
DEF: A kind of atrial septum defect arising from an enlarged foramen ovale, inadequate growth of the septum secundum, or excessive absorption of the septum primum.
An abnormality of the pericardium, i.e., of the fluid filled sac that surrounds the heart and the proximal ends of the aorta, vena cava, and the pulmonary artery.
A disorder of the cardiac conduction system of the heart characterized by ventricular preexcitation due to the presence of an abnormal accessory atrioventricular electrical conduction pathway.
A disorder of the cardiac conduction system of the heart characterized by ventricular preexcitation due to the presence of an abnormal accessory atrioventricular electrical conduction pathway.
A progressive form of hearing impairment.
A structural anomaly of the nasopharynx.
Premature rupture of membranes (PROM) is a condition which occurs in pregnancy when the amniotic sac ruptures more than an hour before the onset of labor.

JT: 自己免疫性溶血性貧血
DEF: An autoimmune form of hemolytic anemia.

JT: 腎尿細管アシドーシス
DEF: Acidosis owing to malfunction of the kidney tubules with accumulation of metabolic acids and hyperchloremia, potentially leading to complications including hypokalemia, hypercalcinuria, nephrolithiasis and nephrocalcinosis.

A type of hearing impairment prominently characterized by a difficulty in understanding speech, rather than an inability to hear speech. Poor speech discrimination is a very common symptom of high frequency hearing loss.
An abnormality that involves the tubules and interstitial tissue of the kidney.

JT: 自己免疫性血小板減少
DEF: The presence of thrombocytopenia in combination with detection of antiplatelet antibodies.

JT: 胎児無動シークェンス
DEF: Decreased fetal activity associated with multiple joint contractures, facial anomalies and pulmonary hypoplasia. Ultrasound examination may reveal polyhydramnios, ankylosis, scalp edema, and decreased chest movements (reflecting pulmonary hypoplasia).
Any structural anomaly of the lung.

A functional defect characterized by reduced total lung capacity (TLC) not associated with abnormalities of expiratory airflow or airway resistance. Spirometrically, a restrictive defect is defined as FEV1 (forced expiratory volume in 1 second) and FVC (forced vital capacity) less than 80 per cent. Restrictive lung disease may be caused by alterations in lung parenchyma or because of a disease of the pleura, chest wall, or neuromuscular apparatus.
Increased susceptibility to aspiration pneumonia, defined as pneumonia due to breathing in foreign material, as manifested by a medical history of repeated episodes of aspiration pneumonia.

JT: 全身性ミオクローヌス発作
DEF: A generalized myoclonic seizure is a type of generalized motor seizure characterised by bilateral, sudden, brief (<100 ms) involuntary single or multiple contraction of muscles or muscle groups of variable topography (axial, proximal limb, distal). Myoclonus is less regularly repetitive and less sustained than is clonus.

JT: 上運動ニューロン異常
DEF: Any structural anomaly that affects the upper motor neuron.
An abnormality of the spinal cord (myelon).

JT: 高トリグリセリド血症
DEF: An abnormal increase in the level of triglycerides in the blood.

JT: 尿中硫酸ヘパラン排泄
DEF: An increased concentration of heparan sulfates in the urine.

JT: 中枢神経髄鞘形成遅延
DEF: Delayed myelination in the central nervous system.

JT: ニューロン移動の異常
DEF: An abnormality resulting from an anomaly of neuronal migration, i.e., of the process by which neurons travel from their origin to their final position in the brain.
Moderate mental retardation is defined as an intelligence quotient (IQ) in the range of 35-49.
Myokymia consists of involuntary, fine, continuous, undulating contractions that spread across the affected striated muscle.

JT: ロイコジストロフィー
DEF: Leukodystrophy refers to deterioration of white matter of the brain resulting from degeneration of myelin sheaths in the CNS. Their basic defect is directly related to the synthesis and maintenance of myelin membranes.

JT: 運動ニューロンの異常
DEF: Any structural anomaly that affects the motor neuron.

A functional anomaly of the upper motor neuron. The upper motor neurons are neurons of the primary motor cortex which project to the brainstem and spinal chord via the corticonuclear, corticobulbar and corticospinal (pyramidal) tracts. They are involved in control of voluntary movements. Dysfunction leads to weakness, impairment of fine motor movements, spasticity, hyperreflexia and abnormal pyramidal signs.

JT: オリーブ核橋小脳萎縮
DEF: Neuronal degeneration in the cerebellum, pontine nuclei, and inferior olivary nucleus.

JT: 音韻的短期記憶の不足

DEF: An abnormality of the vasculature.

JT: 脊椎骨端骨幹端異形成
外傷による無痛性骨折
DEF: An increased tendency to fractures following trauma, with fractures occurring without pain.
Unusual prominence of the median palatal raphe, which is the ridge formed by the fusion of the two plates of the skull that form the hard palate.
Increased susceptibility to bacterial infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of bacterial infection.

JT: リンパ球アポトーシス障害
DEF: A reduction in the rate of apoptosis in lymphocytes.
A lymph node abnormality.
Cleft lip and cleft palate affecting both sides of the face.

ET: Respiratory insufficiency due to muscle weakness
JT: 筋虚弱による呼吸不全
免疫不全による骨髄炎
先天性多発性関節拘縮
DEF: Multiple congenital contractures in different body areas.

ET: Absence of lymph node germinal center
JT: リンパ節胚中心の異常
DEF: Absence of germinal centers in lymph nodes. Germinal centers are the parts of lymph nodes in which B lymphocytes proliferate, differentiate, mutate through somatic hypermutation and class switch during antibody responses.

JT: 頭と頸部の傍神経節腫
頭と頸部の傍神経節腫
突然無呼吸エピソード
DEF: Recurrent bouts of sudden, severe apnea that may be life-threatening.

JT: 肝トランスアミナーゼ上昇
DEF: Elevations of the levels of SGOT and SGPT in the serum. SGOT (serum glutamic oxaloacetic transaminase) and SGPT (serum glutamic pyruvic transaminase) are transaminases primarily found in the liver and heart and are released into the bloodstream as the result of liver or heart damage. DEF: This term applies to all changes in bone mineral density which (depending on severity) can be seen on x-rays as a change in density and or structure of the bone. Changes may affect all bones of the organism, just certain bones or only parts of bones and include decreased mineralisation as may be seen in osteoporosis or increased mineralisation and or ossification as in osteopetrosis, exostoses or any kind of atopic calicfications of different origin and distribution. The overall amount of mineralization of the bone-organ can be measured as the amount of matter per cubic centimeter of bones, usually measured by densitometry of the lumbar spine or hip. The measurements are usually reported as g/cm3 or as a Z-score (the number of standard deviations above or below the mean for the patient's age and sex). Note that measurement with this method does not reflect local changes in other bones, and as such might not be correct with regard the hole bone-organ.

DEF: The term Maturity-onset diabetes of the young (MODY) was initially used for patients diagnosed with fasting hyperglycemia that could be treated without insulin for more than two years, where the initial diagnosis was made at a young age (under 25 years). Thus, MODY combines characteristics of type 1 diabetes (young age at diagnosis) and type 2 diabetes (less insulin dependence than type 1 diabetes). The term MODY is now most often used to refer to a group of monogenic diseases with these characteristics. Here, the term is used to describe hyperglycemia diagnosed at a young age with no or minor insulin dependency, no evidence of insulin resistence, and lack of evidence of autoimmune destruction of the beta cells.

DEF: A swan neck deformity describes a finger with a hyperextended PIP joint and a flexed DIP joint. The most common cause for a swan neck-like deformity is a disruption of the end of the extensor tendon. Conditions that loosen the PIP joint and allow it to hyperextend, for example conditions that weaken the volar plate, can produce a swan neck deformity of the finger. One example is rheumatoid arthritis. Another cause are conditions that tighten up the small (intrinsic) muscles of the hand and fingers, for example hand trauma or nerve disorders, such as cerebral palsy, Parkinson's disease, or stroke.

DEF: A less than normal number of sternal ossification centers. The sternum is initially formed from bilateral sternal plates that chondrify and begin to fuse with ribs at 10 weeks gestational age. The number of ossification centers vary up to six, and it is the ossification centers that are visualized by prenatal ultrasound. This term describes a reduction in the number of ossification centers compared with age-related norms.

Any structural anomaly of a cerebral artery. The cerebral arteries comprise three main pairs of arteries and their branches, which supply the cerebrum of the brain. These are the anterior cerebral artery, the middle cerebral artery, and the posterior cerebral artery.

ET: Complete duplication of distal phalanx of the thumb
