JT: 母指基節骨の完全重複
DEF: Complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of the thumb. On x-ray two separate bones appear side to side. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

JT: 母指指骨の骨融解病変
DEF: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of one or more phalanges of the thumb.

ET: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
JT: 母指末節骨骨端の異常
DEF: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb. This epiphysis is located on the proximal end of the phalanx.

ET: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
JT: 母指基節骨骨端の異常
DEF: This term applies if the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb, which is located at the proximal end of the phalanx, does not appear in concordance with gender and age dependant norms as seen on x-rays. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

ET: Small epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
JT: 小さい母指基節骨骨端
DEF: Abnormally small size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the proximal phalanx of the thumb with respect to age-dependent norms.

DEF: Abnormally small size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the distal phalanx of the thumb with respect to age-dependent norms.

JT: 母指のブラケット骨端
DEF: An abnormality of the thumb in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.

JT: 母指のブラケット骨端
DEF: An abnormality of the thumb in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.

DEF: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in one or more of the epiphyses of the thumb.

A form of diabetes insipidus caused by failure of the kidneys to respond to vasopressin (AVP).
Abnormally wide (broad) distal phalanx of finger.
Increased width of the middle phalanx of finger.
Increased width of the middle phalanx of finger.

DEF: Short distance from the end of the finger to the most distal interphalangeal crease or the distal interphalangeal joint flexion point. That is, hypoplasia of one or more of the distal phalanx of finger.
This term applies if one or more of the phalanges of the hand are either partially duplicated, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance of the phalanges, or completely duplicated.

ET: Complete duplication of the proximal phalanges of the hand
JT: 指の基節骨の完全重複
DEF: A complete duplication affecting one or more of the proximal phalanges of the hand. As opposed to a partial duplication were there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones, a complete duplication leads to two separate bones appearing side to side (radio-ulnar axis) as seen on x-rays. A duplication leading to an accesory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, this is actually a different entity called a Pseudoepiphyses (see according terms) sometimes also referred to as Hyperphalangism.

ET: Complete duplication of the distal phalanges of the hand

As opposed to a partial duplication were there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones, a complete duplication leads to two separate bones appearing side to side (radio-ulnar axis) as seen on x-rays. A duplication leading to an accessory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, this is actually a different entity called a pseudoepiphysis (see corresponding terms) sometimes also referred to as hyperphalangism.

This term applies to abnormalities affecting the proximal phalanx of the hallux.

DEF: Bracket epiphysis refers to an abnormality in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.

JT: 指の指骨のの円錐骨端
DEF: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphyses of the fingers of the hand, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. The related entity 'angel-shaped' epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of a phalanx.

DEF: One or more bent (flexed) joints of the third toe that cannot be straightened actively or passively.
Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the phalanges of the second toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.
Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the phalanges of the third toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.
Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the phalanges of the fourth toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.
Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the phalanges of the fifth toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.

JT: 一次孔心房中隔欠損症
DEF: An ostium primum atrial septal defect is located in the most anterior and inferior aspect of the atrial septum. The ostium primum refers to an anterior and inferior opening (ostium) within the septum primum, which divides the rudimentary atrium during fetal development. The ostium primum is normally sealed by fusion of the superior and inferior endocardial cushions around 5 weeks' gestation. Ostium primum defects result from a failure of the fusion of the embryologic endocardial cushion and septum primum.

ET: Abnormality of the heme biosynthetic pathway
JT: ヘム生合成経路の異常
DEF: An abnormality in the synthesis or catabolism of heme. Heme is composed of ferrous iron and protoporphyrin IX and is an essential molecule as the prosthetic group of hemeproteins such as hemoglobin, myoglobin, mitochondrial and microsomal cytochromes.
The ability of the knee joint to extend beyond its normal range of motion (the lower leg is moved beyond a straight position with respect to the thigh).

JT: 一過性全般的記憶喪失
DEF: A paroxysmal, transient loss of memory function with preservation of immediate recall and remote memory but with a severe impairment of memory for recent events and ability to retain new information.

JT: 早発性骨端骨幹端癒合
DEF: Stop of growth at the epiphyseal plate the hyaline cartilage plate in the metaphysis at each end of a long bone, at an earlier than normal age, resulting in growth arrest and shortening of the involved bone.

ET: Abnormality of the distal femoral epiphysis
JT: 遠位大腿骨骨端の異常
DEF: Any abnormality of the distal epiphysis of the femur.

ET: Abnormality of the proximal humeral epiphysis
JT: 近位上腕骨骨端の異常
DEF: Any abnormality of the proximal epiphysis of the humerus.

ET: Abnormality of the distal humeral epiphysis
JT: 遠位上腕骨骨端の異常
DEF: Any abnormality of the distal epiphysis of the humerus.

JT: 角化嚢胞性歯源性腫瘍
DEF: A benign uni- or multicystic, intraosseous tumor of odontogenic origin, with a characteristic lining of parakeratinized stratified squamous epithelium and potential for aggressive, infiltrative behaviour.

JT: 結膜アミロイドーシス
DEF: A form of amyloidosis that affects the conjunctiva.

JT: 免疫グロブリン値異常
DEF: An abnormal deviation from normal levels of immunoglobulins in blood.
Abnormal prominence of the corneal nerve fibers.

Tumor-like growths that consist of replacement of the medullary bone with fibrous tissue, causing the expansion and weakening of the areas of bone involved. Especially when involving the skull or facial bones, the lesions can cause externally visible deformities. The skull is often, but not necessarily, affected, and any other bone or bones may be involved. Fibrous dysplasia can either effect isolated bones (Monostotic fibrous dysplasia) or also generalized all bones of the body (Polyostotic fibrous dysplasia).

JT: 部分的肺静脈還流異常
DEF: A form of anomalous pulmonary venous return in which not all pulmonary veins drain abnormally. Partial anomalous pulmonary venous return frequently involves one or both of the veins from one lung.

Reduced bulkiness of the crease or fold of skin running from the lateral margin of the nose, where nasal base meets the skin of the face, to a point just lateral to the corner of the mouth (cheilion or commissure).

JT: テント状上口唇唇紅部
DEF: Triangular appearance of the oral aperture with the apex in the midpoint of the upper vermilion and the lower vermilion forming the base.
More than two clockwise hair whorls.
A reduced ability to discriminate between different temperatures.

JT: 周期性複合を伴う脳波
DEF: Periodically occurring generalized periodic complexes.

JT: 周期性異常を伴う脳波
DEF: Periodically recurring abnormalities in the EEG.
A kind of breech presentation in which one or both hips are extended and one or both of the fetus' feet are pointing down and entering the birth canal.
A type of motor delay characterized by a delay in acquiring the ability to control the fingers and hands.

JT: サルコシン代謝の異常
DEF: An deviation from the normal concentration of sarcosine in the blood circulation.

JT: スレオニン代謝の異常
DEF: Any deviation from the normal concentration of threonine in the blood circulation.

JT: メチオニン代謝の異常
DEF: Any deviation from the normal concentration of methionine in the blood circulation.

JT: グルタミン代謝の異常
DEF: Any deviation from the normal concentration of glutamine in the blood circulation.

JT: ヒスチジン代謝の異常
アルギニン代謝の異常
DEF: Any deviation from the normal concentration of arginine in the blood circulation.

JT: システイン代謝の異常
DEF: An abnormality of a cysteine metabolic process.

JT: キサンチン代謝の異常
DEF: An increased level of xanthine in the blood circulation.
The presence of dilatation of the renal pelvis.
A form of hydrocephalus in which the flow of cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) within the cerebral ventricular system or in the outlets of the CSF to the arachnoid space is obstructed.
The presence of microscopic cystic masses of nonfunctioning pulmonary tissue that lack an obvious communication with the tracheobronchial tree.

JT: 長鎖脂肪酸代謝の異常
DEF: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a long-chain fatty acid in the blood circulation.

JT: フィタン酸代謝の異常
DEF: Any deviation from the normal concentration of phytanic acid in the blood circulation.

JT: カルニチン代謝の異常
DEF: Any deviation from the normal concentration of carnitine in the blood circulation.

JT: 骨髄球系白血球の異常
DEF: An abnormality of myeloid leukocytes.

JT: 外因系凝固経路の異常
DEF: An abnormality of the extrinsic pathway (also known as the tissue factor pathway) of the coagulation cascade.

JT: 内因系凝固経路の異常
DEF: An abnormality of the intrinsic pathway (also known as the contact activation pathway) of the coagulation cascade.

JT: 骨ミネラル濃度の増加
DEF: An abnormal increase of bone mineral density, that is, of the amount of matter per cubic centimeter of bones which is often referred to as osteosclerosis. Osteosclerosis can be detected on radiological examination as an increased whiteness (density) of affected bones.

JT: 骨ミネラル濃度の増加
DEF: An abnormal increase of bone mineral density, that is, of the amount of matter per cubic centimeter of bones which is often referred to as osteosclerosis. Osteosclerosis can be detected on radiological examination as an increased whiteness (density) of affected bones.

JT: 尿中ブドウ糖濃度異常
DEF: An abnormality of the concentration of glucose in the urine.
An abnormality in a cellular process.

JT: ムコ多糖類代謝の異常
DEF: An abnormality of the metabolism of mucopolysaccharide.
An altered ability of the kidneys to void urine and/or specific substances.

ET: Agenesis of permanent maxillary central incisor
JT: 永久歯上顎門歯無発生
DEF: Agenesis of upper secondary incisor.

ET: Agenesis of permanent mandibular central incisor
JT: 永久歯下顎門歯無発生
DEF: Agenesis of lower secondary incisor.

ET: Agenesis of primary maxillary lateral incisor
JT: 乳歯上顎側切歯無発生
DEF: Agenesis of one or more maxillary lateral incisor, comprising the maxillary lateral primary incisor.
Agenesis of maxillary premolar.

JT: 永久歯臼歯形態の異常
DEF: An abnormality of morphology of permanent molar.

JT: 歯エナメル質低石灰化
DEF: A form of hypomineralization of enamel characterized by reduced calcification.

JT: 反復性アフタ性口内炎
DEF: Recurrent episodes of ulceration of the oral mucosa, typically presenting as painful, sharply circumscribed fibrin-covered mucosal defects with a hyperemic border.

JT: ケモカイン分泌の異常
DEF: An abnormality in the production or cellular release of a chemokine (a class of cytokines).
Any morphological abnormality of the skin.
Any abnormality of the physiological function of the skin.

JT: 真皮メラノソーム異常
DEF: An abnormality of the melanosomes, i.e., of the cellular organelles in which melanin pigments are synthesized and stored within melanocytes (the cells that produce pigment in the dermis).

JT: 年齢関連性皮質白内障
DEF: A type of age-related cataract that primarily affects the cortex of the lens.

JT: 焦点性棘波を伴う脳波
DEF: EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec.

JT: 焦点性棘波を伴う脳波
DEF: EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec.

JT: 焦点性棘波を伴う脳波
DEF: EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave.

JT: 振幅の変化を伴う脳波
DEF: EEG with abnormal amplitude.

JT: 片側ヒプスアリスミア
DEF: Hypsarrhythmia occurring in one hemisphere.

ET: Tragal bridge of crus of helix
DEF: The anterior origin of the crus encompasses the superior margin of the tragus, the crus overrides the upper portion of the conchal cavum and ends at the antihelix.

ET: EEG with occipital sharp slow waves
JT: 後頭棘除波を伴う脳波
DEF: EEG with sharp slow waves in the occipital region. Sharp slow waves are focal sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec followed by a slow wave.

ET: EEG with temporal sharp slow waves
JT: 側頭棘除波を伴う脳波
DEF: EEG with sharp slow waves in the temporal region. Sharp slow waves are focal sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec followed by a slow wave.
EEG with sharp waves in the occipital region, i.e., sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec.

JT: 焦点性棘波を伴う脳波
DEF: EEG with sharp waves in the frontal region, i.e., sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec.

JT: 単一冠状縫合早期癒合
DEF: Synostosis affecting only one of the coronal sutures.

JT: 単一人字縫合早期癒合
DEF: Premature synostosis of only one lambdoid suture.

JT: 汎頭蓋骨縫合早期癒合
DEF: Craniosynostosis of all calvarial sutures.
Any anomaly of a cranial suture, that is one of the six membrane-covered openings in the incompletely ossified skull of the fetus or newborn infant.

JT: 軽度の全般性発達遅滞
DEF: A mild delay in the achievement of motor or mental milestones in the domains of development of a child.

JT: 重度の全般性発達遅滞
DEF: A severe delay in the achievement of motor or mental milestones in the domains of development of a child.
A mild delay in the acquisition of the ability to use language to communicate needs, wishes, or thoughts.

JT: 後天性毛髪パターン異常
DEF: An abnormality of the distribution of hair growth that is acquired during the course of life.

JT: 反復性皮膚カビ感染症
DEF: Increased susceptibility to cutaneous fungal infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of cutaneous fungal infections.
Aplasia of the internal auditory canal.
Reduction in diameter of the internal auditory canal.

JT: 末梢神経髄鞘形成遅延
DEF: Delayed myelination in the peripheral nervous system.

JT: 末梢神経髄鞘形成遅延
DEF: Delayed myelination in the peripheral nervous system.

JT: 小児期発症短肢低身長
乳児期発症短躯低身長
DEF: A type of disproportionate short stature characterized by a short trunk but a average-sized limbs with onset in infancy.

On prenatal ultrasound, the nasal bone is a thin echogenic line within the bridge of the fetal nose. The fetus is imaged facing the transducer with the fetal face strictly in the midline. The angle of insonation is 90 degrees, with the longitudinal axis of the nasal bone as the reference line. Calibres are placed at each end of the nasal bone. Absence of the nasal bone or measurements below 2.5th percentile are considered significant (PMID:16100637).

JT: アルコール誘発性横紋筋融解
DEF: Rhabdomyolysis induced by intake of alcohol.

JT: 中枢性運動機能の異常
DEF: An anomaly of the control or production of movement in the central nervous system.

JT: アテトーゼ性脳性麻痺
DEF: A type of cerebral palsy characterized by slow, involuntary muscle movement and mixed muscle tone.

ET: Reduced number of corneal endothelial cells
JT: 角膜内皮細胞数の減少
DEF: A reduction in the number of corneal endothelial cells.

JT: 黄斑の脈絡膜血管新生
DEF: Choroidal neovascularization (CNV) is the creation of new blood vessels in the choroid layer of the eye.

ET: Congenitally corrected transposition of the great arteries
JT: 先天性修正大血管転位
DEF: The essence of the lesion is the combination of discordant atrioventricular and ventriculo-arterial connections. Thus, the morphologically right atrium is connected to a morphologically left ventricle across the mitral valve, with the left ventricle then connected to the pulmonary trunk. The morphologically left atrium is connected to the morphologically right ventricle across the tricuspid valve, with the morphologically right ventricle connected to the aorta.

JT: 静脈洞心房中隔欠損症
DEF: An interatrial communication caused by a deficiency of the common wall between the superior vena cava (SVC) and the right-sided pulmonary veins. SVASD is commonly associated with anomalous pulmonary venous connection (APVC) of some or all of the pulmonary veins, which produces additional left-to-right shunting.
A type of ectopia cordis with the heart partially in the cervical region with a defect of the superior portion of the sternum.

JT: 心尖部の異常な方向性
DEF: Abnormal plane of direction of the heart from the base to the apex. Left sided is normal.
Non-continuity of the aortic arch with an atretic point or absent segment at the level of the isthmus.
Non-continuity of the aortic arch with an atretic point or absent segment between the left carotid and subclavian arteries.
Non-continuity of the aortic arch with an atretic point or absent segment between the innominate and left carotid arteries.

An abnormality of the pulmonary situs, i.e., of the sidedness of the morphological right and left lungs, which is defined by characteristics such as the number of lobes per lung and the relationship of the pulmonary arteries to their bronchi.
An abnormality of the abdominal situs, i.e., of the sidedness of the abdomen and its organs.

ET: Partial right sided absence of pericardium
JT: 部分的右側心外膜欠損
DEF: A congenital anomaly with lack of part of the pericardium on the righthand side of the heart.

ET: Partial left sided absence of pericardium
JT: 部分的左側心外膜欠損
DEF: A congenital anomaly with lack of part of the pericardium on the lefthand side of the heart.

ET: Patent ductus arteriosus after premature birth
JT: 早産後の動脈管開存症
DEF: Abnormal persistent patency of the ductus arteriosus when birth was at less than 37 weeks completed gestation.

JT: 非制限的心室中隔欠損
DEF: Any ventricular septal defect (VSD) that does not restrict flow across it sufficiently to generate a pressure gradient between the two sides of the VSD.

JT: 心房リエントリ性頻拍

DEF: Conduction block in the anterior division of the left bundle branch of the bundle of His.

Junctional ectopic tachycardia (JET) is a unique type of supraventricular arrhythmia defined by narrow QRS complex and atrioventricular (AV) dissociation or retrograde atrial conduction in a 1:1 pattern.

ET: Supracardiac total anomalous pulmonary venous connection
JT: 心上総肺静脈還流異常
DEF: Type 1 total anomalous pulmonary venous connection.

ET: Infracardiac total anomalous pulmonary venous connection
JT: 心内総肺静脈還流異常
DEF: Type 3 total anomalous pulmonary venous connection.

JT: 多源性多巣性心房頻拍
中枢性感覚機能の異常
DEF: An abnormality of sensation related to CNS function. Assuming the primary sensory modalities are intact and the patient is alert and cooperative, the presence of an abnormality of sensory function may indicate a lesion of a parietal cortex, the thalamocortical projections to the parietal cortex, or the spinal cord.

JT: 非分泌性副腎皮質腺腫
DEF: An hormonally inactive adrenocortical adenoma, that is, an adenoma that does not secrete excessive amounts of adrenal hormones.
Abnormal development of the neurohypophysis during embryonic growth and development.
Underdevelopment of the neurohypophysis.
Presence of persistent islands of renal blastema in the postnatal kidney, anywhere within a renal lobe (a portion of a kidney consisting of a renal pyramid and the renal cortex above it).

JT: 尿中ヒポキサンチン増加
DEF: An increased level of hypoxanthine in the urine.
An abnormality of one or more of the set of bones that make up the facial skeleton.

JT: 水平のヒダを伴う下顎
DEF: Horizontal crease or fold situated below the vermilion border of the lower lip and above the fatty pad of the chin, with the face at rest.
Average platelet volume above the upper limit of the normal reference interval.

JT: 急性播種性血管内凝固
DEF: An acute form of disseminated intravascular coagulation. Acute DIC can occur following sudden exposure of blood to procoagulants, with the compensatory hemostatic mechanisms becoming overwhelmed.

JT: 血漿総カルニチン減少
DEF: A decreased concentration of total carnitine in the blood.

JT: 肝の結節性再生過形成
DEF: Diffuse benign transformation of the hepatic parenchyma into small regenerative nodules with minimal or no fibrosis.

JT: シトルリン代謝の異常
DEF: Any deviation from the normal concentration of citrulline in the blood circulation.

JT: 黄体形成ホルモン上昇
DEF: An elevated concentration of luteinizing hormone in the blood.

JT: 大脳アミロイド血管症
DEF: Amyloid deposition in the walls of leptomeningeal and cortical arteries, arterioles, and less often capillaries and veins of the central nervous system.

JT: 尿中カテコラミン上昇
DEF: An increased concentration of catecholamine in the urine.

JT: 靭帯組織の異所性骨化
DEF: Formation of abnormal bony tissue within ligament tissue.

JT: 全般性棘波を伴う脳波
DEF: EEG with generalized sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec.

JT: 焦点性棘波を伴う脳波
DEF: EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec in the frontal region.

JT: 頭頂焦点性棘波を伴う脳波
DEF: EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec in the parietal region.

JT: 側頭焦点性棘波を伴う脳波
DEF: EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec in the temporal region.

JT: オルニチン代謝の異常
DEF: Deviation from the normal concentration of ornithine in the blood circulation.
Wasting of the sternocleidomastoid muscle, the muscle in the anterior part of the neck that acts to flex and rotate the head.

JT: アスピリン誘発性喘息
DEF: A type of asthma in which aspirin and other nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) that inhibit cyclooxygen-ase 1 (COX-1) exacerbate bronchoconstriction.
A type of melanoma that is flat and irregular in shape and color, with different shades of black and brown.

JT: 尿中硫酸ケラタン排泄
DEF: An increased concentration of keratan sulfate in the urine.

JT: 中枢性運動伝達の異常
DEF: Any anomaly of the conduction of motor nerve impulses in the central nervous system.

JT: 血清クレアチニン減少
DEF: An abnormally reduced amount of creatinine in the blood.

JT: 原発性開放隅角緑内障
DEF: A type of glaucoma defined by an open, normal appearing anterior chamber angle and raised intraocular pressure,

JT: 原発性閉塞隅角緑内障
DEF: A type of glaucomatous optic neuropathy in an eye that has evidence of angle closure (i.e. significant iridotrabecular contact).

JT: 原発性閉塞隅角緑内障
DEF: A type of glaucomatous optic neuropathy in an eye that has evidence of angle closure (i.e. significant iridotrabecular contact).

JT: メトヘモグロビン血症
DEF: Abnormally increased levels of methemoglobin in the blood. In this form of hemoglobin, there is an oxidized ferric iron (Fe +3) rather than the reduced ferrous form (Fe 2+) that is normally found in hemoglobin. Methemoglobin has a reduced affinity for oxygen, resulting in a reduced ability to release oxygen to tissues.

ET: Abnormality of bone marrow stromal cells
JT: 骨髄細胞幹細胞の異常
異形成生赤血球系造血
異形成生顆粒球系造血

ET: Abnormality of multiple cell lineages in the bone marrow
JT: 骨髄の多細胞系の異常
低トリグリセリド血症
DEF: An decrease in the level of triglycerides in the blood.

JT: 過形成性結腸ポリープ症
DEF: Presence of multiple hyperplastic polyps in the colon. Hyperplastic polyps are generally about 5 mm in size and show hyperplastic mucosal proliferation.

JT: 収縮性正中神経ニューロパチー
DEF: Injury to the median nerve caused by its entrapment at the wrist as it traverses through the carpal tunnel. Clinically, constrictive median neuropathy is characterized by pain, paresthesia, and weakness in the median nerve distribution of the hand.

JT: 未分化大細胞型リンパ腫
DEF: A type of T-cell lymphoma that is characterized by so-called hallmark cells with a pleomorphic appearance that express the CD30 antigen, are lobulated, and have indented nuclei.

JT: 若年性結腸ポリープ症
DEF: The presence of more than 5 juvenile polyps of the colon. The term juvenile polyps refer to a special histopathology and not the age of onset as the polyp might be diagnosed at all ages. The juvenile polyp has a spherical appearance and is microscopically characterized by overgrowth of an oedematous lamina propria with inflammatory cells and cystic glands.

JT: プロトロンビンの異常
DEF: An anomaly of clotting factor II, which is known as prothrombin, a vitamin K-dependent proenzyme that functions in the blood coagulation cascade.

JT: 血清胆汁酸濃度の増加
DEF: An increase in the concentration of bile acid in the blood.

JT: 胞巣状軟部横紋筋肉腫
DEF: A type of soft tissue sarcoma with a histological appearance reminiscent of alveoli because of its reticulated fibrous stroma enclosing groups of sarcoma cells, which resemble epithelial cells and are enclosed in alveoli walled with connective tissue.

JT: 薬剤誘発性無顆粒球症
DEF: A type of agranulocytosis related to ingestion of a specific medication.

JT: 筋グリコーゲン量減少
DEF: A decreased amount of glycogen in muscle tissue.

JT: 上気道閉塞エピソード
DEF: Intermittent episodes of increased resistance to the passage of air in the upper airway.

JT: 小さい遠位大腿骨骨端
DEF: Reduced size of the Distal epiphysis of femur.

JT: 小さい遠位大腿骨骨端
DEF: Reduced size of the Distal epiphysis of femur.
An anomaly of the arch of aorta.

JT: 皮膚アミロイドーシス
DEF: The presence of amyloid deposition in the superficial dermis.

JT: 睡眠時ミオクローヌス
DEF: Myoclonus that occurs during the initial phases of sleep.

JT: 慢性骨髄単球性白血病
DEF: A myelodysplastic/myeloproliferative neoplasm which is characterized by persistent monocytosis, absence of a Philadelphia chromosome and BCR/ABL fusion gene, fewer than 20 percent blasts in the bone marrow and blood, myelodysplasia, and absence of PDGFRA or PDGFRB rearrangement.

JT: ホメオスターシス異常
DEF: An anomaly in the processes involved in the maintenance of an internal equilibrium.

JT: タンパクのグリコシル化異常
DEF: An anomaly of a protein glycosylation process, i.e., of a protein modification process that results in the addition of a carbohydrate or carbohydrate derivative unit to a protein amino acid, e.g. the addition of glycan chains to proteins.

JT: 尿中クエン酸濃度異常
DEF: A deviation from normal of the concentration of citrate(3-) in the urine.

JT: 副腎皮質性思春期早発
DEF: Onset of adrenarche at an earlier age than usual.

JT: 胎便で汚染された羊水
DEF: Amniotic fluid containing the earliest stools of a mammalian infant.
Congenital lack of the skin of prepuce of penis, that is, of the double-layered fold of skin and mucous membrane that covers the glans penis.
Reduction in length of the ventral (lower) skin of prepuce of penis.

JT: 両側性手関節屈曲拘縮
DEF: A chronic loss of wrist joint motion on the right and left sides.

JT: 片側性手関節屈曲拘縮
DEF: A chronic loss of wrist joint motion on one side only.

JT: 側頭骨下顎関節捻髪音
DEF: Noises from the temporomandibular joint during mandibular movement (e.g., chewing). Temporomandibular joint crepitus is often described as a clicking, popping, grating sound.

JT: 下垂体の異常なサイズ
DEF: A deviation from the normal size of the pituitary gland.
An abnormally decreased amount of thyroxin-binding globulin (TBG) in blood. TBG is responsible for carrying the thyroid hormones thyroxine (T4) and 3,5,3'-triiodothyronine (T3) in the bloodstream.

JT: びまん性視神経杯蒼白
DEF: A pale yellow discoloration of the entire optic disc.

A deviation from the normal contents of the platelet alpha granules, which normally contain hemostatic proteins such as fibrinogen, von Willebrand factor, and growth factors such as platelet-derived growth factor.

JT: 高密度顆粒内容の異常
DEF: A deviation from the normal contents of the platelet alpha granules, which normally contain adenosine triphosphate (ATP), adenosine diphosphate (ADP), serotonin, calcium, and pyrophosphate, which are secreted when platelets are activated.

JT: 高密度顆粒内容の異常
DEF: A deviation from the normal contents of the platelet alpha granules, which normally contain adenosine triphosphate (ATP), adenosine diphosphate (ADP), serotonin, calcium, and pyrophosphate, which are secreted when platelets are activated.

An anomaly in the communication from a neuron to a target across a synapse. This is a four step process, comprising (i) synthesis and storage of neurotransmitters; (ii) neurotransmitter release; (iii) activation of postsynaptic receptors by the neurotransmitter; and (iv) inactivation of the neurotransmitter. Thus, this term is defined as an anomaly of neurotransmitter metabolic process.

JT: 母X染色体不活性化の偏り
DEF: A deviation from equal (50%) inactivation of each parental X chromosome in maternal cells.

JT: 尿中カリウム濃度異常
DEF: An abnormal concentration of potassium(1+) in the urine.
A type of chronic kidney disease with normal or increased glomerular filtration rate (GFR at least 90 mL/min/1.73 m2).
A type of chronic kidney disease with mildly reduced glomerular filtration rate (GFR 60-89 mL/min/1.73 m2).
A type of chronic kidney disease with moderately reduced glomerular filtration rate (GFR 30-59 mL/min/1.73 m2).
A type of chronic kidney disease with severely reduced glomerular filtration rate (GFR 15-29 mL/min/1.73 m2).

ET: Abnormality of the suspensory ligament of lens
JT: 水晶体支持靭帯の異常
DEF: An anomaly of the suspensory ligament of lens, also known as the ciliary zonule. These ligaments represent a series of fibers connecting the ciliary body and lens of the eye, holding the lens in place.

Any anomaly of the inflammatory response, a response to injury or infection characterized by local vasodilation, extravasation of plasma into intercellular spaces and accumulation of white blood cells and macrophages.
Reduced uptake of [18F]-fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) in the thalamus as measured by positron emission tomography (PET) brain scan.

JT: 駆出分画の軽度の減少
DEF: A small reduction in the fraction of blood pumped from the left ventricle with each cardiac cycle. The normal range in adults is at least 50 percent, and a mild reduction is defined as 40-49 percent.

JT: 駆出分画の重度の減少
DEF: A large reduction in the fraction of blood pumped from the left ventricle with each cardiac cycle. The normal range in adults is at over 50 percent, and a severe reduction is defined as less than 30 percent.

ET: Regional left ventricular wall motion abnormality
JT: 領域性左室壁運動異常
DEF: An abnormal motion of a segment of the left ventricle during the cardiac cycle.
A repeated, painful urge to defecate without excreting stool.

ET: Elevated brain lactate level by MRS
DEF: An increase in the level of lactate in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).

JT: 嚢状下行胸部大動脈瘤
DEF: An eccentric abnormal localized widening (dilatation) of the descending thoracic aorta that involves only a portion of the circumference of the vessel wall

JT: 中枢神経髄鞘形成過剰
DEF: Increased amount of myelin in the central nervous system.

JT: 異常なニューロン形態
DEF: A structural anomaly of a neuron.
A deviation from normal of the neurological development of a child, which may include any or all of the aspects of the development of personal, social, gross or fine motor, and cognitive abilities.

JT: 幅広い小脳クモ膜下腔
DEF: An increase in size of the anatomic space between the arachnoid membrane and pia mater in the region surrounding the cerebellum.

JT: 幅広い大脳クモ膜下腔
DEF: An increase in size of the anatomic space between the arachnoid membrane and pia mater in the region surrounding the cerebrum.

Infiltration of smooth muscle-like cells in lymph vessels as well as the lung (pleura, alveolar septa, bronchi, pulmonary vessels and lymphatics as well as lymph nodes, especially in posterior mediastinum and retroperitoneum). Focal emphysema can develop because of airway narrowing, and the thoracic duct may be obliterated. Pulmonary lymphangiomyomatosis may lead to multiple small cysts with a hamartomatous proliferation of smooth muscle in their walls.
A loss of the ability to move the vocal fold on both sides.

JT: 男性生殖細胞形態異常
DEF: A structural anomaly of a male reproductive cell.

JT: 寒冷感受性筋緊張亢進
DEF: An involuntary and painless delay in the relaxation of skeletal muscle following contraction or electrical stimulation that is induced by exposure to cold.

Euryblepharon is a congenital eyelid anomaly characterized by horizontal enlargement of the palpebral fissure. The eyelid is shortened vertically compared with the horizontal dimension, with associated lateral canthal malpositioning and lateral ectropion abnormally wide lid opening.

A swelling formed at the base of umbilicus associated with a patent urachus which results from an allantoic remnant. The urachus is a fibrous remnant of the allantois which communicates from the apex of the urinary bladder to the umbilicus. Failed obliteration of the urachus can lead to various abnormalities: urachal cyst, urachal diverticulum, sinus or patent urachus - the most common type. Allantoic cysts in infants with patent urachus can be formed due to the drainage of urine into the umbilical cord, or in uncommon situations, after leakage of hypo-osmotic urine into the Wharton's jelly.
Epiphyses of the 2nd toe are hard and dense like ivory. Such an epiphysis has a uniformly dense appearance on radiographs.
Epiphyses of the 3rd toe are hard and dense like ivory. Such an epiphysis has a uniformly dense appearance on radiographs.
Epiphyses of the 4th toe are hard and dense like ivory. Such an epiphysis has a uniformly dense appearance on radiographs.
Epiphyses of the 5th toe are hard and dense like ivory. Such an epiphysis has a uniformly dense appearance on radiographs.
Bands of scar-like tisssue that hve formed within a cerebral ventricle.

JT: 膝の風邪になびく変形
DEF: The appearance of abnormal valgus deformity in one knee in association with varus deformity in the other.

JT: 母体高フェニールアラニン結晶
DEF: A medical history of exposure during the fetal period to hyperphenylalaninemia because the mother had phenylketonuria with inadequate control during pregnancy.
The presence of a neoplasm of the adrenal cortex.

JT: グリア細胞(経膠細胞)の異常
DEF: An abnormality of the glia cell.
An abnormality of the soft palate.

JT: 上腕骨橈骨関節の異常
上腕骨尺骨関節の異常
DEF: An anomaly of the joint between the trochlear notch of ulna and the trochlea of humerus, which is part of the elbow joint.

JT: 異常にまっすぐな脊椎
DEF: The absence of the normal curvature of the vertebral column.

ET: Abnormal size of the palpebral fissures
JT: 眼瞼裂の異常なサイズ
DEF: An abnormal size of the palpebral fissures for example unusually long or short palpebral fissures.
Congenital defect with failure of the development of the cerebral white matter.
The presence of premature sister chromatid segregation.

JT: チアノーゼエピソード
中手骨骨端ブラケット

DEF: Asymmetry between the two irides or asymmetry between different parts of one iris.
Repeated episodes of abortion (Expulsion of the product of fertilization before completing the term of gestation) without deliberate interference.

JT: 代謝性アルカローシス
DEF: Metabolic alkalosis is defined as a disease state where the pH is elevated to greater than 7.45 secondary to some metabolic process.

JT: アナフィラキシー性紫斑病
基底核のニューロン喪失
DEF: A reduction in the number of nerve cells in the basal ganglia.
An abnormality of a masseter muscle.
An abnormality of a mentalis muscle.
An abnormality of a procerus.
An abnormality of a risorius muscle.

JT: 頬側脂肪パッドの異常
DEF: An abnormality of a buccal fat pad.
Abnormality of the plexus of the ventral rami of the first four cervical spinal nerves which are located from C1 to C4 cervical segment in the neck.
An abnormality of an odontoid tissue.

JT: 下部甲状腺静脈の異常
DEF: An abnormality of an inferior thyroid vein.
An abnormality of a lacrimal artery.
A structural anomaly of the glomerulus.
Loss of normal subcutaneous fat tissue in the face.
Greater than average forward and/or lateral protrusion of the supraorbital portion of the frontal bones.
An abnormality of the middle ear.

ET: Incomplete partition of the cochlea type II
DEF: IWith incomplete partition II, the cochlea consists of 1.5 turns; the apical and middle cochlea turns are undifferentiated and form a cystic apex. The vestibule is normal while the vestibular aqueduct is always enlarged. Developmental arrest occurs at the seventh week of gestation.
An abnormality of vibrational conductance of sound to the inner ear leading to impairment of sensory perception of sound.
An abnormality of the Ala of nose.
Blockage of the lacrimal duct.

ET: Decreased light- and dark-adapted electroretinogram amplitude
DEF: Descreased amplitude of eletrical response upon electroretinography.
Recurrent obsessions or compulsions that are severe enough to be time consuming (i.e., they take more than 1 hour a day) or cause marked distress or significant impairment (DSM-IV).

JT: 高インスリン血症性低血糖
DEF: An increased concentration of insulin combined with a decreased concentration of glucose in the blood.

JT: 甲状腺機能正常性多結節性甲状腺腫
二次性副甲状腺機能亢進症
DEF: Secondary hyperparathyroidism refers to the production of higher than normal levels of parathyroid hormone in the presence of hypocalcemia.
An abnormality of the structure or form of the diaphysis, i.e., of the main or mid-section (shaft) of a long bone.
An abnormality of one or more metaphysis, i.e., of the somewhat wider portion of a long bone that is adjacent to the epiphyseal growth plate and grows during childhood.
A darkening of the skin related to an increase in melanin production and deposition.

Irregular lines in the deep retina that are typically configured in a radiating fashion and emanate from the optic disc. Angioid streaks are crack-like dehiscences in abnormally thickened and calcified Bruch's membrane, resulting in atrophy of the overlying retinal pigment epithelium. They may be associated with a number of endocrine, metabolic, and connective tissue abnormalities but are frequently idiopathic.
Increased pigmentation of the skin in the region surrounding the orbit of the eye.
The presence of an increased number of twists and turns of the retinal arterioles.

JT: 遠位指趾関節癒合症(手)
DEF: The term distal symphalangism refers to a bony fusion of the distal and middle phalanges of the digits of the hand, in other words the distal interphalangeal joint (DIJ) is missing which can be seen either on x-rays or as an absence of the distal interphalangeal finger creases.
An abnormal structure of the tip (end) of a finger.
Mild intellectual disability is defined as an intelligence quotient (IQ) in the range of 50-69.
Any structural abnormality of the cerebellum.

A mode of inheritance that is observed for dominant traits related to a gene encoded on the X chromosome. In the context of medical genetics, X-linked dominant disorders tend to manifest very severely in affected males. The severity of manifestation in females may depend on the degree of skewed X inactivation.
Separation of the vitreous humor from the retina.

A tall and slim body build with increased arm span to height ratio (>1.05) and a reduced upper-to-lower segment ratio (<0.85), i.e., unusually long arms and legs. The extremities as well as the hands and feet are unusually slim.
An abnormality of fetal movement.
An abnormality of the integument, which consists of the skin and the superficial fascia.

ET: obsolete Vocal cord paralysis (caused by tumor impingement)
obsolete Hoarse voice (caused by tumor impingement)

DEF: A structural anomaly of the muscle layer of the heart wall.

In this case the right ventricle is more muscular than normal, causing a characteristic boot-shaped (coeur-en-sabot) appearance as seen on anterior- posterior chest x-rays. Right ventricular hypertrophy is commonly associated with any form of right ventricular outflow obstruction or pulmonary hypertension, which may in turn owe its origin to left-sided disease. The echocardiographic signs are thickening of the anterior right ventricular wall and the septum. Cavity size is usually normal, or slightly enlarged. In many cases there is associated volume overload present due to tricuspid regurgitation, in the absence of this, septal motion is normal.
Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy with an asymmetrical pattern of hypertrophy, with a predilection for the interventricular septum and myocyte disarray.

JT: 二次口心房中隔欠損症
DEF: A kind of atrial septum defect arising from an enlarged foramen ovale, inadequate growth of the septum secundum, or excessive absorption of the septum primum.
An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall in a coronary artery.
Double outlet right ventricle (DORV) is a type of ventriculoarterial connection in which both great vessels arise entirely or predominantly from the right ventricle.
Bilateral clubfoot deformity (see HP:0001762).
The presence of an increased mass of red blood cells in the circulation.

JT: アンモニア中毒エピソード
頭痛(褐色細胞腫を伴う)
DEF: Repeated episodes of headache with rapid onset, reaching a peak within minutes and of short duration (less than one hour) with pain that is throbbing, pulsating, or bursting in quality.
Congenital absence of the vermis of cerebellum.
A form of hydrocephalus characterized by enlarged cerebral ventricles and normal cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) pressure upon lumbar puncture.

JT: 無意味な語の反復の不足
DEF: Impaired ability to repeat non-word sounds. Nonword repetition (NWR) is a measure of short-term phonological memory.
An abnormality of the peritoneum.
Respiratory difficulty as newborn.

An abnormality of the base of the skull, which forms the floor of the cranial cavity and separates the brain from other facial structures. The skull base is made up of five bones: the ethmoid, sphenoid, occipital, paired frontal, and paired parietal bones, and is subdivided into 3 regions: the anterior, middle, and posterior cranial fossae. The petro-occipital fissure subdivides the middle cranial fossa into 1 central component and 2 lateral components.
Any morphological abnormality of cartilage.
An abnormality of the leg.
An abnormality of the arm.

JT: 抱合型高ビリルビン血症

DEF: An increased amount of nitrogen in the form of urea in the blood.
An increased amount of nitrogen in the form of urea in the blood.
An elevated concentration of low-density lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood.

JT: アルカリホスファターゼ上昇
DEF: Abnormally increased serum levels of alkaline phosphatase activity.
An abnormality of the acetabulum, i.e., the Acetabular part of hip bone, which together with the head of the femur forms the hip joint.
An anomaly of the the pubic bone, i.e., of the ventral and anterior of the three principal components (publis, ilium, ischium) of the hip bone.
An irregular surface of the vertebral end plates, which are normally relatively smooth.
An abnormality related to a defect of vertebral separation during development.

An impairment in the rate and degree to which platelets aggregate after the addition of an agonist that stimulates platelet clumping. Platelet aggregation is measured using aggregometer to measure the optical density of platelet-rich plasma, whereby platelet aggregation causes the plasma to become more transparent.
If positive, the ferric chloride test indicates an increased concentration of phenols in the urine or blood.
Enlargement of the muscles of the calf due to their replacement by connective tissue or fat.

JT: 先天性筋ジストロフィー

DEF: Weakness of the muscles of the pelvic girdle (also known as the hip girdle), that is, lack of strength of the muscles around the pelvis.

JT: 卵形放射線透過性(上腕骨)

DEF: Fracture or fragmentation at the lateral portion of the metaphysis of a long bone. The radiographic appearance is that of a small corner of metaphysis separated from the metaphyseal edge by thin linear radiolucency. This feature can be observed in child abuse but fragmented appearance of the metaphysis or facture-like lesions can also be detected in the setting of certain skeletal dysplasias.
Abnormal increase in width of the epiphyseal growth plate of the radius.
An anomaly of the second finger, also known as the index finger.
An anomaly of the third finger.
An abnormality affecting one or both 5th fingers.
A pathological narrowing in the region above the aortic valve associated with restricted left ventricular outflow.
Inflammation of the alimentary part of the gastrointestinal system.

A functional rather than mechanical obstruction of the intestines, associated with manifestations that resemble those caused by an intestinal obstruction, including distension, abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, constipation or diarrhea, in an individual in whom a mechanical blockage has been excluded.
A congenital defect in the occipital region of the skull, covered by skin of the scalp and containing meninges or remnants of glial or neural tissues.
Increased bone density affecting the bones of the spine (vertebral column).
Sclerosis (increased density) affecting vertebral end plates.
AF that cannot be successfully terminated by cardioversion, and longstanding (more than 1 year) AF, where cardioversion is not indicated or has not been attempted, is termed permanent.
Underdevelopment or reduced size of the heart right ventricle, often due to a reduced number of cells.
The presence of multiple areas of atresia affecting the small intestine.

JT: 先天性再生不良性貧血
DEF: A type of hypoplastic anemia with congenital onset.

JT: 正球性再生不良性貧血
DEF: A type of hypoplastic anemia in which the erythrocytes have a normal cell volume (the mean corpuscular volume is within normal limits).

JT: 急性骨髄単球性白血病
DEF: An acute leukemia characterized by the proliferation of both neutrophil and monocyte precursors.
A type of anemia characterized by an abnormally low concentration of hemoglobin in the erythrocytes and lower than normal size of the erythrocytes.
Reduced platelet count that occurs sporadically, i.e., it comes and goes.
Episodic hyperventilation.
Recurrent bleeding into the parenchyma of the brain.
An elevation in bone density of the cortex of one or more diaphyses. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.
The presence of streaks (bands) of abnormally increased density of metaphyseal bone.
An abnormal localized widening (dilatation) of the aortic arch.
Any structural abnormality of a cardiac atrium.
A sensation of stiffness in the joints that occurs following waking up in the morning.

JT: Helicobacterpylori(ヘリコバクター/ピロリ)感染症
DEF: A recurrent infection of the GI tract with helicobacter pylori, a gram-negative, microaerophilic bacterium usually found in the stomach.

JT: 腺腫性結腸ポリープ症
DEF: Presence of multiple adenomatous polyps in the colon.
The presence of a hypoplastic gallbladder.
Lack of the cartilage of the nasal septum.

JT: 自律神経性膀胱機能障害
DEF: Abnormal bladder function (increased urge or frequency of urination or urge incontinence) resulting from abnormal functioning of the autonomic nervous system.

JT: ヘルペスウイルスへの感受性
DEF: Increased susceptibility to herpesvirus, as manifested by recurrent episodes of herpesvirus.
A reduced level of the complement component C3 in circulation.
The presence of calcium deposition in the falx cerebri.
Bony fusion of malleus, incus, and stapes.
The presence of a sagittal suture (the cranial suture that separates the left and right parietal bones) that is not ossified but rather wide open at an age when it is normally closed.
An abnormality of the epiglottis.

JT: Waldenstromマクログロブリン血症
DEF: Presence of a monoclonal immunoglobulin M protein in the serum.
Increased megakaryocyte number, i.e., of platelet precursor cells, present in the bone marrow.
A reduction in the count of nephrons per kidney.
Abnormal reduction in length of all metacarpal bones.

JT: 新生児骨端点状石灰化
DEF: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in one or more epiphyses during the neonatal period.

JT: 陳旧性|親指OR母指|再生不良性OR形成不全OR無形成

DEF: A dislocation of the head of the radius from its socket in the elbow joint in an ulnar direction.

JT: 対合できる三指節母指
DEF: A form of triphalangeal thumb that can be placed opposite the fingers of the same hand.
Abnormally large size of the metaphyseal epiphyses.
Small/hypoplastic or absent/aplastic fingers.
Reduced number of beta cells in the pancreatic islets of Langerhans.

JT: 平坦な遠位大腿骨骨端
DEF: An abnormal flattening of the distal epiphysis of femur.
Proximal radial shortening owing to a congenital defect of development.
Underdevelopment or shortening of the end of the fibula (calf bone) nearest the knee.
Formation of bone in the patella later than normal.
An abnormal anterior curvature of a long bone.
An abnormality of the pulmonary lymphatic chain.
Abnormal increase in density of the tissue at the costochondral junctions.
A defect of the atrioventricular septum of the heart.
A type of cardiac arrhythmia with premature atrial contractions or beats caused by signals originating from ectopic atrial sites.

JT: 後腹膜ケモデクトーマ

DEF: A rare subtype of acute myeloid leukemia evolving from primitive megakaryoblasts.
Pheochromocytoma not originating from the adrenal medulla but from another source such as from chromaffin cells in or about sympathetic ganglia.

JT: 脱髄性ロイコジストロフィー

DEF: An abnormality of the ability (skills) to perform a precise movement of large muscles with the intent to perform a specific act. Gross motor skills are required to mediate movements of the arms, legs, and other large body parts.

JT: 遅発性筋ジストロフィー

DEF: Fasciculations affecting the tongue muscle and the musculature of the face.
An excessive number of small gyri (convolutions) on the surface of the brain in the frontoparietal region.

JT: 意識下での線維束性収縮

DEF: Hemangioma is a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells. This term refers to facial hemangiomas that have a plaque-like morphology.
The presence of multiple leiomyomas of the skin.
Increased amount of keratin (visible as white scales) surrounding hair follicles.

JT: 発汗性外胚葉形成不全
太陽にあたった領域の色素斑
帯型角膜ジストロフィー
結晶性角膜ジストロフィー

DEF: A type of cataract characterized by punctate, dust-like opacities within the cortical region of the lens.
Nystagmus consisting of horizontal to-and-fro eye movements of equal velocity.

A type of retinal detachment arising due to a combination of contracting retinal membranes, abnormal vitreoretinal adhesions, and vitreous changes. It is usually seen in the context of diseases that induce a fibrovascular response, e.g. diabetes.
Separation of the inner layers of the retina (neural retina) from the pigment epithelium occuring near the outer limit (periphery) of the retina.
Inherited progressive cone degeneration.
Defective ossification in an irregular pattern of the seven bones of the foot comprising the calcaneus, talus, cuboid, navicular, and the cuneiform bones.

JT: 先天性副甲状腺機能低下症
DEF: Deficiency of parathyroid hormone with congenital onset.
Insufficient production of steroid hormones (primarily cortisol) by the adrenal glands as a result of a primary defect in the glands themselves.
A type of adrenal hypoplasia with congenital onset.
The presence of an adenoma of the pancreas with origin in a pancreatic B cell.

JT: 遠位腎尿細管アシドーシス
DEF: A type of renal tubular acidosis characterized by a failure of acid secretion by the alpha intercalated cells of the cortical collecting duct of the distal nephron. The urine cannot be acidified below a pH of 5.3, associated with acidemia and hypokalemia.

JT: 思春期および性腺疾患

DEF: A type of extracapillary glomerulonephritis characterized by the formation of crescent-like cellular proliferation.

JT: 先天性ネフローゼ症候群
DEF: Nephrotic syndrome with onset within the first three months of life.
Presence of a single diverticulum (sac or pouch) in the wall of the urinary bladder.

JT: 目立つ前立腺中葉バー

DEF: The presence of aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of the ear.
Atrophy of the intrinsic muscle groups of the hand, comprising the thenar and hypothenar muscles; the interossei muscles; and the lumbrical muscles.
Underdevelopment of the musculature.
An abnormality of adipose tissue, which is loose connective tissue composed of adipocytes.
Contractures of one ore more joints of the hands meaning chronic loss of joint motion due to structural changes in non-bony tissue.
An uneven increase in bone density of one or more of the phalanges of the thumb.
Absence of one or more epiphyses of the thumb.
An abnormality of the epididymis.

A plaque representing a connective-tissue nevus. Connective tissue naevi are uncommon skin lesions that occur when the deeper layers of the skin do not develop correctly or the components of these layers occur in the wrong proportion. Shagreen patches are oval-shaped and nevoid, skin-colored or occasionally pigmented, smooth or crinkled, The word shagreen refers to a type of roughened untanned leather.

ET: Patchy sclerosis of middle phalanx of finger
DEF: Uneven (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the middle phalanges of the hand.

ET: Patchy sclerosis of proximal phalanx of finger
DEF: Uneven increase in bone density of the proximal phalanges of the hand.
An abnormality of the cerebral cortex with fewer gyri but with normal cortical thickness. This pattern is usually often associated with congenital microcephaly.
An abnormality of the antitragus, which is a small tubercle opposite to the tragus of the ear. The antitragus and the tragus are separated by the intertragic notch.
The presence of remnants of a fetal membrane that persist as strands of tissue crossing the pupil.
Absent first metacarpal (long bone) of the hand.
Absence of the second long bone of the hand.
Absence of the third long bone of the hand.
Absence of the fourth long bone of the hand.
Absence of the fifth long bone of the hand.
Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more phalanges of the big toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.

JT: 趾の骨端のブラケット骨端

DEF: Partial/complete duplication of one or more phalanx of toe.

ET: Patchy sclerosis of distal toe phalanx
DEF: Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the distal phalanges of the toes. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.

ET: Patchy sclerosis of middle toe phalanx
DEF: Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the middle phalanges of the toes. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.
An increase in width of one ore more proximal toe phalanges.

ET: Patchy sclerosis of proximal toe phalanx
DEF: Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the proximal phalanges of the toes. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.
An outpouching of the spinal meninges.
An abnormal morphology of one or more phalanges of the second toe, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.
An abnormal morphology of one or more phalanges of the third toe, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.
An abnormal morphology of one or more phalanges of the fourth toe, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.
An abnormal morphology of one or more phalanges of the fifth toe, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.
The onset of puberty before the age of 8 years in girls.
Abnormal increase in size of the upper limbs (due to an increase of the size of cells).
Abnormal increase in size of the lower limbs (due to an increase of the size of cells).
An abnormal increase in the length of the tibia.
Elevated 7-dehydrocholesterol levels.
The presence of developmental dysplasia of the femoral head.
Absence or underdevelopment of the anterior pituitary gland, also known as the adenohypophysis.
Underdevelopment of the anterior pituitary gland.
An abnormality of the Dura mater.
Mirror image duplication of digits affecting the hands only.
Mirror image duplication of digits affecting the feet.
A Lamellar cataract with a pulverulent (punctate, \

JT: 免疫グロブリン値異常
DEF: An abnormal deviation from normal levels of immunoglobulins in blood.

ET: Cherry red spot of the macula
JT: 黄斑のチェリーレッド斑
DEF: Pallor of the perifoveal macula of the retina with appearance of a small circular reddish choroid shape as seen through the fovea centralis due to relative transparancy of the macula.
Naevus flammeus localised in the skin of the eyelid.
Fibrous dysplasia of the bones were lesions are localized in many bones throughout of the body. Polyostotic fibrous dysplasia is a cardinal feature of McCune-Albright syndrome.
An abnormal distribution of eyebrow hair growth in the medial direction.

An abnormality of the premaxilla, the most anterior part of the maxilla that usually bears the central and lateral incisors and includes the anterior nasal spine and inferior aspect of the piriform rim. The premaxilla contains the bone and teeth of the primary palate.
Underdevelopment of the interstitial (Leydig) cells of the testis. These cells produce testosterone.

Pain is an unpleasant sensation that can range from mild, localized discomfort to agony, whereby the physical part of pain results from nerve stimulation and is often accompanied by an emotional component. This term groups abnormalities in pain sensation presumed to result from abnormalities related to the specific nerve fibers that carry the pain impulses to the brain.

JT: 血清セルロプラスミン減少
DEF: Decreased concentration of ceruloplasmin in the blood.

Complexes of spikes (<70 ms) and sharp waves (70-200 ms), which are sharp transient waves that have a strong association with epilepsy, in cerebral electrical activity recorded along the scalp by electroencephalography (EEG).

An enduring pattern of uncooperative, defiant, and hostile behavior toward authority figures that does not involve major antisocial violations, is not accounted for by the child's developmental stage, and results in significant functional impairment. A certain level of oppositional behavior is common in children and adolescents.
The presence of an abnormally large hypoechoic space in the posterior fetal neck (usually detected on prenatal ultrasound examination).
A type of cataract affecting the anterior pole of lens immediately adjacent to ('beneath') the lens capsule.
An abnormality of the nasal bone, comprising the left nasal bone and the right nasal bone.
An abnormality of the cell cycle.

JT: 反復性アフタ性口内炎
DEF: Recurrent episodes of ulceration of the oral mucosa, typically presenting as painful, sharply circumscribed fibrin-covered mucosal defects with a hyperemic border.

JT: 年齢関連性皮質白内障
DEF: A type of age-related cataract that primarily affects the cortex of the lens.

JT: びまん性促進を伴う脳波
DEF: EEG frequency is abnormally increased.
An abnormal shape of occiput.
Posterior curving of the antihelix from its origin at the antitragus, traveling initially almost perpendicular to the descending helix and obscuring some of the concha.
EEG with sharp waves in the parietal region, i.e., sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec.

JT: 側頭棘波を伴う脳波脳波
DEF: EEG with sharp waves in the temporal region, i.e., sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec.

JT: 軽度の理解できる言語遅滞
DEF: A mild delay in the acquisition of the ability to understand the speech of others.

The cisterna magna is measured on a transaxial view of the fetal head angled 15 degrees caudal to the canthomeatal line. The anterior/posterior diameter is taken between the inferior/posterior surface of the vermis of the cerebellum to the inner surface of the cranium. An enlarged cisternal magna is defined by an anterior/posterior diameter of 10 mm or more (PMID:16100637).
A medical history of exposure of the mother of a child or fetus to a teratogenic substance during pregnancy.
An abnormality of the stroma of cornea, also known as the substantia propria of cornea.
The presence of a single coronary artery ostium from which both coronary arteries arise.
Multifocal atrial tachycardia is a rare supraventricular arrhythmia in neonates and young infants that is characterized by multiple P waves with varying P wave morphology and is usually asymptomatic.
A type of second degree atrioventricular (AV) block characterized by sudden failure to conduct an impulse through the AV node without a preceding change in the PR interval.

Atrioventricular (AV) dissociation is present if the atria and the ventricles are under the control of two separate pacemakers. AV dissociation can occur in the absence of a primary AV conduction disturbance.
An abnormality in the range and ease of motion of joints across their normal range.
A form of adrenal insufficiency related to a lack of ACTH, which leads to a decrease in the production of cortisol by the adrenal glands. Aldosterone production is not usually affected.

JT: 自己免疫性副甲状腺機能低下症
DEF: A type of hypoparathyroidism with circulating antiparathyroid or anti-calcium sensing receptor antibodies indicative of autoimmunity.
Abnormally persistent foci of embryonal immature blastema located in the superficial cortical region (perilobar).

JT: 大脳リポフスチンの増加
DEF: Lipofuscin (age pigment) is a brown-yellow, electron-dense, autofluorescent material that accumulates progressively over time in lysosomes of postmitotic cells, such as neurons and cardiac myocytes. This term pertains if there is an increase in the accumulation of lipofuscin (also known as autofluorescent lipoprotein) more than expected for the age of the patient.
Any anomaly in the formation of the bony substance of the sternum.
An abnormally increased diphosphate(4-) concentration in the blood. Diphosphate(4-), as ester with two phosphate groups, is also known as pyrophosphate.

A type of pleural effusion with a transudate (extravascular fluid with low protein content and a low specific gravity). Pleural effusions can be classified as transudates or exudates based on Light's criteria, which classify an effusion as exudate if one or more of the following are present: (1) the ratio of pleural fluid protein to serum protein is greater than 0.5, (2) the ratio of pleural fluid lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) to serum LDH is greater than 0.6, or (3) the pleural fluid LDH level is greater than two thirds of the upper limit of normal for serum LDH.
Developmental hypoplasia (shortening) of proximal phalanx of toe.
Increased concentration of thiosulfate(2-) in the urine.

JT: 中心焦点性棘波を伴う脳波
DEF: EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec in the central region.

JT: 焦点性棘波を伴う脳波
DEF: EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec in the frontal region.

JT: ミトコンドリア数の異常
DEF: A deviation from the normal number of mitochondria per cell.
Abnormality/dysplasia of a single myeloid cell (erythroid, granulocytic, or megakaryocytic).
An elevated concentration of high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL) in the blood.
An abnormal pigmentation pattern of the external genitalia.
Increased length of the middle phalanx of finger.
Increased length of the distal phalanx of finger.
A reduced level of the complement component C9 in circulation.
An abnormal regulation of the sweat glands by the sympathetic nervous system associated with abnormal perspiration.

An increased degree of femoral version, which is defined as the angular difference between axis of femoral neck and transcondylar axis of the knee. Thus, femoral anteversion is an inward twisting of the femur that causes the knees and feet to turn inward.
Calcification, that is, pathological deposition of calcium salts in the tunica media of arteries.
An anomaly of cerebral veins.
An anomaly of the intracellular membrane complexes known as the dense tubular system.
An anomaly in the amount of force per unit area exerted by the intraocular fluid within the eye.

A functional brain anomaly detectable by positron emission tomography (PET). PET scanning is a method for functional brain imaging, and its measurements reflect the amount of brain activity in the various regions of the brain.
A darker than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the thalamus. This term refers to a localized hypointensity affecting a particular region of the thalamus.
A lighter than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the thalamus. This term refers to a localized hyperintensity affecting a particular region of the thalamus.
A lighter than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the brainstem. This term refers to a localized hyperintensity affecting a particular region of the brainstem.
A darker than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the brainstem. This term refers to a localized hypointensity affecting a particular region of the brainstem.
The presence of atrophy (wasting) of the cerebral white matter.
Chronic loss of joint motion in a finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue.
An anomaly of the process of formation of bone in the humerus.
A morphological abnormality of the optic disc, i.e., of the portion of the optic nerve clinically visible on fundoscopic examination.
Transmission of light through the iris as visualized upon slit lamp examination or infrared iris transillumination videography. The light passes through defects in the pigmentation of the iris.
Decreased strength of the vocal fold on one side.
Any structural anomaly of a reproductive cell.
Muscle hypertrophy affecting the paraspinal muscles.
A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the thyroid gland.
An abnormality of the hair of head.
Abnormality of the growth of the pubic hair. Pubic hair is part of the secondary sexual hair, which normally ensues during puberty.

The carpus consists of the scaphoid, lunate, triquetal, pisiform, captitate, hamate, trapezoid, and trapezium bones. The tarsus consists of the talus, calcaneus, navicular, cuboid, cuneiform, and navicular bones. This term applies if there is any fusion among the bones of the carpus or tarsus.

Atrophy of one side of the brain, characterized by findings including thinning of the cerebral cortex, reduced volume of the cerebral white matter with abnormal myelination, and enlargement of the ispilateral fourth ventricle.
Presence of abundant argyrophilic grains and coiled bodies on microscopic examination of brain tissue.

ET: Abnormality of the vitamin B3 metabolism

DEF: Overgrowth of only one leg.
Overgrowth of only one arm.
A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the adrenal gland.
An abnormality of Sharpey's fibers (bone fibers, or perforating fibers), which are a matrix of connective tissue consisting of bundles of strong collagenous fibres connecting periosteum to bone.
An abnormality of astrocytes.
A bony protrusion present on the midline of the hard palate.
An abnormality in the placement of the ocular globe (eyeball).
An abnormality of a nasalis muscle.

JT: 頬側脂肪パッドの異常
DEF: An abnormality of a buccal fat pad.
An abnormality of the angular artery, the terminal branch of the facial artery.
Any structural abnormality of a lingual artery.
An abnormality of a lingual tonsil.

Multicystic dysplasia of the kidney is characterized by multiple cysts of varying size in the kidney and the absence of a normal pelvicaliceal system. The condition is associated with ureteral or ureteropelvic atresia, and the affected kidney is nonfunctional.

A duplication of the collecting system of the kidney, defined as a kidney with two (instead of, normally, one) pyelocaliceal systems. The pyelocaliceal system is comprised of the renal pelvis and calices. The duplicated renal collecting system can be associated with a single ureter or with double ureters. In the latter case, the two ureters empty separately into the bladder or fuse to form a single ureteral orifice.
The presence of multiple cysts at the border between the renal cortex and medulla.

Any abnormality of the parotid glands, which are the salivary glands that are located in the subcutaneous tissues of the face overlying the mandibular ramus and anterior and inferior to the external ear.
Inability of velopharyngeal sphincter to sufficiently separate the nasal cavity from the oral cavity during speech.
An abnormality of the external ear.
An abnormality of the inner ear.
An abnormality of the nasal tip.
An abnormality of the eyelashes.
A vertical gaze palsy with inability to direct the gaze of the eyes downwards.
An abnormality of the dental enamel.

Difficulty in social interactions related to an impairment of characteristics such as eye contact, smiling, appropriate facial expressions, and body postures and characterized by difficulty in forming peer relationships and forming friendships.
Any abnormality of the diaphragm, the sheet of skeletal muscle that separates the thoracic cavity from the abdominal cavity.
A reduction of skin color related to a decrease in melanin production and deposition.
Severe loss of visual acuity within hours or days. This is characteristic of Leber hereditary optic neuropathy.
A state of abnormally strong desire for sleep during the daytime.
Underdevelopment of the vermis of cerebellum.

Impairment of certain skills such as reading or writing, coordination, self-control, or attention that interfere with the ability to learn. The impairment is not related to a global deficiency of intelligence.
A reduction in the freedom of movement of one or more joints.
An abnormality of the hip joint.

ET: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the musculature of the pelvis

JT: 乳児期の成長障害(成長不全)

DEF: An abnormality of the structure or appearance of the umbilicus.
Enlargement or increased size of the heart left ventricle.
Absence or underdevelopment of the metatarsal bones.
A form of inflammation of the kidney affecting the interstitium of the kidneys surrounding the tubules.
The process of hematopoiesis occurring outside of the bone marrow (in the liver, thymus, and spleen) in the postnatal organisms.
An abnormality of the intestine. The closely related term enteropathy is used to refer to any disease of the intestine.

JT: 誇張されたキューピッドの弓
DEF: More pronounced paramedian peaks and median notch of the Cupid's bow.
An exaggerated startle reaction in response to a sudden unexpected visual or acoustic stimulus, or a quick movement near the face.
Spasticity of one or more muscles innervated by the facial nerve.

A decrease in the ability to perceive vibration. Clinically, this is usually tested with a tuning fork which vibrates at 128 Hz and is applied to bony prominences such as the malleoli at the ankles or the metacarpal-phalangeal joints. There is a slow decay of vibration from the tuning fork. The degree of vibratory sense loss can be crudely estimated by counting the number of seconds that the examiner can perceive the vibration longer than the patient.
Electron-dense granules within double membrane-bound cytoplasmic vacuoles.

JT: オリーブ核橋小脳萎縮
DEF: Neuronal degeneration in the cerebellum, pontine nuclei, and inferior olivary nucleus.
Abnormal intestinal contractions, such as spasms and intestinal paralysis, related to the loss of the ability of the gut to coordinate muscular activity because of endogenous or exogenous causes.
Inflammation of a superficial vein associated with venous thrombosis (blood clot formation within the vein).
A disorder of bone growth affecting the vertebrae and the ends of the long bones (epiphyses).
An abnormality of the frontal sinus, one of the mucosa-lined, normally air-filled paranasal sinuses of the bones of the skull. The frontal sinus is located within the frontal bone.
A chronic, relapsing, inflammatory, and often febrile multisystemic disorder of connective tissue, characterized principally by involvement of the skin, joints, kidneys, and serosal membranes.
Increased susceptibility to infections with Escherichia coli, as manifested by recurrent episodes of infection with this agent.
Chronic reduction in active and passive mobility of the shoulder joint due to structural changes in muscle, tendons, ligaments, or skin that prevents normal movement.

Reduced activity of coagulation factor VIII. Factor VIII (fVIII) is a cofactor in the intrinsic clotting cascade that is activated to fVIIIa in the presence of minute quantities of thrombin. fVIIIa acts as a receptor, for factors IXa and X.

Reduced activity of coagulation factor VIII. Factor VIII (fVIII) is a cofactor in the intrinsic clotting cascade that is activated to fVIIIa in the presence of minute quantities of thrombin. fVIIIa acts as a receptor, for factors IXa and X.

DEF: The presence of abnormal electromyographic patterns indicative of myopathy, such as small-short polyphasic motor unit potentials.
An abnormality of one or more of the vertebrae.

JT: 末梢神経軸索ニューロパチー
DEF: An abnormality characterized by disruption of the normal functioning of peripheral axons.
An abnormally increased diphosphate(4-) concentration in the urine. Diphosphate(4-), as ester with two phosphate groups, is also known as pyrophosphate.
Cellular accumulation of GM2 gangliosides.

A positive response to the regitine blocking test consisting of a substantial reduction in blood pressure following administration of regitine, indicative of the presence of increased levels of epinephrine and norepinephrine in the circulation, which is seen in pheochromocytoma-associated hypertension.

JT: 尿中エピネフリン上昇
DEF: An increased concentration of adrenaline in the urine.

DEF: Absence of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger.

A degree of kidney failure severe enough to require dialysis or kidney transplantation for survival characterized by a severe reduction in glomerular filtration rate (less than 15 ml/min/1.73 m2) and other manifestations including increased serum creatinine.
The presence of a splayed (i.e.,flared) metaphyseal segment of one or more long bones of the arm.
Fusion of two or more bones of the 4th finger.
Fusion of two or more bones of the 5th finger.

An anomaly of trapezium.
The presence of a hernia in the abdominal wall.

Any abnormality of the skeletal muscle cell. Muscle fibers are subdivided into two types. Type I fibers are fatigue-resistant and rich in oxidative enzymes (they stain light with the myosin ATPase reaction), and type II fibers are fast-contracting, fatigue-prone, and rich in glycolytic enzymes (these fibers stain darkly). Normal muscle tissue has a random distribution of type I and type II fibers.
A reticulocyte abnormality.
An increase in the magnitude or amount of ossification of the skull.
A reduction in the magnitude or amount of ossification of the skull.
A reduction of bone mineral density, that is, of the amount of matter per cubic centimeter of bones.

Loss of strength in the arm, leg, and sometimes face on one side of the body. Hemiplegia refers to a severe or complete loss of strength, whereas hemiparesis refers to a relatively mild loss of strength.

An abnormality of the C-shaped rings of hyaline cartilage, normally 16 to 20 in number, that occupy the anterior two-thirds of the circumference of the trachea (the posterior portion of the ring is completed by fibrous and smooth muscle tissue).
An abnormal narrowing of the lumbar spinal canal.
An abnormality related to a defect of vertebral separation of cervical vertebrae during development.
Underdevelopment of the nasal bone.
Supraventricular tachycardia (SVT) is an abnormally increased heart rate (over 100 beats per minute at rest) with origin above the level of the ventricles.
Polyp-like protrusions which are histologically hamartomas located in the stomach.

JT: 急性前骨髄球性白血病
DEF: A type of acute myeloid leukemia in which abnormal promyelocytes predominate.
An intermittent (discontinuous) form of lactic acidemia.
An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall in the thoracic aorta.
Multiple exostoses originating in long bones.
The ability of the wrist joints to move beyond their normal range of motion.
Enlargement of the chamber of the right ventricle.
An abnormal dilatation of lymph vessels in the pericardium.
Interphalangeal joint stiffness is a perceived sensation of tightness in the interphalangeal joints when attempting to move them after a period of inactivity.

A type of gastritis characterized by excessive proliferation of the gastric mucosa and diffuse thickening of the gastric mucosal folds.

An abnormality of the structure of the veins that return deoxygenated blood from the body into the heart, i.e., the superior vena cava and the inferior vena cava.
Hypoplasia of the epiglottis.
Increased susceptibility to chicken pox, as manifested by recurrent episodes of chicken pox.
A severe form of B lymphocytopenia in which the count of B cells is very low or absent.

A transient reduction in the number of erythroblasts in the circulation.

Absence or underdevelopment of the femur.

A soft tissue continuity in the anteroposterior axis between the toes 2, 3, and 4.
A type of dysharmonic skeletal maturation in which there is a delay in skeletal maturation whose degree differs markedly in different bones.

An enchondroma is a benign growth of cartilage that develops within the medullary cavity of bone. Enchondromatosis refers to the presence of multiple enchondromas, and this term refers to the presence of multiple enchondromas within the medulla of metaphyseal bone. Radiographically an enchondroma presents a an oval, linear, or pyramidal osteolytic (radiolucent) lesion with well defined margins.
An abnormality of skeletal development characterized by a disturbance of the metaphysis and its histological structure with relatively normal epiphyses and vertebrae.
Aplasia or Hypoplasia affecting the metacarpal bones.

Hypersensitivity pneumonitis involves inhalation of an antigen. This leads to an exaggerated immune response and a following inflammation of the alveoli within the lungs. The main feature of chronic hypersensitivity pneumonitis on lung biopsies is expansion of the interstitium by lymphocytes accompanied by an occasional multinucleated giant cell or loose granuloma. After exposure to the provoking antigen, following symptoms can be seen: fever, chills, malaise, cough, hemoptysis, chest tightness, dyspnea, rash, swelling and headache and can be completely reversible, based on the duration of the illness, categorized as acute (HP:0011009), subacute (HP:0011011), and chronic (HP:0011010).
Prematurely closed sternal sutures.
A larger than usual distance between the left and right nipple.
An abnormality of filling of a ventricle with blood during diastole.
A form of acute leukemia characterized by excess lympoblasts.
The presence of an follicular adenocarcinoma of the thyroid gland.
A kind of thyroid adenoma characterized by the presence of oxyphil cells.
